text: Intensely sweet Tripel, bright and boozy with an everlasting head and a nose worthy of the gods. But Im not digging the taste this time around; maybe this is the freshest bottle of La Fin du Monde Ive ever drank, but it seems exceptionally harsh, the alcohol very present and the candi sugars going overboard on my palate. Starts with a even-keeled wheaty Tripel flourish, grassy and yeasty with banana-clove sweetness underlined by doughy bread, yet the sugars keep piling on, adding up, overwhelming the beer until it reaches a cloy, unpleasant finish. The ABV smacks you with every dollop of its 9% ABV, offsetting the otherwise nice sparkly Belgian texture. Needs age. I guess. Not my favorite Tripel, regardless.
Cork bottle: pours a light clear golden color with medium creamy head. Aroma/taste: Belgian yeast, apricots, tangerines, mild citrus and oak. Medium carbonation with smooth finish.

750ml corked bottle opened with loud pop bought at Q-Club in SoHo, Central.
Looks: Translucent golden orange colour  with a thin layer of dirt-like yeast sediments; One and a quarter finger head with crumpety white foam which last for 3 minutes; Very good sticky lacing and fizzy slight carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and sweet full Pils malt, with very strong orange and marmalades, honey, floral, sugar, strong phenolics, strong cloves, spices, thick bread, yeast, lemon peels and grass. Very jammy!

Taste: Mid to strong sweet full malt, with strong orange and marmalades, light candied fruits, floral, sugar, light alcohol, strong spices, bread, Bel yeast, lemon, mid to strong bitter hops and fair grass.

Body: Full body. Very slick and smooth palate.

Mouth Feel: Rich maltyness in a wholesome and fairly creamy background, not too heavy and well attenuated. Strong jammy orange and marmalade throughout, matched by equally strong but pleasant sweetness. Slightly flowery with notable spicyness. Bready yeasty with lemon to round. Very nice!

Alcohol: the 9% booze is well hidden and not screaming, tasty with not much knock-on if you don guzzle it. Good!

Hoppiness: Honey, floral, spices, lemon peels and grass in nose. Floral, strong spices, lemon and fair grass in taste; Bitterness is fairly strong for an abrupt, mid to high astringent sweet-bitter malty finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Orangey sweet and fairly bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one has a different approach for a tripel - the yeast is pretty artistic for that strong orange and marmalade aroma and taste, plus strong spice, nice sweetness, fairly lean body with tasty light booze. Stand tall with top Belgian Tripels, I like this a lot!

341ml bottled from Montreal. Pours a cloudy pale gold color, with a foamy rich long lasting head. Fruity notes, spices, sweet, smooth texture goes down nice, not too hoppy. This is pretty good, but at 9% Id have max 2 or 3 in a sitting.
Cloudy, pale gold. Minimal head. Spiced floral scent. Taste is sweet but spices add complexity. Comparable if not better than New Belgium's trippel.

One of the thickest, long-lasting white heads Ive seen in any beer. Very puffy and foamy. Smell is a very pleasant fruity mix, though taste not so much. Not bitter, which is good for me, but not at all sweet either. The 9%ABV, though not overpowering, is very evident in the taste. I wish it would have been hidden better. Overall, I liked it OK, but it wasnt worth what I paid for it. I probably wont seek it out again,

From old tasting notes. Cloudy pale gold color. Fine bubbles lead to a rich creamy white head. Rich fruity malt nose is reminiscent of honey and wheat. Tart bittersweet malt flavor has an obvious alcohol prescence. Very Begian like, reminiscent of Duvel, only sweeter.

Pours a hazy amber with a decent white head. There are aromas of lemon and musty yeast. The taste is slightly sweet with a mildly tart, dry finish. There are notes of lemon, vanilla, pepper, raisins, and warm alcohol. Surprisingly light bodied with moderate carbonation. Tastes like a tripel but it doesnt feel like it. Regardless, its a tasty beer.
I think this beer is very tasty, but find it a bit too wheaty and too seasoned to be a true tripel. Typically golden in color and nice head. Very fuity aromatics.
Glad to have tried this classic beer. An excellent triple, lack a bit of smoothness to get the extra points.

Bottle from West Side. Pours a clear gold with a full 2 fingers of soapy foam that lingers. Lemon yogurt, coriander, lemongrass and bready pils-malt nose. Honey and coriander on the palate. Sweet with a bit of tart. Great tripel.

Pours hazy pale amber with a 1 1/2 finger white head. Fruity aroma with a bit of yeast. Maybe some caramel too. Medium body, a touch syrupy. Dry finish. Fruit flavors over notes of nutty malt and earthy yeast.

From Saveur-Biere. In La Trappe chalice. Watching Los Soprano 6x02. Had great expectations and didnt dissapoint. Perfect tripel. All typical notes of the style perfectly assembled. Superb aroma. Found myself enjoying it just by its aroma. Abv very well hidden. Left me wanting more

Chilled inside a cooler kept outside (w/some snow packed in it) and poured a 12 ounce bottle into a cleaned and clear glass 16 ounce tumbler.
Complex aroma. Complex taste. Complex palate. Overall:
OUI! Beer salad; a wine, of a sort, maybe?

Single 12floz bottle ($2.50), BBD 09.16.2019. Its been a while since I last had this beer. I remember it being better, but this may be due in part to a changing palate and increased variety of beers available. Pours with a voluminous head and a hazy golden body. Smells like a sweaty sock and hay - it is a Belgian style ale. Coriander, lemon zest, and black pepper flavors come out from this full and well-carbonated ale. Alcohol makes its presence known in the follow through. By the end of consumption, my feelings improved to appreciate it stylistically appropriate and pretty decent all in all.
light malty, belgian aromas. gold and slightly hazy in color with massive long lasting head. taste is malty with light notes of plum, raisin, cherry, and caramel

Bottle. Pours light copper with off-white head and lacing. Fruity yeast aroma. Light bready malt with some banana and other tropical fruit notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quite balanced, bit artificial nuances of fruits like banana, rice and rye. Medium taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with wheaty flavors. Overall, way too artificial and simple.

pours a mildly cloudy straw gold with a medium fluffy white head that quickly dissipates. Tons of carbonation. Strong banana and clove aroma. Lively sweetish taste that follows the nose. Some alcohol warmth on the finish. This is normally not a favorite style of mine, but this one is quite good!

Aroma: biscuit, banana, apricot ; Appearance: blonde, white medium head ; Taste : medium sweetness, no bitterness ; Palate: medium+ body, moderately long lasting finish. A good abbey trippel. A classic.

Bottled. Best by 05/2019. Pours hazy dark yellow, huge Belgian style white head. Aroma is clove, esters, wheat, lemon, Belgian spice. Flavor is banana, clove, peppercorn, little tart brett-like note, Belgian spices, esters. Its fine. It doesnt blow my mind, but its fine. Seems a little overcarbed.

Appearance: Pours a very hazy and golden body. Color resembles a pear. Fairly average head that recedes quite quickly and no much lacing to speak of. Not too nice, i was expecting more.

Smell: Much better here. Getting a nice heady aroma of cloves, yeast, banana and dough. Am i drinking a hefe? Regardless, very pleasing indeed.

Taste: Quite discreet at first. I get some herbs and some fruit thats more dry than sweet but never obtrusive. Some citrus action in there also. Opens up more as it warms but its still a low-key affair.

Mouthfeel: Carbonation hinders it a bit but it still feels rather good anyways. It subsides a little as it warms. Very full-bodied and light at the same time if thats possible

Not the best tripel I have tested, but easily the best for the money. I can get a 750ML bottle of this at my local Costco for $6.99, which is just a tremendous bargain. 

It is a little sweet but it hides its 9% alcohol well and pours a hazy, golden color. Yes, I think Duvel and certain other Belgian brands are better, but this Canadian rendition (not calling it a knockoff) is fine in its own right. Highly recommended.
Pint night at Pazzos. Aroma was yeast with some malt notes. Taste was slightly sweet.
Golden yellow color. Has nice fruity aromas. Really taste the spice and cloves along with the yeast. This is a very nice brew

We are obsessed with this beer because it is the best. The aroma is fresh and fruity, like a crisp spring day. Its a beautiful golden color with a white foamy head, like sunshine with a few light clouds. It tastes like baby angels were singing to the monks that were brewing this beer, and they were so distracted that they accidentally combined their standard brew with oranges, honey, and crack cocaine. Very drinkable and enjoyable and the best, duh.

Bouteille de 341 ml. Couleur blonde avec un joli col. Arôme de malt, de céréales et de fruits. Le goût est celui des céréales, des oranges, des poires et des fruits tropicaux avec un léger goût dalcool. Bien quel soit de 9% ABV, elle nest pas difficile à boire.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Always enjoy trying a new Belgian-style. I bought this in a 750 ml bottle at HEB. Personal experience, be cautious removing the cork. Poured into a Belgian glass, appropriately. It had a yellow-blonde body with a superb whitish top. Great carbonation, very active. I get a whiff of spices and fruit. The taste improves on that. There is cloves, cinnamon, a black plum sweetness. Mature but not as complex as others. Pretty fine.

Pale amber and cloudy if you pour it that way. Immediately transports you to the Low Countries. Excellent faux Belgian tripel with the fruitiness one expects from such beers. Not much evidence of hops but that goes with the territory. Great once-in-a-while beer.

12-ounce bottle pours bright golden, slightly hazy, much carbonation, huge three-finger white head that sticks around for several minutes with some lacing. Aroma is hard to pinpoint, but I detect lemon, orange and yeast. Flavor is of banana, clove, whole wheat bread. Perfect mouthfeel for a triple, balanced and drinkable. For a brew with 9 percent alcohol, this is unbelievably easy to drink -- dangerously so. La Fin du Monde translates to "the end of the world." If this is whats waiting for me to drink when the world ends -- with an open tab and unlimited supply, of course -- then doomsday may not be that bad after all.

Thick haze filled golden color, white head. Aroma its malty biscuit, banana, light citrus. Taste follows aroma with banana, biscuit, juicy light citrus, clove and pepper. Creamy medium body. Very enjoyable.

A 750ml corked and caged bottle with a best before date of 24th July 2017. Poured into a Chimay goblet glass. It poured a hazy golden orange colour with a one finger white head that settled to a nice creamy layer and left nice curtain lacing. Aromas of juicy orange and mango, biscuity malt with touches of honey and banana. Tastes biscuity, banana, honey and orange with a hint of peach. Clove and light peppery spice on the finish. Creamy, medium bodied with moderate to low carbonation. Overall the citrusy orange was just coming on a bit too strong at times for me. Other than that, it was nice.

Dorée claire voilée, nez fruité, corps un peu pesant mais lalcool nest pas trop dominant, sucre doux pour une finale un peu sirupeuse. Assez singulière et goûteuse. Bouteille 34.1cl achetée sur un stand québécois dun marché de Noël, France, bue le 07/01/2017.

I have tasted this beer many times before, but just discovered I have not reviewed it here, so this is a great opportunity to do so. Poured into my Duvel chalice, amazing foam that just doesnt quit, aromas of malt and yeast are upfront. First taste is easy, low carbonation makes it incredibly easy to drink. Orange peel, buttered toast, and passion fruit are there. This is an amazing beer, a must to always have. Like a Duvel, but 1% better.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2017 Bottle from Tami for Xmas. Haven?t had one of these in quite some time, and apparently I?ve not rated it until now. Cloudy pale yellow with pillowy white head. Strong aroma of lemon and straw, with the characteristic Unibroue yeast smell. Sweet ale with flavours of lemon, straw, faint ginger. This used to be one of my favourite beers, and it holds up well to my memory of it.

Bière blonde de 9 % dalcool. Elle possède un col mousseux laiteux au versement. Elle possède un odorat amer, comme également de sarrasin. Elle possède un bon goût de houblon, doux en bouche, léger fond dalcool, avec une finale épicé. Elle possède également une finale métallique, mais sans trop. Enivrante, très bonne !
cloudy deep rich orange color. Rich sweet fruit taste with a tad bit of ginger or clove coming through. The 9% abv is undetectable. Tasty brew if you like sweet Belgian ales

Pale color with a really sweet taste.
Foamy head but dissolves fast.
Its no mines
This beer is awesome dont have to qualify my ratings with why I love it, just do.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2016 Sampled from a bottle at Millers Pub in Chicago. Pours a hazy yellow/amber with a foaming white head. Quite fruity - notes of bubble gum, cloves and banana. A little creamy and heavy for this style of beer. Not much bitterness. Rather lacking in charm, and not a great example of a tripel.

Bière découverte au stand québécois du marché de noël de Liège. Il sagit dune très bonne bière passant très bien en bouche et ayant des arômes très bien dosés. Dhabitude, je ne suis pas très bière triple mais là je suis comblé !
Flaska på Thunder Bay Grill Pewaukee. Ljust orangegul med vitt skum. Toner av citrus och jäst. Rejäl smak med lite banan och koriander.

This stuff is as bad as I remember it! Havent tried a bottle in many years, but it still sucks mass. So overrated it makes me wonder what we are doing here on ratebeer. Stuff is so thin, doesnt hold anything--it just evaporates. Not happy with ratebeertarians on this one. They know it sucks mass but rate it well on reputation alone. Im in that mood right now, sorry. Guns blazing! No passes for any beer!

Bottle thanks to Eric.

A: Semi clear gold, thin white head.

N: Esters, peppercorn, honey, and agave. Toasted biscuit. Some pineapple and grapefruit. Lemon zest. Green apple and pear.

T: Quite sweet and plenty of spice to ward off the cloying.

M: Medium body, spritzy carbonation, no alcohol.

O: This is so good. The best North American rendition of a Tripel.
Literally the beSt beer you will ever ingest! As an added bonus, its 9%abv

A big active white head on an orange/straw body. The nose leads with citrus and bready malt, with a hint of grapes and nose tingling effervescence. A well blended, well crafted Tripel. Banana esters, lemon, orange, cloves and candied fruit are well blended lead elements. Green apples, grapes, a touch of honey, and bready sweet malt round out a beautiful blend. Fine and explosive effervescence adds to the taste experience, as with great Belgian beers.

backlog, Bottle shared with Pat, Pours a hazy orange gold with a medium to large head. Aroma is malt, grape skins, clove, and banana. Flavor was most of the same with dark malt, fruit yeast, and some random spices. This is always a solid choice for a belgian inspired beer.

Bottle; pours cloudy gold with a white head; aroma of yeast, fruits, spices, and caramel hints; taste is sweet with caramel, bread, fruits, and hints of vanilla; finish is slightly wet with some spice

Hazy orangey yellow, keeps a nice head. Mild stone fruit aroma, moderately carbonated. Banana ester flavors with a yeasty, slightly sharp and bitter finish. A classic tripel, always a pleasure to drink.
Killed rating?!? First bottle picked up in some local Carrefour shop in France when on holiday at Cote dAzur. Lovely sweet Belgien yeastiness, warming feeling, great beer.

Beautiful looking beer.... opaque liquid gold, thin creamy head that sticks around. Aroma is yeasty and fruity, but not especially big - caramel, grape, touch of apricot. Caramel, grape, peach/apricot flavours, noticeable floral hop in the background, some nutmeg. A bit of a sourdough bread character to lend it some body. Flavour is complex, but not strong enough to conceal the booze. Might not be the #1 Unibroue offering, but its certainly one of their better beers.

Bread, citrus, yeast in the nose. Pours a thick creamy head that settles into a thin ring. Hazy dark orange in colour with spotty lacing. Citrus, Carmel, spice, wheat, booze. Palate is thick, creamy and it coats the mouth. Overall- A good tripel. One of the first craft beers I ever had, years ago. It helped change what I thought beer could be. So it has a special place in my heart. That being said I often get a metallic note at first, which eventually fades but that has an impact on my flavour rating.

F: average, white, normal lasting.
C: golden, hazy.
A: malty, spicy, yeasty, banana, peach, perfumed, floral, hint of orange.
T: malty, yeasty, banana, peach, candy, orange, quite sweet but very good balanced and creamy mouthfeel, tasty, worth to try, 341ml bottle from Eat Brussels 2016 festival.
Pours hazy gold with a white head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is sweet malts, bread and fruit. Taste is sweet and the abv is evident. Good beer.

341ml bottle. Typically candy sweet, but less so than others. More spices and marshmallows. Floral, with green apples and some overly ripe ones. Medium to heavy body over a lively carbonation. Noticeable booze with a texture that reminds more of a cider than a triple. Sticky sweet palate.

Look: cloudy orange, unstable white head.

Aroma: ripe apricotes, white pepper, cloves, apricote home-made brandy.
Taste: dry with prominent spicy bitterness.
Flavour: rotten fruits, minty and peppery notes.

Good.

Mildly yeasty with a complex palate of malt, fruit and spice notes followed by a smooth, dry finish.

Floral and honey smell. 

Medium body with white creamy head.

Floral, grass, hay, bread, fruity yeast character, ABV well integrated.
Hazy golden colour, medium white head, good amount of lacing.
Heavy sweetness, medium bite, ABV evident, floral and grainy character with a hint of corn.
Fullbodied, fizzy carbonation, sweet and warming finish.
Solid.
Hazy and bright golden. Beautiful. Dense and creamy head. Moderately boozy. Herbal aroma. Belgium would be proud.
Smell is sweet and smooth Taste is sweet and high in alcohol...finishes like a cider...with a bit of a lipsmacking finish like a wheat beer...@ old Chicago

Je ne suis habituellement pas un amateur de la levure Unibroue et je préfère les belges brunes que blondes. Pourtant, celle-ci est ma préférée de cette brasserie. Les oranges, la pêche, les épices, le malt mielleux, très bel équilibre. Il faut faire attention par contre, cest un 9% qui ne paraît aucunement!
Aroma of fresh baked bread, orange zest, clove, and vanilla appears as it warms. Taste is fresh baked bread, orange zest, cloves, and a faint vanilla. After taste of vanilla, clove, and citrus.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orangish color. Aroma and taste are wheat, citrus, and some spices.

Smells of breads sweet malts and dark fruits like cherry and plum. Super cloudy orangeyellow color with two finger white head that dissipates fairly quickly some lacing. Taste of sweet malts cherry flavor and bready flavor sweet smooth wet finish. Medium body with toasty crisp carbonation that give me the burps. All in all this brew is very tasty and complex Ive been putting this beer off for years but glad I wanted to my palate to mature because I really enjoy this beer now. Nice brew!

Pours hazy light orange. Aroma is yeasty, fruity, apple, white fruit, banana, licorice, maybe figs. Taste is more funky, darker, a bit of honeyed sweetness, a bit of hops. Well carbonated medium thick and smooth.
Pours a cloudy golden with a mild yeast aroma, very mild lemon taste with evident carbonation & a very smooth, heavenly finish. Thank You.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle into a tall tulip glass. Very cloudy, gold in color with a huge, pillowy, white head. As the head recedes it leaves a very light lacing on the glass. The nose is yeasty with a hint of spice and banana. Medium sweet, malty and soft. Pleasantly long finish.

Meget frugtagtig øl. Den smager ikke så sprittet som mange øl på 9% ofte gør, og den fylder godt i min mund.

"La fin du monde", eller "anus mondi" på latin, betyder verdens ende. Underligt navn, men hvis det er den øl man får serveret der, er det vel ikke så ringe. Hvor ligger det så?, tjo... stedet findes i hvert fald på Als

Nez: Malté, banane
Bouche: Maltée, banane, citron, poire, épicée, sucrée
Une Triple bien faite

Pour is a dark orange, hazy and thick like honey. Tiny sparkling qualities to it. Smell is a tad nutty, cut grass, citrus and a thick malt. Taste is similar, barely any citrus, nice nutty balance against a lingering bitterness that balances against yeast

At Milanos in a snifter. A classic triple. Pours murky golden with a small head. Wheaty sweet with a creamy mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

bottle at home from beers of the world genevaquite orangey gold with dense off-white head collapsing to lacing. Very warming, lots of weizen like clovey esters and a touch of banana, full bodied, spritzy carbonation warming alcohol, reminds more of a weizenbock, quite sweet and fruity. V enjoyable, bit of alcohol burn - triple fermentation does not make it a tripel but certainly Belgianesque
Pours beautifully creates an awesome head. Color is honey yellow and tastes great.
Bttle. Opaque et blanche. Belle brume avec un léger col. Goût caramel. Note finale sucrée.

Tap at beerbistro in Toronto. Translucent murky goldenish yellow with rather nice off-white head. The nose is yeasty, wheaty-grainy, sweet, caramelly fresh. Tastes similarily, pretty sweet, caramelly and fruity. Thin crisp carbonation and medium body, somewhat dryish finish. Clean and well made but I cant really see this as a top 50 Tripel... Then again, most of the few top 50 Ive had Ive rated well below their average so I guess Im just not a big Tripel fan.

For a rather unattractive pout this is a clean tasting tripel! The pour is cloudy so I expected a muddy taste...wrong! clean and crisp! High ABV is not detectable by taste...smooth enjoyable and I will drink it again.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Gorgeous dusty gold, moderate foam. A hint of metal under a rich scent of peaches and cream, dried fruit, bread and banana. Peppery banana taste and intense juiciness. Creamy citrus notes. Utterly delicious and deceptively high in alcohol. This is my go to, amazingly affordable and a classic tripel. I love trying new ones but always come back.

Bouteille de 341ml. Dégustée le 31 janvier 2015. Bière blonde dorée voilée. Très effervescente, bulles moyennes. Mousse assez, col blanc moyen persistant (se régénère constamment). Odeur de levure et dépices. Saveur épicée en amorce, avec alcool qui ressort juste un peu, puis de fruits secs (figues/dates) ensuite. Assez costaude mais pas trop lourde, se boit bien malgré le taux dalcool élevé.

A strongly hazy, light yellow, a head is big and almost white. Aroma has fruitness of lemon, some spicyness and bananas, balanced. Taste has fruitness, bananas and some lemon, low spicyness, hint of alcohol thats not bothering. Medium bodied, strong carbonation, fresh. Balanced and tasteful Tripel.

Slightly hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma has the typical belgian yeast esters with flowers, hay, green meadow and other rustic notes. Taste starts with banana and bubblegum, also floral notes, hay and other yeast esters. Leans a bit on the sweet side but the finish is really balanced. Body is quite heavy and smooth with medium carbonation. Really classic and well made. The only downside for me is the slight alcohol presence.

Aroma bread, cereal, banana, clove, 
Appearance golden, hazy, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, 
Palate medium body, fizzy, lively, 
Overall a nice lively beer on the tongue that is very refreshing. I would suggest this beer to a friend.
Rating datant du 28 décembre 2015. La Tripel par excellence au Québec depuis plus de 20 ans, Son nez reconnaissable parmi mille et son goût malté raffiné demeure un classique.
330ml bottle hazy gold & frothy smells of yeast faintly fruity tastes superb yeasty malty fruity citrus banana cloves spicy flavours all come through enjoyed

0.341 bottle. Cloudy, gold color and a medium, white head. Aroma of spices, and citruses - quite usual for a tripel. Taste is sweet and sour, spicy, tasty, very usual. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is medium long and resemblant of the main taste. Overall a good and drinkable beer.

Pours bronze with a thick white head that leaves lacing and a thin covering head. As with the Unibroue beers, carbonation is fine bubbles and continuous. Nose is bananas spice. Taste is bananas and spice as well. No bitterness. T 12 oz bottle with no BBY date.

Originally rated on 7/23/08. A very hazy golden body, a thick off white cap fueled by continuous carbonation stayed until the end. Rather complex it has hints of cloves, banana, fruits, and other spices, producing a slightly spicey-sweet flavor. A hearty beer that finishes nicely
Wonderful high alcohol beer, white foamy head, a great Belgian style beer
On tap at Old Town Pour House. Slight cloudiness. A bit more bite at the beginning than I expected. Slight fruitiness.

Good beer with very typical nose, taste, and body of the style....not the best triple but an excellent representation at an amazing price point. This is as good, if not better than Russian Rivers Damnation at about half the cost.

Tripelről talán festeni sem lehetne szebbet, olyan küllemmel van megáldva a kanadai főzet; szalmasárga, opálos teste hófehér, krémes és sietős habot gerjeszt. A gabonás jelleg az illatában is továbbél - könnyed, világos hangulatú maláta képe búzasörös, sziporkázó élesztős, némi banános-korianderes karakterrel megfestve. Tartalmas kortyait szinte harapni lehet, folyékony kenyérként simulnak szét az ízjegyek nyelvünk terepén, cseppnyi fűszeresség, élesztős fanyarság és némi alkoholos csípősség vibrálása élénkíti meg a nyugodt folyású főzet szerkezetét.

Perfect balance with a nice, subtle hint of lemon in the finish. A favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a very cloudy orangey-yellow and is over carbonated in my opinion. The alcohol content provides a nice warmth that complements their belgian yeast strain. Overall a good beer, but I think overrated on here.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy orange/straw color with a big, white, soapy head. Leaves a nice lacing. Smells of bread, yeast, a bit of spice, and lemon zest? (Not very lemony, but a hint. Lively carbonation. Spiciness to the yeast and malt. Slightly sweet. Clean finish (Edit: after it warms a bit, it is a bit sticky in mouth). Pretty good tripel.

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours a hazy orange color with a huge white head and very good lacing. The aroma is orange, spice, and Belgian yeast. The taste is fresh orange, pepper, other spices, and Belgian yeast. I think the sweetness level is just right. Theres a nice dry carbonation to it. I liked this beer a lot. This brewery has impressed me lately.

Pours nice honey yellow, fine fluffy white head, good lacing. Nose is relatively subdued, apricot, warm spice, peach, booze. Pretty sweet at first, but fine champagne bubbles and a dry finish prevent it from being too much. A treat, and I think the first tripel I ever had (about 15 years ago).

My judgement might be clouded by the fact that Im sitting on my balcony in Tegus watching a beautiful sunset, observing the hummingbirds and parakeets in the trees of my neighbours garden while eating danish blue cheese, but this beer is quite good to me. Its heavy sweetness and 9% alcohol goes perfect with the creamy and sharp cheese. It has the classic caracteristics of an Abbey Triple and is well crafted. I would probably buy it again although the price ($4,5) is a bit steep for my Honduran salary.

Bomber into a tulip. Pours a hazy orange/yellow, with a huge white heat that slowly fades. Lees from the bottle fermentation remain. Good lacing. Nose is malt and esters, with some fruity and sugary notes. Taste is exceptional-just as a tripel should taste. A little on the sweet side, probably due to the kandi sugar. Outstanding.

Aroma of lemongrass, and a bit of earthiness in the yeast. Pours like any blonde of report. The sweet flavor is nearly apple, nearly sweet like champagne. A fine experience on the mouth, heavy carbonation and a mildly viscous presence. Good, opened solo to celebrate a new chapter in life.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2016 Bottle, BB 10.09.18.
Honey-orange, a bit lighter than St.B T, glowing yellow hue. Big frothy white head, sits well with tons of co2 bubbles rushing up from the bottom center of tulip.
Shrimp, malty sweetness, unique syrupy texture (similar in a lot of Unibroue). Ivory, herbal, low hops, but noticeable. Green-like (apple) finish with a hint of herbal hops. Lighter finish than ST. B. More bready malt is present as it warms. Smooth body for abv, no booze. 01/22/16

01/25/16
BB 10.13.18.
A bit of baby diaper, delicious, but different than 750ml from a couple nights ago. Compared to NC Le Merle, more dry in finish. Has a lighter body.

I heard a lot about this beer and how great it is. A must have. Anyway, all worked up about tasting it for the first time at a bar, paying top dollar, only to taste a beer similar to Blue Moon. What a disappointment!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The aroma is a soft lemon and bread. Dark hazy yellow body with a snow cap white head that lingers quite awhile. The taste follows the aroma with the lemon and bread. Mild bitterness. Has a gentle warming sensation. Bold tartness in the middle. Clean refreshing finish.

Appearance: clear pale gold with one fat finger of fluffy off-white head, short retention and minimal lacing. (3/5) Aroma: slight citrus, banana, malt, candi sugar, stone fruit, and yeast. (9/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, mild bitter, moderate spiciness. (8/10) Palate: medium-light body, lively to moderate carbonation, medium duration slightly boozy finish. (5/5)

Pretty consistent with the prior vintages Ive tried. Solid Belgian character, light mouth feel for a high ABV. I still find it just slightly too sweet, but its an otherwise solid performer. (17/20)

Bouteille de 341ml. Lorsque versée, elle démontre un très forte effervescence, des bulles serrées, et la mousse nous quitte rapidement. On y sent des fruits(agrumes et pommes), du pain(levure), des épices et un peu de houblon. Très pétillante en bouche, les fruits dominent, sans être trop sucrés, ainsi que le goût de levure et une finale toute en épices. Elle est ronde et chaleureuse, grâce à son 9%. Moins dans ma palette, mais on sent que cest une bière de qualité.

Pours hazy blonde with a fine white head. Nose is fruity esters and coriander. flavor is a somewhat biting mixture of hops, fruit, spicing, and Belgian candy. none of it is overpowering however. Finish is long and somewhat dry. Alcohol is present but does not detract. good beer.

An exceptional beer. Had this New Years Eve 2009. From what I remember it was fruity. There was sediment in the bottom of the bottle that went into my glass.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Foggy/cloudy appearance. Light white head. Bubble gum arouma. Citrusy flavor. Bitter.

Bottle from Safeway in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is yeasty, fruity. Taste is sweet, yeasty / fruity. Compared with Westmalle Tripel...goes a little sweeter, not as bitter-balanced, but very lovely / drinkable for 9%.

I got this on the Oasis of the Seas at the Globe and Atlas Pub. It pours a amber color, with some haze and a moderate white head. Aromas are floral hops, earthly elements, spices, lemon, coriander, and hints of banana. It has tastes that feature fruity esters, earthly yeasts, spicing, lemon, and floral hops. It has a bitter dry finish with alcohol warming.
Had this beer at a bar in Paris in 2002 and Ive been in love ever since. Pours a golden hazy color that almost glows. A drink that is smooth and full of flavor.
Pours hazy golden amber with low white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, herbs, grass and hay. Taste is sweet, smooth, fruity and yeasty. Lightly citrusy finish. Medium, smooth body with soft carbonation.

Eye: pours a murky bronze color with a medium thick but rather quickly dissipating white head and medium carbonation
Nose: sweet toffee yeast all over, caramel, honey and - might sound funny, cold meat loaf
Mouth: grapes, almost sherry (fino) like, tickling, sweet and yeasty
Palate: yeast again
OVerall: well balanced between sweetness and bitterness even a bit sour and
Its beautiful, all i can say really, fruit as hell and yeastie. a huge head. hoegaarden times 3. enough said.

Hazy , golden , sunny color . Huge , white head . Perfect looking beer! Belgian yeast, fruits, malt in aroma . Some sweetness in taste , with light bitterness in the dry end . Incredibly easy to drink. Delicious tripel !!!

De couleur blond foncé elle est légèrement trouble avec une bonne effervescence une mousse épaisse
Au nez tout de suite c'est la cannelle qui vient puis des arômes de céréales et d'épices, de pomme cuite aussi
En bouche sont toujours ses serveurs très épicée pousser sur la cannelle et aussi peut-être sur les clous de girofle sont aussi une bonne amertume
Elle a beaucoup plus d'attaque en bouche que au nez
Très belle découverte d'une blonde trip québécoise parfumée

"Its the end of the world as we know it. And I feel fine." - REM. I must concur with Michael Stipes lyric. If this were the beer that I had at hand during a looming rapture, I could do worse. Much worse. At the pour, La Fin du Monde is golden and effervescent. Aroma propels champagne-like esters of fruit, candy-like malt, bread, and spices. Flavor carries it all through. While many Tripels embrace a grassy hop profile, La Fin du Monde takes a maltier approach. Mouthfeel is lively (almost spritzy) and sweet. After a bomber of this to myself, I feel fine indeed.

Perhaps the best looking beer Ive seen, this pours a cloudy gold with an everlasting half-finger of dense, clingy white perfection on top. Wow. Aromas are many with yeasty esters, banana, sweet light malt, and apples. Flavors are completely different - a semisweet fruitiness thats fantastically malty. This is delicious. Uh oh.
Fantastica tripel bionda e spumeggiante. Profumata, floreale, mielosa, corposa, rotonda e con un finale bello amaro e roccioso. Malto a volontà e carattere fruttato non mancano!

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with an average sized white head and lively carbonation. Aroma is Belgian yeast, a lot of banana, clove, and spice notes. Spicy and fruity flavors. Medium bodied with a spicy finish. Quite good.
My wife told me I wouldnt like this beer, but I tried it anyway. She was right. Too fruity for my taste. Maybe a good summer beer.

Pours a hazy straw color with a white head. Aromas of malt and some earthyness. Very nice depth of flavor. Very complex but everything works together to get a solid brew. Light to moderate palate. No alcohol burn.
This was a solid brew...crazy head on this one...shared with pluggy,the crop duster and Brian...light barnyard funk...good stuff.

Robe dorée légèrement trouble, léger col de mousse blanc. Très faible effervescence. Arômes de poires, pomme et banane. Beaucoup de levures également, miel, clou de girofle, léger houblon citronné et alcool en arrière-plan. Nez soyeux, fruité et pas trop épicé. En bouche, encore beaucoup desters fruités: poire, orange, pomme et banane. Levures encore présentes ainsi que du clou de girofle. Léger sucre résiduel rapellant la cassonade et la muscade. Un peu plus alcoolisé par contre, chaque gorgée apporte une belle chaleur. Texture moyennement onctueuse, corps dune belle rondeur. Une des plus vieille tripel (ou la plus vieille?)au Québec et est encore un incontournable.

341ml bottle from a coop in bern. pours a hazy pale orange with a small white head and some lacing. aroma of belgian yeast, pineapple, spices. citrusy flavour, spices, caramel, honey, cloves. strong carbonation. very little hop bitterness. alcohol is very well hidden.

Bottle from 6 pack sampler at the LCBO. Pours tangerine with a massive white cap on top. My first impression is cotton candy champagne. Deeper sips bring ripe orange, maple syrup, herbs, yeast, spices. Fantastic brew to enjoy after a long day at the education factory. The 9% will come in handy.

Bottle in Los Angeles. Bottle conditioned. Pours pale straw, bubbly white head. Fruity Belgian yeast ester aroma (Westmalle yeast?). Mild sweetness, fruity tripel flavour, mildly bitter dry finish. I personally prefer such mildly bitter tripel over more bitter examples (Chimay white, Allagash). Carbonation could be higher but its a weak bottle! A well done tripel and great availability and price.
Fizzy, yeasty, dry brew thats the color of pineapple juice. Faint whiffs of fruitiness. Light to medium-bodied. Seems close to something great, but never quite comes together in the end.

Very strong yeast aroma, with a notable banana odor.
Cloudy with a deep golden color and a weak head. 
The taste is very complex and truly delicious. The hop character is almost nonexistent with just the faintest initial tinge of citrus leaving the slightly sweet malt profile to shine through with a smooth thick almost biscuit-like taste. Lively carbonation accents the silky smooth creamy palate. The finish is buttery, with a note of nuttiness. 
Overall, this is one of my absolute favorite beers that is just enjoyable on the last sip as it is at the first. Cannot recommend enough.

Shared 750 ml. bottle. Pale golden, cloudy, large fizzy head. Smells of malt, yeast, and some spice. Tastes malt, yeast, hints of fruit and spice. Lots of carbonation. Somewhat similar to a wheat beer.

Aroma: wheaty, faintly skunky
Color: amber, pillowy head, little lacing
Taste: wheaty, slightly spicy
Palate: creamy, some follow through but turned astringent
Overall: Decent wheat beer, but did not meet expectations

"The end of the world"

Pure gold color, almost cloudy. The elegant white head dies fast. Weak legs and no visible activity.

Sweet and nicely strong floral aromas with grain and spices. Pleasant smell of malty caramel. A very sweet smell compared to the bitter taste.

Perfectly fresh yet powerful taste of bitter spices. Great taste of malty fruity citrus, almost resinous. A strange feeling of caramel that is probably maple sirup.
Its a warming and delicious feeling. A slick medium body with a drying end and a champagne like effect.

La Fin du Monde is "Quebecs pure gold", probably a reference to its secret ingredient = Maple sirup = Quebecs "gold". This is just a theory and an opinion from someone who eat Maple sirup every weeks of the year. One of my favorite tripel being extremely well crafted, balanced, exquisite taste and freshness; this is the only beer youll ever need living through the end of the world!

Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Robe dambre doré, elle se monte un épais col de mousse blanche qui descend rapidement pour se maintenir à 1/4 de pouce en laissant très peu de dentelles. Elle pop en décapsulant la bouteille tellement elle est effevescente. Puissant arôme de levure sur une note citronée, typique des belges. Au goût cest pareil, levure, agrumes et des notes dépices; le 9% dalcool est quasi indétectable. Une bière correcte, mais qui manque un peu de caractère.

トリペル   
華やかなバナ&

Served on tap at Whiskey Tango Foxtrot. Hazy orange color with a white head. Orange citrus grain aroma. Citrus Belgium witbier citrus flavor. Smooth but a little too bland.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured at home in a snifter. The yellow-gold was a big haze with ample head and lacing. Aroma is orange and lemon zest with some spices and cereal. Taste is similar with the fruits moving towards grains at the finish. Slight citrus and tart finish. Medium to light body, heavy carb. Overall pretty good.

Very refreshing, crisp tripel. Has a sweetness that fades quickly to a nice malty, wheat feel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a semi- cloudy yellow color. Citrus aroma mostly lemon zest. It is smooth and fairly thin in body. A little tart but not so much. The lemon feels thick like custard or lemon pudding. The smell reminds me of lemon dish soap. Its not that bad but not very good either.

Alluring Tripel aroma in a light golden pour. Superbly well balanced taste with all the complexity of the Belgians and a lot of the subtlety to match. As good as, if not better than, most of the style.

Bottle from Harvest Market, Bedford NH. Aroma is yeast (that flirts with going over the edge to the overfermented, vomitous side, but doesnt), a bit like Chardonnay or champagne, with mild fruity esters. Appearance is hazy yellow with mild sparkle and finger-width white fizzy head that dissipates fairly quickly. Lacing does not linger. Taste is balance of moderate fruity sweet and minimally sour. Palate is medium bodied with carbonation that is too lively--like drinking freshly poured ginger ale, with slight initial sting to the front of the tongue that detracts from the taste experience. Finish is dry and abrupt. Overall, a really good beer but not one without faults.

Bottle @ rattle n hum NYC. Giallo dorato con riflessi ambrati. Velata. schiuma bianca, fine non molto persistente. Aroma intenso, fruttato, esteri del lievito, pesca sciroppata, albicocca matura, un po di gomma, spezie (coriandolo in semi e cannella). gusto pieno, amabile lingresso, fruttato ed alcolico, poi note acidule, e finale amaro erbaceo senza eccessi. Retrogusto di zucchero candito e caramello. Carbonata, poco corposa,rotonda, piena. Equilibrata e di grande armonia.

Yields a completely hazed, sun-yellow color, with a small white head, leaving back a thick lacing.

Smells of an intriguing blend, featuring clove, cardamon, white pepper and slightly spiced dried fruit, especially lemon. 

Has a high, very lively carbonation, enabling the peppery and sweeter spices and a very soft, dough ending. Drinks best in small sips, as for its intense spice profile.

Dough yeast brings peppery spices immediately to the palate, balanced by wild honey and spring flowers. Rock sugar adds to the prominent spices, almost creating a short burn, evoked by the high carbonation and the higher alcohol, gently coated up by the soft yeast. Finishes with rock sugar, amping up the spices even more, bringing back a flowery note and well pronounced clove.

Well working, old school triple, featuring a very pronounced spiciness, which defines the beers taste throughout. Exhibits a fuller and very pleasant mouthfeel, with feathering yeast doing a great job in balancing the spice onslaught
Tons of pressure behind the cork followed by tons of white foam in the glass. Nice lace work as it collapses. Smooth Tripper with a nice yeasty flavor to it. Definitely a keeper for a cellar.

Sample pour from bottle. Pours a bright yellow, clear, fluffy white head to it. Aromas of fruit, yeast, spice. Flavor had banana, lemon, grass, sour funk. Pretty solid brew. Full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation with a dry finish. Not bad all.

Pours a hazy golden color, topped with a decent white frothy head, ok retention. Malty, yeasty aroma, some fruity notes and spices. Taste is similar, yeasty with some spices, alcohol can be noted, slight malty sweetness and mild bitterness. Not unpleasant, but not to my liking as well.
Rated based on notes taken 21 Dec 2012 -- Drank at the Flying Saucer in Houston. Pretty solid beer. I think this is my first craft beer I ever drank from Canada.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 12 oz bottle. Hazy yellow, orange with a short bubbly white head. Pretty beer, huge lacing. Aroma is thick with very ripe fruit, banana, spices. Beer is spicy with white pepper, clove, and coriander, just a little bitterness. Banana, citrus, apple cider, pears. Very good carbonation.  A long time favorite.
750ml bottle. Light hazy yellow golden color with white head. Yeasty aroma, fruity and spicy. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 12 oz bottle dated "best before" 7 Sept., 2012 (from notes). 

Pours with a white head. Plenty of sediment in the bottle, much of which remains despite a light swirl mid-pour, but some of which comes out at the end of the pour tainting (aesthetically) the center of the white head. Head has excellent duration but leaves little lacing. Liquid is a cloudy yellow-gold. 

Mainly fruity yeast and (apparent) spices in the aroma, with a touch of hops and hints of apples, bananas and pears. The taste is also quite yeasty-fruity, with hints of apples and apricots, and even some dark fruits. The high ABV is very well hidden in both the aroma (until it warms up) and the taste. Seems like there is more flavor in the finish than earlier on. Lightly tart. 

M: refined, champagne-like feel, although with more body. 

O: not my favorite style, but quite enjoyable nonetheless. I can easily see others giving this a very high rating. Flavorful and refreshing, but better as a slow sipper than as a session brew. Complex aroma and flavor.

Bottle pour into tulip. Hazy yellow with generous head. Quite carbonated. Initially tastes like any Belgian ale, but with a lot of complexities and subtleties to it; I get spiced apple, pear, banana, and peach out of it. Finishes with more spice and some sweetness. Quite good...and Im not normally a fan of trippels!

Big white head that drops quickly to a thin layer of tight bubbles. High carbonation. Nice lacing. Hazy straw. Spicy, lemon, slight banana aroma. Lemon, pear, caramelized apple flavour. Complex and layered. Full mouthfeel with a drying yet sweet aftertaste.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip today. I cant read the best by date. A: Orange, lemon, and banana. It smells like a hef with spices. A: 3 finger fluffy head with an easy pour. Cloudy orange body with bubbles streaming up. T: Orange, lemon zest, peach, and cloves dominate. Egg yolk and almost a cinnamon back end are subtle. P: Creamy smooth with a crisp finish. Thick mouthfeel. O: The flavors are so complex and well balanced that its hard to pick apart. Its on the sweet side, but balanced by spices on the finish. I hate tripels, but this is awesome.

Bottle from December, 2013 - Pours hazy golden body with somewhat orange hue. Massive white head, great retention. Initial aroma of fresh apples, spices, particularly cloves, and banana. Scents of yeast and raisins are layered throughout. Fruity flavors of pear and apple combined with herbaceous, doughy bread taste. Solid carbonation as evidenced by the relentless upward stream of bubbles and prickly mouthfeel. Dry, slightly bitter finish; however, there is an enduring, honey-sweet aftertaste. Alcohol definitely becomes more pronounced as it warms.

BBD 10/1/17. Pours a hazy gold with a touch of amber. World class head volume and retention, outstanding lacing.

 Classic tripel nose with a bit of clove and subtle sweet fruit notes.

Medium body with a bit of creaminess. Nicely carbonated with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a nice prickly rush in the finish.

The flavor profile is intense, somewhat complex and somewhat balanced. It begins with some fruit flavors that are quickly overcome by phenolic clove. Phenolic clove dominates from almost the start. The middle brings a bit of malt sweetness but never achieves balance. The somewhat dry finish has a medicinal clove characteristic that lingers. Alcohol also shows a bit of astringency as an aftertaste as it warms.

Draft. Glad to finally rate this after having it several times before. Nice straw/gold with a solid white head. Grainy with lots of fruit notes throughout, specifically a juicy pear and apricot thing happening. Very full body. I really enjoy this beer.

Have had this several times. Golden brew, with a large head. No taste of alcohol outside of the warming portion. Semi-sweet, a bit of spice, super well balanced. My personal favorite brew so far and it has been for a good while.

(bottle) very hazy golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of black pepper, pears and caramel, with a hint of peaches, some wax, honey and powdered sugar. flavour is heavy pineapple and bubble gum, rather sweet, with some more caramel, pale malts and honey. heavy-bodied with lively carbonation.

Aroma: clove, grass, alcohol, 
Appearance: clear golden, massive white head
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: medium body, sticky feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Awesome brew

330ml bottle. Appearance: Cloudy pale golden with a frothy white foam cap. 
Aroma: Strong clove phenols dominate over fruity esters of banana and pineapple. 
Taste: Sweet rich maltiness and banana esters up front. Strong clove phenols. Typical pear esters appear on the swallow. 
Motuthfeel: Medium body with some creaminess and moderately high carbonation. Not as carbonated as some other tripels, but also avoids alcohol heat. 
Finish: Clove spice on the swallow, but banana and pear esters longer long after. 
Overall: Aroma is good but maybe not as strong as some other world class tripels. Really well balanced flavor profile
Alcoholic and spicy notes, with a hint of cereal. Golden in the glass with a rich head. No distinguishable hops, instead, harmonious overall impression. Perfectly carbonated.

Pours a beautiful golden color with a bubbly white head. Amazing how the aroma spreads in the air when opened! Almost champagne like carbonation with notes of pear and grass. Very refreshing and deceptively strong.

Has it really been 20 years since I first drank this, when it was new? Seems it is. Deep golden amber body, crowned with an active white head.
Belgian yeast fills the room on the pour, assaulting the nose. Some definite pepper notes round out the aromas.
Fairly creamy mouth feel. On the tongue there is the aforementioned Belgian yeast, bananas, cloves, pepper, and yes a hint of alcohol, which really isnt surprising.
I like this beer a lot, but it isnt a beer one could drink regularly, sporting that 9% abv.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a nice yeast aroma that is well balanced and not off-putting.
Appearance- Pours a golden yellow with a thick white head.
Taste- Fantastic flavor of yeast and malt, the ABV is well masked.
Palate- A medium bodied mildly carbonated beer.
Overall- A world class beer, this should be on everyones must try list.
This is a really good beer from the province of Quebec, Canada. Really fruity and subtile. But its 9% so you get drunk really fast before you even know it! Faite attention, be careful! ;)

Pours cloudy gold with a huge white head. Sour lacquer and pine needle aroma with yeasty notes. Triple umph tastes of alcohol, pine and some sweet notes too. A lot going on but more of a fight than a symphony. Oily with good carbonation. Not bad.
Pours golden orange with white lacey head. Aroma of floral hops, orange peel, and spice, moderate mouth feel with moderate carbonation. Flavor of honey, spice, and citrus finishing crisp and dry.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Chimay chalice. Been drinking a lot of tripels lately, both Belgian and otherwise and this one does match up well. Im getting a slight metallic taste and perhaps a lack of complexity as well as a somewhat biting carbonation which which is undoubtedly caused by the bottle fermentation. As usual, Im letting the beer warm up to bring out more flavor. Bought it an hour ago off an uncooled shelf in a store and rode it home in 55f weather in a bike bag, but as it warms up to room temps, it is more complex. Developing quite a liking for this brewery! Pretty fanciful map of Northern Quebec and Newfoundland on the label, an area which must be la fin du monde in bug season.

4/4/15 (Bottle) - Golden pour with generous white head, mild carbonation. Yeast and bread aromas, with a hint of citrus. Excellent taste of malts, yeast, somewhat sweet and balanced. Excellent feel, smooth, nice kick to it, and with the large bottle you are set for the afternoon.Overall excellent beer!
bottle poured into a trappist glass..golden yellow with a thin white head..aroma of bread,florals,bananas,grass..thin,funky and wine-like..not very good.

341 ml single bottle from Liquor Depot, served in my fancy Moninger Ratscherrn Pilsener chalice thingy. Ah, "The End of the World", a perfect name for a 9% abv offering from Quebec. Pours a slightly hazy orange-yellow with moderate carbonation and a crackling, rapidly diminishing milk-white head, leaving spots of lace. Aroma features very bright malts - very nice! -backed up by banana in bunches, and spicy clove, along with what seems like herbal hops (difficult to tell with the heavy banana). Flavor is a bold, yeasty weiss-style with tremendous banana, clove, and touches of bubble gum, with wheatiness tying it all together. Mildly thick and with a bit of a spice note that lingers on tongue and into the throat. Many wheat beers are high-octane offerings, and this is Canadas contribution, which fits honorably into the profile with identifiable flavor and aroma traits.
Pours a hazy straw from the tap, yeasty/lemon nose, smells almost sour. Flavor is a puckering maltiness, dry (IMHO) but still with some light caramel notes. Hides alcohol well. Very good beer.

Aroma is a little sweet, almost fruity.

Pours a partially cloudy golden amber colour. 

Taste was a little sweet for me, with a bit of an aftertaste.

Lots of carbonation. Goes down smooth.

Overall I was not dissapointed. I would not however buy a case of this. Definetly a quality brew. Just a little too sweet for my liking. Hard to tell this was a 9% beer.

MB

Pours a cloudy gold, with a nice white head. Aroma of sweetness with a powdery yeast and a light phenolic clove note. The taste is a bit peppery with a warming alcohol right behind it. Malty with some sweetness, fruity flavors. Some bitterness with a slightly dry finish. Smooth, drinkable, with some creaminess. All in all, a good tripel. Thumbs up.
Shit that good. Canadian French quality. Great colour, apple taste, wonderful stuff.
Haze straw color. Thick off white head. Yeast orange lemon aroma. Classic triple taste with a nice sharp brightness. One of the worlds best for sure

Appearance: this beer pours with a very large beige to cream colored head that takes a while to pour down, the beer is a slightly darker than average gold color, almost copper, pretty clear with nice bubbles coming up, head settles into a thick density 
Aroma: yeast, lemon, bread, 
Taste: bread, slight lemon, banana, slightest bit of warmth from the alcohol on the finish
Palate: heavy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, minimal banana aftertaste 
Overall: a pretty impressive beer, has a very nice appearance and hides the abv pretty well, could be a little more unique, has some hefeweizen qualities to it

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a nice moderate size head, very bubbly. Gives way to a very hazy darker yellow/orangey look. Aroma is quite strong, of yeast and about the same as flavour. Citrus flavours are quite abundant, hoppy, wheaty. A tingly aftertaste, a little tangy also. A great starting off point, but not a constant one-after-the-other kinda beer (9%!) Great stuff though!
Spices show through in scent not much of a looker, very smooth for abv hidden well by fruity yeast like flavor along with a few spices, carbonated to perfection
bottle pour,citrus aroma, nice golden color, sweet to taste, med body nice carbonation

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, belgian yeast, grass, flowers. Flavor is lightly sweet, malty, yeast, lemon, grassy, flowers. Medium body, fine lively carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. 230410
Authentic, legit tripel, but its got way way too heavy of a "Unibroue yeast" character to rise to absolute greatness.

Bottle from Pasquier. Aroma: orange zest, lemon, Belgian yeast, spices. App: hazy pale with medium white head. Taste and palate: full body, high carbonation, light acidity and warm finish. Overall: not sure why I stopped drinking this beer for a while because it is good and so well done. Great job Unibroue for being so constant.

Poured from bottle. Hazy gold with 2 finger head that dissipates quickly. Nose is grassy and floral with hints of coriander and spice. Mouthfeel is light and bubbly. Taste is sweet and fruity with a spicy finish. Awesome beer!
Bottle at Stumbling Monk, Seattle. Colour is cloudy light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, orange, Belgian yeast and malts. Better than average tripel.

Petite bouteille. Des louverture sechappe un parfum soigneusement epicé. Dans le verre le nez se developpe, gomme balloune, esters fruités de levure , agrumes, banane aussi. Vraiment le point fort de cette biere. Un corps moyen vraiment bien allégé par une effervescence assez forte. Des epices, on dirai une biere blanche forte. Aussi une belle acidité qui acompagne une tres legere amertume. Un delice! Jen avais trop bu pour me souler quand jetais jeune et on les vois tellement sur les tablettes partout quon oublie que unibroue produit des bieres exceptionelles a bas prix disponible en tout temps en plus!

Pours hazy gold with frothy white head with decent retention and attractive lacing.
Aroma is orange, honey, grass, spice. Evolves on the palate with lemon, coriander and biscuit notes joining the others. Satisfying mouthfeel, full but not filling, ebullient but not overpowering carbonation. If this is thin and flat at your local, blame your local.
Everything one wants beer to be, but hardly ever is. We can quibble about whether La Fin du Monde is the best beer in the world, or merely the best in North America, where its main challengers are within Québec, and for that matter, in-house.
Pours a hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma is citrus. Flavor is spice and citrus.
Pretty perfect in every category. Fantastic balance. Alcohol is masked with complex, sweet malt flavors

It could be that it is not what I was expecting, but despite the beautiful head, appealing aroma and a juice like appearance the spice was overwhelming and didn't seem to mesh with the underlying fruitiness. It's akin to blindly choosing ingredients from the cupboard; despite the quality of individual ingredients, it just calls that it could have been more.
Couleur dorée avec un col blanc respectable. Une triple dans les normes, agrumes, épices, céréales, alcool. Jai jamais vraiment compris quesquelle avait de si merveilleux...

Un classique indémodable, voilà! Belle mousse blanche, belle effervescence, levure et céréales remarquablement amalgamées... Un produit remarquable, à petit prix, dont je ne me lasserai jamais. Jadore sentir le bouchon de liège en ouvrant ce produit!!

Hazy greyish golden, light white head, creamy and frothy crust. Nose is thankful crisp lemon and brassy yeast. Creamy tangy initial swing, soft fudgey sweetness and a brusque carbonation. Finishes lean blueberry and linger of fresh peeled tangerine before shoved into an undercooked Victoria sponge. Bottle, 10pm Curfew Tasting
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma of cereal, caramel and yeast. Taste is yeasty, peppery, cereal. Dry and a little bitter
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear amber, nose is sweet, sherbet, grassy, taste is dry, dull toffee, sugary.
UPDATED: SEP 23, 2015 Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Aromas of light malt. Taste is honey sweet. Nice to try. Lager-like.

Golden colour, aroma typical of a triple. Nice palate and clean finish. 
I would enjoy this one again.

Nice sweet aroma. Really classic Belgian Triple. Lots of fruit in the aroma. Big banana, slight citrus, pear and green grape aroma. Taste is very sweet with big sweetness from the yeast and a very nice classic Belgian taste. This beer is just really solid and nails the style. So much flavor packed into the bottle. Highly recommend.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2015 10 month old bottle. Pours hazy yellow with lots of head. Nose in Belgian funk, banana, bubblegum. Lively carbonation with a somehow soft, frothy mouthfeel. Taste is fruity, funky, spicy, light fruit esters, banana, clove. Booze well hidden. Sweet and slightly sour with a mild bitterness on the finish.

32 month old bottle. Getting a strong peach/plum notes in the taste and nose, as well as some bread/grainy malts. Still fantastic.
Excellent beer soft taste but powerful surprised because I didn't knew it and it slap in the face on the first taste, will definitely have agai.

For #400, finally LA FIN DU MONDE! For my Canadian Friends! The aroma is Belgium yeast-banana/bubblegum, malts - bread, hay. Pours a slightly hazy yellow golden color with a big white frothy head, mostly diminishing. The taste is sweet/sour and bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish long. Overall one of my favorites.

Bomber to a tulip. Watching Buckeyes vs Terps. Hazy burnt orange with plenty of foamy head which rapidly fades. Great aroma , cork smells vinous like a Chardonnay. Also banana, clove, and nutmeg. Fresh baked bread with a fruity tangy sweetness... Just a bit of funk on the finish. Excellent triple!
Among the best of all the Unibroue Beers; quite the classic. Getting a bit of a hint of banana which increases with age. Great tripel.

ENG: 750ml bottle from Liquor Mart Winnipeg, poured into the glass. Light yellow - straw color with medium tan head, no lacing. Spicy and wheat aroma with strong yeast notes and hints of citrus, bananas and alcohol. Taste is malty, bready, also strongly wheat flavor, then sweet-sour champagne-like booze, finished with ginger. I cant find any hops or bitterness here (but thats the style). Light body, creamy, high carbonation. Overall very interesting beer to drink occasionally. ///~~~/~~~/// ///~~~/~~~/// PL: Butelka 750ml zakupiona w Liquor Mart w Winnipeg, przelana do szkła. Barwa żółto-słomkowa, średnia jasna piana bez lejsingu. Aromaty przypraw z mocnymi nutami drożdżowymi oraz cytrusami, bananami oraz alkoholu. Smak słodowy, chlebowy, mocno pszeniczny, później pojawia się słodko-kwaśny buzujący szampan, a wszystko wieńczy kandyzowany imbir. Nie mogę doszukać się tu smaku chmielu czy jakiejkolwiek goryczki (ale taki to już styl). Lekkie, kremowe, mocno nasycone. Podsumowując bardzo ciekawe piwo.

Ganz leicht trüb, läbig, orange. Nicht kompakter, kurzer Schaum. Stark hefig im Aroma, Teig, Düss, Alk. Sprudelnd süss im Antrunk, Alk merkt man sofort, nicht gut verteckt. Kaum Bitter, erwas säuerliches, trocken. Mittel Co2. Die Süsse scheint künstlich, Caramell. Süss-trocken-hefig im Abgang. Nä-ä!

From bottle. Pours super heady with a golden body. Aroma is lightly spicy. Taste is pretty malty and sweet. Has a nice spicy flavor as well. The spice lingers a while. Not super complex feeling. Thin and bubbly. Good. Not my favorite

750ml bottle poured into a duvel glass around 10 degrees. Pours a clouded corn with lots of carbonation and topped by two fongers of bright white fizzy head shrinking and resting to half a finger thick. Moderate heavy lacing is created when the glass is tilted. The nose is yeasty and resineous with bubblegum and some sweat. A faint breadiness in the back with a sweet lemon pie feature. The taste is a lot more malty with some caramelon the forefront. The yeast bring a soapy/doughy aspect paired with moderate booze. The brew feels dense and airy, leaving a sharp resineous finish that lasts. Great product you can let age in your cellar. Cheers!

12 oz bottle says best by sometime in 2017. Frothy white head. Yellow, but very cloudy. Well its a Belgian golden triple. Intense banana clove yeast. Probably too much for me. Bit of sweetness. No bitter.

From 750ml corked

Aroma: subtle citrus, slight breadiness

Appearance: Golden, hazy, big white head

Taste: Light sweet, medium bitter 

Palate: Light body, lively carbonation, sticky texture, long bitter and dry finish

Overall: A nice Tripel. Lots of Belgiany characteristics in the yeast and body. Subtle (not over done) spiciness. Nice body and dry finish. Aroma is a tad off - cant place why I feel that way. Overall, a very nice digestible Belgain beer.
Very enjoyable Belgian Tripel. Sweet and fruity, complex yeast character but still simple.

An abbey tripped, named in French, and brewed in Canada. Appears that good things do come from Canada. This is one of my favorite trippels. It is a bit higher on the alcohol side and you you can tell when let come to room temperature, so make sure to enjoy frosty.

I often buy the bomber and share, but have been known to keep the bottle in my wine coozy and keep it to myself!

Dark orange clear color (if you leave a sip in the bottle), very little foam. "Belgian" beer smell. Incredible crispy carbonation combined with an intense heavy body that makes you realize the alcohol. I find it rather difficult to drink.

On tap at Quenchers, Chicago. Very well described already so I wont describe, just give my opinion. Very well balanced and tasty and very smooth, but smooth to the point where it is boring and almost simple. Good, but lacking in character.

Bottle. Poured hazy, orange, decent off white head and some moderate spotty lacing. Intense fruity aroma, some grain and some yeast (Belgian like). Taste is sweet and quite fruity some wine notes and some hints of alcohol. Excellent beer, very enjoyable.

Full & rounded flavor.

Poured from a bottle with a golden yellow and a a white head that has lacy throughout the glass. The aroma is citrus and yeasty. The flavor is smooth malt and citrus with a subtle spice. A full body mouth feel with a light fizz. A nice Belgian style ....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2014 I love this French beer. This is one beer that i can use to express how my palate has changed i bought this beer when I was 18 or 19, thought it was horrible, now i like it.

75cl bottle brought from Canada and shared with friends.
Aroma had spices, bread, banana, a bit fruity.
Misty orange gold with a foamy off-white head. Head is lasting a while.
Taste was very "belgian". Grains, bread, and present sweetness.

Poured from a coupla bombers into the pint glass, the cork smells like wine. Taste is very refreshing and turns to a buzz very quickly. I would not guess this beer to be 9% considering the great juicy taste, and no dry aftertaste, it keeps your mouth watering.

Blonde légèrement orangée, voilée. Bonne mousse blanche, relativement persistante. Lacings.
Au nez très épicée clou de girofle et poivre, maltage sucré. Plutôt florale. Levures. Houblonnage floral. On ne décèle pas vraiment lalcool, belle balance.
En bouche, mêmes élèments avec une légère acidité avec des notes citron-orange. Légère amertume. Fin de bouche plutôt sucrée. Bonne carbonatation. A nouveau alcool très peu présent pour une 9%.
Bottle. Color hazy orange with medium white head. Aroma yeast, wheat, orange. Taste sweet, yeast, spicy, coriander, orange.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into tulip glass

Appearance: pours a thick, hearty white head that falls very slowly with some mild lacing. Color is an extremely cloudy light orange with plenty of streaming carbonation. 

Aroma: banana, cloves, vanilla, grass and floral aromas with some sweet bread as well.

Mouthfeel: light to medium bodied, frothy, with a slightly wet finish and some alcohol burn.

Flavor: lots of spice (mainly cloves & cinnamon), a bit of banana, bread dough akin to a sweet roll, some mild hops for balance.

Overall: An outstanding brew that I have enjoyed many times past and will continue into the future.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2015 Bottle from Jonis. Its pretty great. Super high score from me for any beer let alone a Belgian. Pours a beautiful hazy orange with a tight white head that dissipates. Lacing for days.   Incredible balance with sweet malt, clove, pepper, floral notes, biscuits, ripe bananas and raisins all readily apparent. Definitely leans towards sweet at the end. Yeasty and somewhat bitter finish. Slick mouthfeel. Exactly right for the style.

Hazy golden with a thin white head. Spice, floral hops, light sweetness, Belgian yeast signature with a light acidity. Mainly sweet, light bitterness with a light, long lasting, sweetness. Slick texture with a lively carbonation.

BOTTLE 341 ML.
Dusty blond tripelesque fruitiness, but also very spicy - even for a tripel - peppery and cloves. The flavour is similar, but more mellow.
This is really nice. Bold bitterness, lovely sugars great aroma, lovely length and taste. This is a pretty good beer to start an evening with.

hazy yellow colour, moderate sized off-white head; aroma of coriander, yeast, citrusy notes, hints of honey and dried fruits like raisin; taste of coriander again, grains, biscuity sweetness, fruity notes and some spicy afte-taste - although dominated by sweetness, it still has somehow dry character; great tripel

Sourdough ( I love that smell), nut meg and tangerine.   Seltzer, not sticky but it lingers.  Poured out of a bomber with no major changes (surprising) as it got warmer.  A great compliment to my turkey dinner and I suspect  would be with most savory dishes.  May you have many things to be thankful about year round, like tasting delicious beer!
Thin off white head under a cloudy tan pour, nicely sweet, terrific balance of spice, most excellent
Pours orange color with a very intense flavor. Nice aroma, not to strong considering high.
Unbalanced sweet tripel with a lot of ester aroma from the yeast as expected.
Lots of carbonation, good head, taste is good with an interesting yeast taste to it. Alcoholic content is OK but it doesnt stand out. Good beer!
Gold appearance with big head. Aroma is yeasty and sweet. Taste is very sweet, mostly biscuits, yes, but also citrus. Tastes like Aprilosenroulade. Fine brew!

La Fin Du Monde pours a completely cloudy sunset light orange with a decent beige head that doesnt last too long. The aroma is light citrus with lost of biscuits. The flavor is biscuits with light fruit and possibly apricot. Overall this is a lovely beer.

Wife got this draft at Madrones in Frederick, MD. Served in a tulip glass, hazy amberish-golden color with white head. Aroma of citrusy yeast, wheat malt, banana, clove and fruit (apples, pear, white grapes). Taste adds notes of candy sugar, pepper, toffee and light spices. Medium body, moderate carbonation, soft with dry yeast finish. Very tasty tipel.

Apparence: D?une couleur jaune dorée opaque, elle est coiffée d?une mousse moyenne d?une durée moyenne. Effervescence difficile à évaluer, mais semble quasi inexistante. 

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des arômes de malt et des notes dépices. 

Saveurs: En bouche, cest un corps moyennement léger. Au goût, cest des saveurs de malt et des notes dépices. De courte durée, il y a une légère effervescence et aucune amertume. 

Fiche technique
Style: Triple Belge
Format: 341 ml
Taux d?alcool : 9%

Bottle shared with Kouji & my buddy Nie. Served in a tulip. A lovely vibrant gold with a creamy white. A fantastic juicy spicy orange aroma with good spicy yeast character. Soft carbonation & a smooth mouthfeel. The taste is wheat, orange, cloves very well balanced. A fantastically well made beer. It was really dangerously drinkable for 9%

A very nice belgian style. Pours a very cloudy orange with a white head. Smells of citrus and lemon merengue pie. Taste is complex and layered, with lots of herbs and citrus, and a wheaty, creamy finish. Had in tap at Sonoma Public House.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Hazy Golden-yellow with medium white head. The aroma is yeasty, fruity (banana, pear), sweet, soapy. The flavor is very sweet, yeasty, banana notes, a bit alcoholic, spicy, light sour semi-dry finish. Medium carbonation, medium to full-bodied.

APPEARANCE - Opaque amber with a 4-finger head that lasts. A bit of lacing.

AROMA/SCENT - Sweet, malty, fruity, herbaceous.

TASTE - Hoppy, piney, herbaceous, a little sweet. ABV well-hidden.

MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - A bit of carbonation.

VALUE - Import price -- but its only Canada!

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - Very quaffable.
Strong, rich and complex with lots of fruit on the nose and a hefty dose of yeast on the tongue. Noticeable warmth from alcohol but not in the taste. Very pleasant.

750 ml bottle into signature tulip glass, best before 3/28/2017. Pours lightly hazy deep golden color with a 2 finger fairly dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big lemon, pear, apple, apricot, pineapple, orange peel, banana, coriander, clove, pepper, wheat, bread, candi sugar, herbal, grass, light bubblegum, and yeast earthiness. Incredible complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, spices, and pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, pear, apple, apricot, pineapple, orange zest, banana, coriander, clove, pepper, wheat, bread, candi sugar, herbal, grass, light bubblegum, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon. pear, apple, apricot, pineapple, orange zest, banana, coriander, clove, pepper, wheat, bread, candi sugar, herbal, grass, light bubblegum, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Insane complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, spices, and pale malt flavors; with a pretty much perfect yeast/spice/malt balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and fairly prickly/dry mouthfeel that is incredible. Alcohol is extremely well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is a world class tripel style. All around insane complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, spices, and pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to sip on for the big ABV. An absolutely amazing offering.

bière orangé,mousse peux persistante,aromes de levure, banane , céréales, épices et dalcool. en bouche cest bien malté,doux pétillement,cest velouté,bananes,levure final réchauffante un tout petit peux sucré, cest facile , très rafraichissante, Bref, criss de bonne triple
Pour is picture perfect. Aroma is coriander and malts with slight banana. Flavor is a little watery but otherwise this is an outstanding triplel.
Mild sweet in smell and flavor, full, thick and smooth. Moderate dark color, I like this Great beer

Draught at Gordon Ramsays Burger bar in Las Vegas. Pours a cloudy honey colour with small white head. Sweet nose of honey, peach and maybe some orange. Taste hits the spot. Creamy mouthfeel with notes of orange peel, peach, yeast and some light spice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

341ml bottle from The Only Cafe. Hazy gold body with a foamy thick head, almost creamy. Notes of orange zest and coriander, some yeasty funk, minimal.alcohol notes, vanilla and clove. A little bit of floral hop presence. Alcohol brings quite a bit of warmth which is nice as it isnt overpowering and feels quite balanced. Mid glass I noticed more malt based flavors like cereal and found some minimal sweetness. Quite full bodied.
Hazy golden with white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Nice complex flavor that doesnt scream 9% ABV.

"lighter fare than the Mudite or Trois, light golden with a quickly dissapating white head...more drinkable. very champagne like with the carbonation and mouthfeel. hides 9% really well at first (thought i was drinking a weizen with the lighter flavor profile), but it evolves into a refreshingly hearty triple. the spices are all there, but less aggressive than in some of their other beers. nice."

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 330ml bottle served in a tulip glass.
My 50th review, with class... ;)
A: Pours a yellow to orange golden color. Bit cloudy. Forms a medium bubbled head with low retention and very few lacings left
S: Smell is sweet, grainy and quite spicy. Complex. Notes of cinnamon, coriander, honey, pepper, vanilla, orange zest, flowery hops and yeasts. Malts backbone. A bit of alcohol in the very end
T: Complex as the nose: Sweet, grainy and spicy upfront. Again, notes of honey, coriander, cinnamon, vanilla, malts, pepper, orange zest and bready-earthy yeasts. Mild bitter finish
M: Heavy body. Creamy and molasses. Medium carbonation. Bittersweet aftertaste which is also quite spicy
O: good beer. Perhaps a little bit too spicy. Quite different from the Belgian Tripels Ive tasted. Strong Unibroue character
[ BA Review @ 1/30/2010 ]

hazy golden color. smells lemony and yeasty. Bready, doughy, grainy still very mellow high head and carbonation very well hidden alcohol and a very good yeast, a wheaty yeast. a real mens beverage!!! one of the best known tripels out there !

Julie says it is kind of tart and grassy She reports. It is a. 3.0. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I go out of my way to find this stuff. La Fin Du Monde is sweet, balanced, and strong. Its one of my absolute favorite beers.

Quite tolerable and quaffable for a Tripel. Pours an unfiltered straw colour with big white head. Aroma is of basement, booze, lemon, yeast, and grapes. Tastes of grapes, candy, and lemon. Has a sweet, smooth body that his highly carbonated and a little chewy. You feel the booze in this bad boy.
Bomber bottle pour. Hazy orange thin head. Malty, wheaty, fruity aroma. Yeasty funk. Typical tripel. Fruits, wines, and a finish that makes me think I just drank milk.

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Classic tripel. Flavors of white wine, pear, banana, slight sourness and funk, candi sugar. Plenty of yeast which rounds out the palate as well as the flavor. Probably the best use of yeast of any Unibroue beer. Pretty full-bodied for the style.

Bière triple sur lie de 9 % abv, avec des houblons belges en partie.
Orge et blé maltés, plusieurs levures, quelques épices.
Couleur or profond, avec un léger trouble.
Bulles par dizaines mais assez grosses.
Mousse qui fait un nappage correct.
Arômes axés fortement sur le malt.
1ère bouche à la texture agréable sur un beau mélange fruits secs/céréales.
Arrière-bouche avec des pointes de houblon intéressantes.
2ème bouche aux saveurs des grands espaces, iode, fleurs.
3ème avec une pointe de citron, fruits confits, coriandre.
La longueur est très belle et bien progressive.
Lalcool aide à cette progression.
Les levures ont de belles nuances.
La finale est au top.
CONCLUSION : très belle bière qui fait un grand cru digne et très fin.
Une progression sensible vers  la fin du monde.

Bottle purchased at Haskells in Maple Grove. Consumed in snifter glass. Hazy gold color and a minor head that keeps its form as the beer is consumed. Yeast present in the aroma with some underlying sweetness. Taste brings to mind slightly funky, sour notes with the good spice characteristics. A little bit of fruit to be found...probably banana.
