Has that tangy mouthfeel expected of a tripel. Highly enjoyable finish. Definitely a fan of this rendition. For this one Ill happily blame Canada.

On tap, poured lightly hazed yellow hue w/ medium lasting creamy white head. Bold aromas of white wine, sour, citrus, and apples. Initial flavor is moderate sweet and moderate sour finish. Tastes are bold white wine, oak, vanilla, white grapefruit, and milk. Full bodied and balanced mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rich yellow with lots of carbonation and a huge head. Champagne, banana, yeast funk aromas; some oak, bubblegum, grass. Flavors are apricot, grape, hint of citrus, tangy, some toffee, bubblegum. Long bittersweet finish.

Sampled this years ago but somehow the rating disappeared. Re-approached this one. Hazy honey pour with a billowing white cloud of a head. Bready, spicy, yeasty, and sweet with candy sugar, cane, grassiness, and a hint of banana. Fairly thick and chewy.
hay, grass, barnyard, pale, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively, astringent,

Bottle from the Beer Store. Hazy orange amber with a large fluffy white head that fades slowly. Nose is dominant yeast, with light honey, caramel, apple, grapes and a light pepper and clove background. Light sweet start with a mild bitterness accented with a light tart wine note. Mouth is medium slick with prickly carbonation. Well balanced with lots of character.
Hazy golden orange pour with a foamy head and no lacing. Aroma of orange zest, spices, yeast. Tastes about the same, heavy on the spices and yeast. Wish this had more of a hop presence. Great tripel.

Bottle. Nice hazy orange gold pour with a thin finger of white rocky head that sticks around fairly well. Aroma is sweet, citrus, with a fair bit of spice as well, nicely balanced with some bready malt. Light on the tongues, fairly drinkable. Flavours match the aroma with a bit more spice and less citrus.
Maltly triple with a smooth body and fine aftertaste. Heavy body brings the flavors forward. Sweet, as mentioned by others, but i feel it leaves something to be desired.
Ein sehr gutes bier, bei dem der gesamteindruck sehr überzeugend ist. Steht bei mir ganz weit oben...

Flaska drucken på Bishop Savoy, Malmö. Kanadensisk tripel med dimmig apelsinblond färg och stort vitt skum. Mjuk, frisk, viss maltsötma, örter, frukt, jäst i doft och smak, sammetslen, med en mild örtig torr humleavslutning. Elegant, modern och riktigt gott.

Sweet and delicious. Its not too tart, not too sweet; light enough for a summer drink and tasty enough year round. Back of the tongue flavor, this is a nice compliment to spicy food, but good enough to stand on its own. A nice, well-rounded beer ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tripel tipple sweeter than angel nipple. Hazy straw yellow juice with a huge, pillowy ivory head. Whiffage of grapes, yeast, basement, honey and spices. Slick, light oiliness, mid carbonation and some mild chewiness add to this sweet, boozy and dank Belgian brew. Fun times, very fun and fantastic.
Very heavily spiced. Lots of flavor and aroma. Overall a very savory flavor.

Un beau doré-orangé avec un col faiblement persistant. Nez dépices, de bananes avec un petit fond ferreux. Un peu amère, elle offre un goût de bananes et de levure dans un tout un peu sucré et bien velouté. Ce breuvage botte généreusement des derrières. Une fierté nationale!

Pouring La Fin du Monde is pleasant, especially if you have a bomber with cork version. Its quick to notice the bready, citrusy, spicy aroma. The brews golden, orange, color is its greatest attribute. If its minimal head didnt dissipate so quickly, Id have rated the appearance 5/5. It has a medium body, lively carbonation and a finish that lingers. 

Then theres the taste...maybe its the wrong time of year to be drinking a brew where spices seem to dominate the taste so much - especially in a lighter beer. Tastes like a seasonal beer Id have have around Christmas or other months in the winter. 

Maybe Ill give it a try when the leaves are turning or have fallen off the trees.
Slightly cloudy golden colour with visible good and very little head. Quite a sweet beer with a slightly spicy taste. Not one you could drink loads of. (K)

Bélgica preferida da Paloma, canadense pertence a saporo. Melhor do que a Sofie, mas ainda em dúvida sobre a Matilda.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bomber. Pours a hazy golden, orange. Makes a beautiful white head. Smells like a belgian triple with yeast, banana, citrus and malt. Tastes like a belgian ale, slightly bitter, this is an exceptional beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Canadian tripel with misty orange blonde colour and big white head; herbal, fruity, soft and yeasty aroma and taste, smooth, malt sweetness, velvety, with a mild herbal hoppy finish. Elegant and gentle example of the style, in spite of its ominous name.
Opaque golden orange with small off-white foam ring. Orange, and mango aroma, some barley. Decent strong beer taste, again some soft fruits notes. Short aftertaste. (Houston 201408)

Sweet and delicious. It's not too tart, not too sweet; light enough for a summer drink and tasty enough year 'round. Back of the tongue flavor, this is a nice compliment to spicy food, but good enough to stand on its own. A nice, well-rounded beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Banana and spice on the nose, beautiful golden hazy appearance. More banana and clove on the taste. Hits all the notes you expect in a triple very nicely.

Transfer from BA review on 11-16-12-
 Poured from 750 ml bottle into snifter

 Appearance  Pours a hazy orange-yellow color with a two finger white head. The head fades over a moderate amount of time to leave a lighter level of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma is bready and yeasty with a strong citrus orange and tropical fruit aroma. Mixed with these stronger aromas are some spice notes of a coriander and clove smell. Overall very Belgian triple like.

 Taste  The taste begins of a smooth bready flavor mixed with some tropical fruit tastes of mango, papaya and some tangerine/orange. As the taste advances, a yeasty flavor mixed with spice flavors of coriander, lemongrass, and clove come to the tongue. From there the spice and yeast grown stronger as the taste moves further forward with the sweeter fruit flavors losing some ground. In the end an alcohol flavor mixes with the rest to leave a warming bready spice flavor on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is rather complex and is really quite interesting and nice. It begins very smooth and creamy at the start with the carbonation level seeming relatively light. As the taste moves on the carbonation seems to explode from the brew within your mouth with the body crisping up. The smooth and creamy in the beginning are great for the bready and sweet that are heaviest up front, while the crisp and carbonated at the end are fantastic for accentuating the spice and booze. The feel is very nice, I must say.

 Overall  A very tasty and enjoyable to drink beer. This beer has one of the best feels of any beer I have ever had, as it seems to match and complement the flavor transitions perfectly. This is definitely one to try.

Finally tried this renowned beer while on holiday in California. Cork and caged bomber: BBD 19th Nov 15, shared with my wife and poured into La Chouffe tulips at my daughters on 16th July 14. Hazy pour with a huge head on both glasses.

Fairly sweet malt nose which gives way to a yeast and fresh fruit aroma mid sniff. Maybe some cloves coming through as well.

The taste is also malt led, but not as sweet as the aroma first suggests. The yeast also has a heavy presence in the mouth and this in turn allows the other flavours to show: semi bittering hops and a spicy feel compliment the aforementioned maltiness and yeast feel to make this a truly world class beer. Medium bodied with enough depth to carry the alcohol without it being an issue. Very pleasant indeed.
Initial impression is hard candy sugar. Clove prominent both in the aroma and taste. A touch of yeast. A good and interesting beer.

Yay four packs! But a twist off bottle? Wtf? These guys really are owned by Sapporo. 

Anyway. Smells herbacious. Estery. Floral but not hops. Orange. 

Explosive off white head. Hazy light orange color. 

Taste is like the smell. Also yeasty. 

Palate is smooth with a nice dry finish. 

A great Belgian style. Unibroue is always good.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a hazy medium amber with a whispy white head. The aroma is sweet toffee caramel. The flavour is medium sweet with a rich sweet malty yeast alcoholic bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

2009 vintage Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Pours cloudy dark golden with a small ring tan head. Aroma of yeast, plastercine, caramel, and toffee. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

bottle shared at THT from my beer cellar vintage 2009
Thin white head. Hazy golden blond pöur. A lovely tripel
Poured light amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of sweet berries and apple, soft caramel malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, light yeast. Medium sweet, lightly bitter.

Huge easy perpetual foamy head. Pours a hazy yellow glow. Heady penetrating aromatic trippel nose. Some carb on the tongue and the potent (overly?) body has notes of banana, light supple traces of liquorice and a whif of spice. Bit heavy too.

Impressive and undoubtedly one of the worlds top beers of its style.

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is quite yeasty with some banana, spices and some flowers. Taste has some spices, yeast and a medium bitter finish. Medium body, over medium carbo. Decent.

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours hazy golden / straw with a pretty white head. Aroma is bready, a little funky, banana, and spices. Taste is mildly sweet, banana, coriander, and some white yeast funk. This is a 9% beer but you cant taste the alcohol... very dangerous. This is an extremely good white. Medium body, medium carbonation, very enjoyable.
Hazy gold color with a finger of white head. aroma is bread and yeast. Flavor is bread, yeast, spices, and banana.

Pours a hazy yellow with decent head thats thick and sticks around for a while. Aroma is nice and fruity, slightly fermented but without being overwhelmingly sweet. Also has hints of fresh grass and floral scents. Taste is fruity and very smooth body. Good carbonation and well balanced. Ends with a slightly bitter taste with hints of hops. Generally a very good trippel that isnt overwhelmingly sweet, is very balanced and drinkable. One of my favorites in the style.
Strange malty tripel. Very yeasty body, with a thick taste of malt and fruits. Bit too malty perhaps.
Really fruity with notes if banana and a solid upfront malty taste. Medium mouth feel... Really good.
On tap, pours a hazy golden. Belgian yeast and fruity aroma. Taste is spicy yeast, and fruit - banana and pear. Alcohol content well hidden.

Bottled. I was introduced to this beer by my good friend and craft beer geek Erik from Hamilton/Canada. He and I love Belgian ales and this Belgian style ale was amazing! Fruity, citrusy, alcohol hidden, beautiful color.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2014 12 oz bottle poured into a stemmed goblet. Initially, theres a strong fruit combination pineapple, banana, orange, and peach with a light spice dusting and a bread dough and champagne aroma that fades. After the fading, some mango, cream, and a warm caramel are revealed. It pours a murky yellow-orange color with a soft, dense, small bubble head. A patch of micro to small bubbles floats in the middle and a thin ring retains on the outside edge. The lace is runny and leaves a clean glass. Its a medium-high sweetness with a light-medium bitter finish. The creamy texture has a light, but ample amount, of prickly carbonation. The body is medium-full and finishes with a pizza crust, spice, and jam flavor. Theres also a dull, dry white wine note in the finish. The aftertaste is mellow and sneaky - a bit of spice and buttery pizza crust with a juicy, citrus note to it.
Just an awesome beer. Perfect for dinner or enjoying with friends and family. Smooth and refreshing.
Smooth, rich, flavorful. It's been too long, so I'm glad I've got a bomber tonight. If course it's a little sweet too.
Draft: Pours a nice golden yellow color with a white head. Aromas are fruity and earthy. The flavor is full and yeasty...lots of fruit and spices. Very nice to drink.

Cloudy gold pour, finger of white head. Nose is mangoes, soft caramel and yeast. Bittersweet. Middle is creamy orange and smooth banana syrup pouring over a pancake. Seriously. Finish has a hint of quinine that is tempered by green, soft fruit sweetness. A little alcohol warms the exit. Complex, yum.
Cloudy straw pour. Spicy, yeasty, floral, apricot, honey, pineapple, peach. Pretty dry and very drinkable.

35cl bottle from drinks of the world, Basel. Color is dark gold. Appearance is hazy. Head is thin. Body is medium, and quite highly carbonated. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet, quite balanced. Aroma is malty, caramel, spicy, pepper, yeast, fruity.

Smell of yeast and flour, citrus and cloves. Orange hazy colour, opaque to translucent. Smooth finish with over arching flavour of reminiscent of fresh bread dough and oranges.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Belle robe jaune paille ambrée sur un col blanc très persistant. Doux arôme floral légèrement alccolisé. Au goût elle développe des notes intenses de levure & céréales sur une douce finale fruitée et sucrée. Un Doux Plaisirs avec assez de caractère. 0UTSTANDNG!!! ;)

It has a hazy body with a light golden amber color with a pale orange hue. The head is smooth, thick and creamy with good retention. It has a creamy off white color and it leaves behind soft lacing as it is slowly sipped down to the bottom of the glass. The aroma is full and fruity. There is sweet orange citrus and spicy character with a big hit of yeast and tropical fruits like pineapple. It has a sweet rich and fruity malt and yeast flavor up front. Tropical fruit like pineapple and guava are noted. Soft spices come out and the alcohol starts to warm things up. Hops add a light citrus and leafy flavor before the yeast comes back out and turns powdery and slightly dry in the slow lingering finish. The texture is smooth and creamy with perfect carbonation for the medium body. Outstanding and wonderfully complex with great drinkability.

330ml bottle ($2.51) from Premier in Halifax.

Mild but nice citrus aroma. Pours a cloudy amber/orange with minimal head. Has a medium sweet taste that goes down great. A light to medium body with a nice oily texture and lively carbonation.

Overall a very enjoyable brew.
750ml ($10.99) Very good beer. a really well defined version of an orange beer. far surpasses almost all orange beers and is 9% to boot. a very good beer worth trying if only once.

Aromas of banana, clove, slight citrus, maybe tangerine, slight apricot-like stonefruit. Cloudy yellow-orange with a mostly lasting fluffy white head. Off-dry, fruity, spicy, some medicinal-like phenols. Medium bodied, soft, fluffy carbonation, fruity, phenolic finish.
Beautiful gold color. Sweet aromas of orange candy, honey. Yeasty, sugary, fruity and spicy.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange colour with a big, long lasting, white head. Sweet aroma of fruit, yeast and spices. Sweet flavour with fruit, yeast and a dry, spicy finish. Medium body with oily texture and soft carbonation.

Aroma: Warm dough aromas with hints of freshly baked bread.
Appearance: Cloudy gold with a rich white head.
Taste: Light sweetness immediately followed by a medium sourness.
Palate: Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: The alcohol is a bit too apparent in the aftertaste for me. Still, this is a solid beer, and very well developed.
Tap in tulip at Mccormicks. Cloudy light orange. Small white head. Smells citrus. Tastes kind of wheat beer like . Spicy and sweet. Clean bite. Finished slightly sour . Ay, ok.
Bottle. Pours cloudy light gold with a big white head. Nose and taste is citrus, particularly orange along with clove. Delicious.
Pours a golden amber with fluffy white head. Spicy with hints of cloves and bananas. Very smooth. A bit of a chemical after taste, but all things considered a very fine beer.
Outstanding tripel with a fruity aroma. Crisp mouth feel with a malty character. Clean finish.

Pours amber with thick white head. Aroma of booze with some banana and raisin. Taste is complex, with raisin, hints of anise, coffee bitterness long slow boozy burn of an aftertaste. Oily mouthfeel. An old favourite!

Bottle pour. Breast citrus aroma with hints of orange and lemon. Cloud golden color with fluffy white head and good lacing. Clean light body. Initial bread taste that follows with a sweet citrus taste that ends slightly bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
My BF went on and on about this one... I honestly can't remember one quality about it. Maybe is about as good as I can offer...

Ah, the famous La Fin Du Monde. Ah, who hasnt had this?
Haha, no worries. Ive had this more than enough times to say something on this.
Here goes and just about every time Ive had this into a chalice.
The appearance was a nice golden amber to somewhat orange color with a nice one finger white foamy head that dissipates within less than a minute.
The smell had a super nice allocation of iced apples, coriander, some peaches, and a nice Belgian spicy sort of yeastiness invading my nose.
The taste was sweet and spicy and said a lot about a somewhat invading pear-like flavoring over top of the apples I previously smelled. I didnt get any aftertaste but I did get a dry finish.
On the palate, it sat about a light to medium and showed a decent sessionable characteristic about it. The carbonation seemed somewhat smooth but still had a decent sharpness running about it.
Overall, in my opinion, this was a good Tripel that I would have again.

Excellent. Cloudy orange-yellow color. Smells of lemon, orange, banana. Taste is banana bread, a bit of clove, some orange. Very creamy mouthfeel with lots of small bubbles. Not as yeasty-sour as some others.
This is possibly the best Trappist style ale one can enjoy. I place this up there with the likes of Delerium, even though this is richer overall.

Pouted from a 330ml bottle, brilliantly clear light gold in color big creamy white head with tiny bubbles. Aroma is sweet alcohol, bready malt and some light clove spiciness. Taste honey like malt with some alcohol sweetness, clove is pretty strong almost gingerbread like. Medium body medium carbonation, coats your tongue with a slickness.
12 oz bottle poured a murky gold. Aroma of yeast esters. Banana flavors dominate with hints of floral, grassy hops.A little sweet. Heavy carbonation. Smooth and good.
More subtle and juicy then a lot of great tripels. Really not as excitign but very clean and tasty. A sipper but still easy to drink. Pear juice apparent.

Pours a hazy peach with a medium white head. Aroma is yeast, banana, mango and white grape. Taste is sweet up front with yeasty floral goodness following and a nice clean finish. Creamy with medium carbonation. Very easy to drink and absolutely delicious.

0.355l bottle @ Rattle N Hum. This is a light cloudy orange with a small off-white top. It has a trippel nose with some banana and yeast, light traces of flowers and alcohol. Lovely flavors! Its about average on the carbonation perhaps average+ and it has a oily mouthfel. The taste is clean and classic with Belgian yeast, more banana, a bit like a golden ale with some alcohol and Christmas spices in the finish. Lots of flavor and quite a tasty little treat bought to us by a really talksome guy at the bar that insisted that this is the best beer in the whole world and that we just have to try it. 13.06.2013
UPDATED: MAY 4, 2014 Pours hazy, straw color with white head. Smells of yeast, bread, and a little citrus. Tastes of bread, apricot, and coriander. Mouthfeel is creamy yet sticky.
Pours a slightly cloudy gold with white head, not much lacing. Coriander, wheat, and spice on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with some spice.

Pours cloudy yellow. Massive head, moderate lacing. Aroma banana, cloves, skunk. Medium sour taste with notes of oranges, banana, clove and apricot. Full body with barely noticeable carbonation. Texture is half creamy, half sticky. Finishes long and sour. An excellent example of the style.

Appearance 4/5 - The beer is a nice amber orange clear color with a white thick head that leaves a nice lacing. Very majestic looking bottle.
Smell 9/10 - Nice belgian yeasty smell with bready, fruity notes. Banana, orange, cereal. Smells like candy in beer form :)
Taste 9/10 - Same belgian yeasty/bready notes in the taste as in the smell. Banana, orange, white pepper.
Palate 4/5 - Great mouthfeel, light - medium with slight alcohol warmth. Aftertaste is sweet bready banana. Very clean beer.
Overall 17/20 - Probably the best belgian strong pale ale that Ive had. Its pretty amazing.
Delicious smell, yeast and hay. Decent head (enjoyed from a tap), but a very clear color. Sparkles with cirrus and honey notes, finishes great and cleanses he palate.

Aroma: yeast, sour, caramel, hay, flowers. Appearance: hazy pale gold, medium creamy white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: light sweets continue, some light bitters lingering in the background, nice balance, malty sweets, bread, caramel, low carbonation. Overall: fantastic Abbey Tripel, well balanced aroma and palate. Bottle from Drinks of the World Zurich HB, Switzerland.

This is nice, they brew some mighty fine Belgian style ales in Canada. Aroma of apricot, dough, hay, lemon, spices, and nutty yeast. Pours cloudy straw-gold with a nice, creamy, white head that leaves lacing. Complex, interesting flavor that is overall dry but very fruity and well balanced. Has elements of earth, nuttiness, tart/sweet/sour, and peach. Medium to full bodied, slick texture, lively carbonation, and dry finish. I really like this, would repeat.
Really nice tripel. descent aroma and a really smooth taste for the high abv. Very good.

Bottle. Light golden pour with a big foamy head. Floral, citrus, bread, spice, yeast. Light to medium carbonation with a medium body. Initially slightly citrus and bready with fruity and bready finish. Pretty good
Great triple. Wonderful 9% brew that you can sip and enjoy. Nice head and wonderful flavor.
Citrusy juicy hints on honey and pine, appearance is cloudy with little sediment, taste of bread, citrus, alcohol is there but not overpowering woody pleasant taste.

Despite the odd odor this beer tastes superb. It sits rather heavy though. This might be a great meal-replacing beverage or FIRST beer. I had trouble finishing it after a meal and another beer. I put this beer in the Kwak category which to me means "unique, great tasting, high octane beer."

Hazy light gold color with a large foamy white head. The nose is of fruity and musty yeastiness. First sip is sugary & fruity - apricot in particular. The sweet taste is in command, but the beer is balanced enough. Caught some nutmeg aroma.

The 9% worried me and I expected a thick, malty experience. It really is magic. It tasted light with a tiny hint of pineapple somewhere. I dont like fruity beer, but this really worked. A lovely warm buzz after finishing a big bottle. If you had time for one beer before the end of the world, this would be it.

Pours a hazy light gold from the tap. Big, foamy white head that holds for a bit. Smells of hay and fruit. Nice blend of apples and pears hits the tongue, with a touch of white grape. Smooth, crisp mouth. This is an excellent tripel that is light and refreshing.
Pours a big head with aromas of spice with Apple pear and citrus. Nice yeast malt character that largely follow the aroma. Beautiful beer with just the right yeast and spice balance.
Aroma is honey, gingerbread, dark grain bread, clove, banana. Taste has some of those elements along with some yeast and tang, with spices to balance. Easy drinking 9%, and good for the style.

Poured into a tulip out of a 750ml bottle.

Pours a hazy medium orange with a huge four finger billowy head. It takes quite a while for the head to settle down in order to fill up the glass. Really impressive head retention and lacing.

Aroma is very fruity and spicy with orange peel and some coriander. Maybe even a touch of clove and pineapple thrown in there. Very nice.

The flavor continues the characteristics found in the aroma but there is an addition of a quick shot of caramel up front. A big rush of orange peel follows with some clove and banana. There is a moderate dryness towards the finish and the finish is fairly clean. Alcohol is completely hidden.

Overall, this is a very nice Tripel. Probably not the best I have ever had but it is up there. I would say this is the best non-Belgian example of the style I have come across.

Bière orangée, voilée, très mousseuse avec une effervescence soutenue. Le nez est bien parfumé, à la fois dalcool et dépices, sur un trame levurée assez marquée. Ça sent la soif (!) En bouche, les promesses faites à nos narines se réalisent avec justesse. Lensemble est fruité et les épices ajoutent à la longueur de la finale. Le bilan des levures est assez lourd, mais rien pour nuire à la dangereuse buvabilité du produit. Les bières pâles qui ont autant de goût et de puissance sont redoutables. Cen est presque capiteux! Unibroue ne brasse aucune mauvaise bière en 750 ml. Et dans cette série de bières dinspiration belge, la Fin du Monde trône parmi mes favorites depuis longtemps.

12oz bottle from Brewmasters in Wilson. Golden-Orange hue, normal clarity with 1-1/2 finger thick fully lasting frothy white head. Citrus fruits, spice (clove), water aromas. Smelled and tasted like a clove cigarette. Moderate bitter nutmeg and clove up front with a light average spice finish. Again, tasted like a clove cigarette. Light body, fizzy carbonation, oily texture. I usually do not like Abbey beers, but the spice/clove aroma and taste did it for me. It could have also been because I was enjoying it outside in the kick ass weather we had yesterday or because I like pumpkin beers. Either way I liked it.
Draft. Hazy straw with medium white head. Aroma of fruit (pears and apple), grain, and some yeast notes. Light body with fruit, Belgian, and yeast notes, some graininess, and a sweet honey finish.

Aroma - typical banana-clove aroma 
Appearance - not too pale, not too clear, not too orange - a perfect tripel, impressive head (used a wide chalice)
Taste - aroma (estre) driven subtle blend of banana and juniper, slightly citric fresh watery finish
Palate - noble juniper and chinine-like bitterness only subtler with only a trace of bitterness from alcohol
Overall - I suppose this was the main inspiration for Pintas Sahti "Happy End" (literal translation of the Polish market name is also "End of the world", its a thicker beer with strong uneven banana-sausage taste and totally hidden 8% ABV). A noble tripel, I regret I havent spared it for a special occasion. I only would like it thicker but its impossible due to the triple fermentation. Will surely drink it again. 341 ml bottle from "Drinks of the world" Zurich

(from notes) 12 oz bottle into a pint at Basement Burger Bar on February 19. The pour is a foggy gold, a little darker in color than a light gold. There is no head to be found, and naturally zero lace. The aroma is HUGE Belgian yeast! There is a light booziness and some caramel maltiness, but for me, its mostly all yeast. The flavor is more of the same. Belgians are definitely not my thing, but I cant get over the yeastiness and breadiness of this thing. Its definitely comparable to drinking a weird bread. There is perhaps some dark fruits resonating through the flavor. The mouth feel is solid. Its definitely thick, and creamy, and the aftertaste isnt so great, but ts decent for a Belgian, which, again, arent my thing

UPDATED: APR 12, 2014 12oz bottle (soon to be 2-12oz bottles). A definite citrus aroma and flavor people are saying cloves a lot and I have to agree. The flavor is strong but only for a few second and leaves a lesser citrus taste on the tongue. Im not 100% sure of what wine drinkers mean by "dry", but that is what came to mind after drinking this beer. The color is light and opaque with a very little head that keeps getting less and less. Im not real big into the sweeter beer styles but this is a good beer.

750 ml bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with full head. Aromas Belgian yeast, lemons and spicy banana bread. Flavors of lemons, cloves, resin, and toasted malts. One of the great Quebec beers of yore. (OK the last ten years.)

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes orangegoldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, alkoholisch, Nüsse, Früchte.
Geschmack sehr süß malzig, dunkle Früchte, hefig, leicht alkoholisch.

3/4/14. 
With Sue. 
Bomber. 
Dillon, CO. 
Decent Belgian triple but slightly too peachy sweet for my liking. Relatively highly carbonated which is refreshing but I prefer the heavier tasting Belgian ales. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This Quebec beer delivers a hazy, deep golden hue and a head with densely packed bubbles that evaporate quickly. Satisfying malt aromas of caramel, honey and sourdough bread balance nicely with the yeast's coriander, clove, banana and lemongrass. The hops in this beer do not have a starring role, but merely complement the performance. Delicate pepper, citrus and clove bathe the palate. It is medium-bodied, dry and slightly tart. The finish is medium in length and exhibits a spicy, mild bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2015 Bière jaune orangée, bien trouble, très effervescente, et surmontée dun col blanc, bien mousseux, savonneux même, assez large, dense, compacte et persistant. Arômes de levure belge typiquement Unibroue, avec effluves bien maltés de pain frais, pâtisserie, miel et fruits frais du verger (pêche, poire, pomme). On note également beaucoup dépices au nez (clou de girofle, coriandre, gingembre, muscade, poivre), ainsi que des pointes de houblon herbacé et dalcool. Nez assez agréable, belle complexité, moyennement intense. En bouche, pétillement assez élevé sur la langue, breuvage bien mousseux, avec une onctuosité fort intéressante au palais, cest rond, doux et soyeux. Au goût, pain frais et pâtisserie, très fruité (fruits du verger avec des notes dagrumes), avec un malt mielleux à souhait. Cest également très épicé, et on est autant dans les herbes aromatiques fraîches que dans les épices plus chaudes, le tout équilibrant à la perfection les saveurs plus maltées. Un délicat houblon herbacé amenant une amertume légère mais bien sentie se pointe dans une fin de bouche au cours de laquelle perce dagréables nuances alcoolisées qui viennent mettre la touche finale à cet équilibre parfait. Excellente intégration des différentes saveurs, belle complexité et intensité supérieure en bouche par rapport au nez, excellente bière! /// On prétend souvent que cette bière à un excellent potentiel de vieillissement Je peux dire quun vieillissement denviron 3 ans fait exploser la saveur du malt mielleux et fruité (un véritable sirop de pêche!) mais quon perd définitivement le houblon, lamertume et les notes alcoolisées. Cest intéressant, mais pas nécessairement supérieur à la version fraîche

Orange and hazy (perhaps I poured in the dregs). Big white head that really lasts. Aroma has nice spice and pepper, with some citrus notes as well. Great flavor, very zesty. Light, a soft bready/ caramel sweetness that is balanced by tropical fruit. Good bitterness balances. Good carbonation on the tongue, with an overall fairly creamy mouthfeel. CLings to the tongue a bit. Really delicious beer and goes down smooth and easy for 9%.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2014 Aroma: lemon, clove, vegetable, spice, very mild cheese

Taste: Lemon, Clove, mild bubblegum, nutmeg, multigrain bread, dark molasses, a little cheese funk 

Palate: Although this beers high abv does not allow much head to form a quick swirl in the mouth gives a wonderfully cloudy froth. Wonderful subtle burn on the back end but without the taste of alcohol. Very lovely. 

If you want to check out some great Canadian beer. This one should be on your list. It is hard not to tell this beer is made from Uniboue. Their yeast has a profile that really defines the brand. It works very well in this beer and works perfectly in tune to the fresh lemon flavors that are present.

 If mouth feel is something you look for in a beer, this beer has a light creamy texture that takes that nitro mouth feel to a whole new level without nitro actually being present.
On tap a bit cloudy golden color with thin white head. Taste is malt and fruity citrus. Very balanced throughout with no noticeable alcohol. Very nice but not a match for the better Belgium triples.
Kept in a cool closet for just over a year. Probably shouldve bought a fresh one to compare. Either way great beer.

750mL bottle (w/ cork). The first pouring yielded little head, but the smell which hit me almost immediately as I started pouring was a beautiful citrus and peach smell. The colour was a beautiful cloudy pale gold. The taste is magnificent, completely disguising the high alcohol content. The second pouring gave about 1 inch of head, and tasted just as good as the first. An extremely good and drinkable beer!!
I loved this beer! Great taste if you like Belgium strong ales! Very drinkable! It was a little cloudy. It finished pretty dry. I think is one of the best from unibro!

Nice Brew!!! As described by most raters, yes its cloudy gold in color nice aromas of yeast" kind of bready ". I do not know why but I always seem to get a waxy smell and flavor from this style beer , what I mean by waxy is you know that wax candy they sell right about Halloween the vampire teeth and big lips or the small coke candies in wax , not the flavor of the candy but the actual wax. Anyway thats my opinion and its a free country. Enjoy !!!

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy golden color with medium creamy white head, average sparkling appearance and some yeast residue. Aroma of yeast, cheese, fruit, spices and some alcohol notes. Taste starts with moderate sweet grainy malt, follows refreshing fruity and yeasty, mouthfeel is warm alcoholic, while finish is mild bitter. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. This is the end of the world how I want it :)

750 ml. bottle. Pours golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of yeast, fruit, and spice. Taste is yeast, spice, banana, orange, grain, apple, and malt. Really grew on me as it warmed. World class!
Smooth and easy to drink. A higher ABV for people who are shy of hops and malt.
On draft. Cloudy and golden. A good amount of white head. Tart taste, citrusy, smooth. A dry finish. Very good beer.

An AMAZING brew!! Best just below room temperature served in a brandy snifter, huge notes of banana, vanilla, toffee abound in this offering from up North. When the days been "one of those", I can crack one of these and all is well with the world again! Would LOVE to try straight from the tap!

Pours a cloudy yellow brew with a huge white head with regular retetntion, aroma is heavy sweet and moderate to light bitter with citrics, clove, coriander and banana, medium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a bittersweet finish.

Pours hazy golden with moderate fluffy head. Nose is Belgian yeast, ripe banana, bready. Taste is Belgian yeast, ripe banana, bready, starts off sweet then dries out at the end. A touch of alcohol on the end, solid mouthfeel, moderate carbonation. Very solid tripel, on the fruity side as compared to other tripels. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2oz sample at International Great Beer Expo (Meadowlands). Pours a golden straw color with a frothy white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and spices, and a sweet fruitiness. Taste is the same. Sweet fruit, and strong Belgian yeast and spice notes.

Poured from bottle into trappist tulip. Pours a cloudy amber. Nice white head that thins down fast but lasts till end. Lacing on glass. Med carbonation. Aroma is classic Belgian. Yeasty, floral and ripe banana. Med body, dry. Taste is malt, banana, bready, citrus (lemon). Were it is differant is the finish is not as strong in alcohol than most in this style. A little nutty with some lingering yeast. Very nice, very enjoyable.
Shared bomber; snifter. Light gold color that looks darker in some light due to its haziness. Yeasty, bready, some tartness, peach; nice balance, everything goes together nicely.
The only beer I save so I dont overdrink it, because if I could I would drink this every day. A perfect blend makes for a near-perfect beer.

From a bottle. A very bubblegum and banana aroma with hints of acidic star fruit and hay. Appearance is hazy gold with thick white head and beautiful lace. Taste is sweet bubblegum and banana with mild acidic apple and pineapple balanced with some slighty bitter hay. Palate is very nice, fizzy, mouth filling, not syrupy; just a little too thin to be a 5. Overall, a great beer.

From bottle. Clear gold. Bubbly, almost cider like mouthfeel. Big head turns to lingering thin foam. Nose of bubblegum, Belgian yeast, metal. Tastes of light Belgian yeast, light metal, banana, clove. Borderline Farmhouse funk. Solid as hell.

Complex brew, with a wide range of aromas and flavors. Orange zest, sour apples, bananas, clove, mixed grains, spices and yeast. Between the slightly sour finish and clove, I cant have too much of this one. But it is a very good beer and solid take on the style.

Pours a cloudy honey colour, with a thin head. Aroma notes include fruity notes, citrus, astringent, acidic, yeast, grapes, and slight musty. Tasting notes include dried fruits, sweet cherries and currants, spicey, rich malts, and has a quite dry finish. Excellent!!

12 oz. bottle from Old Chicago. Appearance: golden yellow color, very cloudy, white head that diminishes quickly, good sized head. Aroma: vinegar, banana, white wine, yeast, coriander, fruit. Palate: light body, dry finish, average to laively carbonation, long tart finish. Taste: instant tartness and sweetness, tartness lingers in the mouth like an under ripe cherry. Overall, very unique, not my favorite but very good.

From bottle. Cloudy deep golden color, effervescent. Aroma of sweet yeast, plum, bubblegum, banana, and clove. Taste of banana, clove, pitted fruit, very lightly tart yeast. Finishes with sweet and slightly bitter dry finish.

Poured into a Unibroue snifter a cloudy golden orange color with a white head that dissipates quickly.
Aroma is classic Belgian yeast, floral, bready, booze nicely hidden.
Flavor is a malty joy of citrus lemony. Fruit balanced here with a some slight hops. 
Highly carbonated which perfects the balance of malted tastes in this great Belgian. When I want a classic trippel this brew calls my name.

Had it bottle in a Goblet. It pours a golden yellow, with a white head that dissipates slowly. It has a strong nose. I got a lot of floral hints and some coriander. It is a medium body with slightly high carbonation and also dry. On the taste I pick up some fruits such as apple and pear. I also get a little bit of spice. Overall this is a really good beer. Has an amazing aroma and tastes amazing. Overall this is one of my favorite beers now!

Pours a cloudy bright golden honey color. Aroma is yeasty and inviting. Taste is slightly citrusy, slightly sour and a bit hoppy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at HoB. Big, sweet, boozy and somewhat sticky aroma. Not chewy, but a sipper regardless. Alcohol is well hidden, but there is no doubt that youre drinking a big beer. Very good.
(from notes)

Bottle at home. This is another beer I have had many times and never rated. Pours a hazy golden color with a large fluffy white head that lasts. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, citrus, fruit, yeast some alcohol at times but it doesnt distracting, some spices and a hint of banana. I used to drink this quite a bit before I joined ratebeer and it was interesting to revisit.
Pours hazy golden yellow. Aromas are sweet and tart, like orange and grapefruit. Tastes like a well-balanced tripel, characteristic yeast and sweet malts. Great Belgian style beer.

Pours a murky, golden with about 1 of head that dissipated quickly leaving some nice lacing behind. Aroma is the typical Belgian yeast and fruity esters. Taste follows the nose with a little hint of spice and a lingering tartness. Medium bodied with a dry finish and above average carbonation. This is my favorite beer from Unibroue.
Excellent triple with full body and flavor.  Can definitely taste the spices.

Light smoky, lightly meaty, light fruit. Light in color. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

 via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden yellow color, fruity aroma (mostly apple), almost tastes like a hard cider.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 This beer out of Quebec is a hazy orange color with thick head when poured. 9% abv with a fruity taste to it. Drinkable, but not to my preference.

Pours a golden yellow color with a thick, creamy white head. Wheat, clove, apple, pear, spices and yeast aroma. Apple, pear, spices, wheat, malt, grassy hop and yeast flavors. Sweet with a light body and lots of carbonation. Spice fruit and wheat finish.

Poured to NB globe. After having so many times in the past, finally gonna put a pen to it.

A: hazy corn kernel appearance with limited head (this time, unusual). the surface remains scattered with fine white foam on the edges and rimming the edge. Little lacing.

S: Lots of banana, clove, cardamom, coriander. All spice and fruity esters. Light grain in the nose.

T: All the spice crosses through and offers more of the same. Banana more evident on the finish here. Finish also offers the peppercorns to show a bit. Some corn as well.

M: Light for the style, but lively carbonation. Leaves the mouth slick. Decent.

D: Drinkable, but not the best in show IMO. I find other triples more to my liking. their yeast is repulsive, and this is simply another stage for them to showcase the beast.

Serving type: bottle

02-23-2011
Bottle, smell of sweet pear, appearance golden cloudy yellow with white head, taste is sweet light fruit, bread, bubble gum, very good beer that is not heavy

341ml bottle. Pours cloudy golden orange with a thin foamy white head. Aroma is cereals, pear, apples, vanilla, citrus, honey and spices. Taste is honey, banana, spices, biscuit with a touch of alcohol. Medium body, lively carbonation, smooth texture. Warm and fruity finish.
Classic. Big body, big spice, nice yeast flavor. Orange rind dominates, long finish. Nice.
Golden yellow with a nice foamy white head. Has a sweet, yeasty wheat flavor that goes down smooth. Very delicious.
Botella de 33 cl ya hace montón de tiempo. Una gran pena no encontrar nada de esta casa actualmente. Imprescindible conseguir algún día de nuevo esta potente triple de 9 vol para volver a recordarla.

Der Geruch ist malzig, aber genauso wie bei dem "Eau Bénite" nach Popcorn. 

Der Geschmack hat was von "Almdudler für Fortgeschrittene" - relativ süß und nach Kräutern. Das Popcorn aus dem Geruch ist zum Glück nicht zu schmecken! 
Sehr süffig, aber doch sehr klebrig-süß! 
Der Abgang ist leicht herb. Es hat was von "Bionade Kräuter + Zucker + Alkohol" 
 --> nicht so zu empfehlen!
(22.4.2008) --> 	Noten: 12,7,10,5,12,5 - 7,10

Drought. Golden yellow with creamy beige head, orange-tangerine-vanilla aroma, sweet cookie like taste, almost like consuming those butterscotch cookies, low carbonation, medium finish. Incredibly smooth and easy for a beer with this high alcohol content; explains why it would be a month-ender!

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste belgian yeast, sweet, fruity. I thought this was really good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of my favorite triples out there, and the most reasonably priced one too; for 7.99 at TD Joes its an excellent deal. Its on the sweeter side of tripels, lots of belgian yeast, banana, butterscotch, vanilla and sugar, hazy bright yellow with a foamy big head. Lovely representation of the style; for my money beats some of the big hitters in the Belgian front (St Bernardus, Karmeliet...)

Poured from a 750ml bottle. The aroma is yeast driven, but I would not be surprised if some fruit was harmed in the making of this beer. There is orange, banana, musty notes, soft malty sweetness, just in the aroma. The flavor is bready, sweet maltiness, yeasty, banana, orange. Some warming alcohol. I have had this beer many times and I am still finding it enjoyable.
Très bonne bière bonne qualité pour un prix abordable 9%cest pour les hommes pas les enfants

Bottle poured into tulip. Two plus fingers of off-white head that slowly collapses to a ring and a few small foamy islands. Pale apricot gold color that is hazy. Bubbles rise single file - cool to watch. Aroma is apple/pear cider, doughy yeast, clove, alcohol. Clove flavor up front then malty sweetness followed by drying alcohol. More hints of cider. A touch of hop bitterness in the finish. Medium bodied, creamy texture, lively carbonation, drying finish.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a medium white lasting fluffy head. mild lacing. Aroma is of sweet spicy fruit, Belgian yeast, some notes of citrus and banana, some biscuit malt as well. Taste is same as aroma with a good spiced hops bitterness. A medium body, with lively carbonation, almost champagne like. The finish is a combination of sweet spiced fruit, Belgian yeast, biscuit malt with spicy hops bitterness on the end for balance. This brew has some nice champagne like effervescence. Overall a very good, delightful, and tasty brew. very nice.

Bottle at Ava's in Easton, MD. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a creamy white head in a Chimay glass. Aroma of pears, spice, yeast. Flavor follows with lots of fresh juicy pears, honey, some spice, and lingering yeast ones on the palate. Medium bodied, slightly dry finish yet still juicy, adequate carbonation. Such am easy drinking really world class brew.

Ok, belgian from Canada... In my opinion one of the best beers in the world! The flavor profile is outstanding, drink one next to a Duvel. This beer has a taste that is unmistakeable, fantastic malty smootheness but, with the distinguishable belgian yeast mix. Though I may not reccomend this spicy belgian to everyone , this is probably my favorite beer!

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 Amber in the glass with abundant small bubbles of carbonation producing a nice head. Interesting spice nose. Pleasant, refreshing mouth feel, a touch of yeast flavour similar to fresh baked bread.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a snifter. 

A: Strong Belgian yeast accompanied by light citrus fruit, clove, caramel and some biscuit notes as well. 
A: Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a creamy head that dissipates to a thin ring and leaves minimal lacing. 
T: Follows the nose, sweet and spicy, with a hint of citrus fruit, yeast and sourdough breads. Copious amounts of complexity with every sip; each sip is slightly different than the previous. 
P: Medium bodied beer with high effervescent carbonation. 
O: In my mind, it would be a dog-fight for the best non-Belgian tripel between Unibroues La Fin du Monde and Victorys Golden Monkey. I find La Fin du Monde to have a much stronger fruity note than the Victory and to be slightly more complex as well.

From bottle. Cloudy deep golden color, effervescent. Aroma of sweet yeast, plum, bubblegum, banana, and clove. Taste of banana, clove, pitted fruit, very lightly tart yeast. Finishes with sweet and slightly bitter dry finish.

Bottle / pours out cloudy light copper. Small head. Nose of yeast, citrus, and boozy cherries. Taste of cloves, yeast, and some hints of banana. A nice triple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden pour from the bottle with a tall white head that lasts. Perfect carbonation. Aroma is full and malty with a little bit of citrus. Flavor is big, complex, malty and citrus and a little bit tangy. Medium mouthfeel and pleasant to roll around the tongue.

On tap at Disney. Pour is hazy straw yellow with a bubbly white head. Aroma is of spice, citrus, and orange peel. Flavor is citrus at first and transitions into a biscuit middle and sweeter finish. Some yeast flavor, medium carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2014 pours a very hazy and full of sediment gold. the aroma sweet and spicy, similar to orange juice or could be just me. you can also pick up some honey as well. the taste is very similar to the aroma. not much bitterness with this but you feel a little bit of the alcohol as it goes down but you have to be careful at 9% ABV this is an easy drinker. Highly recommend everyone try this beer
Excellent beer. Pale color and light body. High alcohol content. Sweet taste and great finish.

75cl bottle, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: citrus, hops, candy sugar, liquorice.
TASTE: fruity, pleasant bitterness, hops, grains.

Poured from bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a creamy white head that lasts a long time. Aromas of yeast, sweet malt, hints of lemon. Highly carbonated, complex sweet finish, yeasty, crisp, lemon. Really delicious and tasty.
Light amber, slightly cloudy. The aroma is the best part, floral and honey. The taste includes malt and yeast.
Well balanced spiced ale, beautifully golden in the glass, thin head that dissipates quickly. The taste is smooth and pleasant, with a hint of banana.

Poured from keg at Thirsty Monk in Asheville, NC. Hazy golden-yellow color. White head with very little retention. Aroma was delicate and took some serious work. I might be congested, but I got some sugary sweet yeast notes. The taste had a fairly prominent Belgian yeast quality that was boozy with a decent, but light carbonation. Mouthfeel was sugary sweet and coated my mouth.

12oz bottle, BB12/2014, picked up along the way in WI/MI Sep 2013. pours a dull murky goossberry yellow-green with ok head, oily texture. Quite a refined compote/near-marmelade aroma of pear, ripe apple, white grape. Taste falls short of this aroma, delivering all mentioned ripe/autumn fruit flavours, but centering around a yeasty, sticky sugary centre that lightly coats the palate in an artificial aspartame powder sugars. Stylewise more than OK, though not my favourite kind of beer. Likeness with Delirium/Guillotine.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Thick White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Apple, Black Pepper, Belgian Yeast, Belgian Sugar

T: Apple, Pear, Belgian Yeast, Belgian Sugar

M: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Spicy

Overall, still after all these years, such a great well balanced triple, truly a pinnacle of the Unibroue brewery.

Un classique qui fait et fera toujours parti de mon top 10. La Fin du monde est, comme plusieurs amateurs de bière québécois, lune des première a mavoir fait découvrire ( et redécouvrire) le monde de la bière. dune grande qualité et toujours bien balancé, elle na rien a envié aux autres triples brassée ici. Je la considère comme étant la meilleure blonde triple de style belge au Québec.

Wow - what a good beer! Nice pour with good head, hazy in glass. Great aroma and great taste - impressed by how bold and complex both smell and taste were, but also extremely well balanced between all the fruity, spicy, malt, yeast elements. Only a hint of alcholol in the finish, but not a negative. Not heavy at all

This beer was pretty good. We tasted it at the public house in the Venetian in Las Vegas.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one presents a delectable olfactory kick. Sweet maple syrup and the yeasts are certainty prevalent as it smells like cookie dough. Thick and heavy texture. Tastes of banana, bubblegum, and syrup. Very sweet with negligible hops. Im generally not fond of sweeter brews, but this one is quite alright.

Pours hazy golden with three fingers of rich foamy head and ample carbonation. Belgian yeast aroma with grassy notes and some spice. Crisp, dry champagne-like Belgian flavor with hints of apple. I really enjoy this one. If it really is the end of the world, Im ok with this being my final beverage.
On tap at the Yard House. Gold, hazy, white head. Belgian yeast, fruit, esters, herbs, light spice. Mild sweetness, light bitterness.

Smells of Belgian candied sugar and maybe some slight fruit aromas. Taste is sweet, borders on too sweet but maybe just right for a strong triple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Citrus and a little spicy with a hint of banana? Medium carbonation. Aroma of citus. Great after taste. Overall above great beer.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Cest drole parce que la Fin Du Monde était une bière que je détestais quand jétais plus jeune. Vous savez dans le temps où on boit de la bière seulement "pour que ça tape"... Dans ce temps là je buvais surtout de la Bleue Dry, pour vous dire! Je ne laimais pas particulièrement, mais cétait facile, ça faisait la job et jétais content! Mais une Fin Du monde? Euk! Je nallais pas boire ça toute la soirée, cétait ben trop intense! Et bien, plusieurs années plus tard, la Fin Du Monde est une de mes bières préférée. Une des bières québécoises les plus rondes en bouche, les plus profondes. Elle nest pas la plus originale, ne joue pas la carte des épices, du houblon intense ou de certains ingrédients plus rares, mais ce quelle offre elle loffre dune manière convainquante : une bière aux notes belges de levure, riche et bien ronde.

2015 : Je mets ici mes notes de dégustation dune FDM 2009 ouverte côte-à-côte avec une 2015! Voyons voir comment cette bière évolue avec le temps! Au visuel, les deux sont  très, très semblables! Le temps ne semble pas faire évoluer son aspect visuel dun iota! Au nez par contre... Ouf! La version 2015 sent beaucoup plus légère alors que la 2009 a des notes fortes et sombres qui ne sont pas nécessairement agréables selon mes goûts. Il sagit probablement de madérisation, bien que javoue ne pas être convaincu dêtre en mesure didentifier les notes propres à ce processus avec précision. En bouche, cest pas mal le même principe : il y a dans la 2009 des notes en arrière-bouche de vieille levure, de  papier mouillé et de cantaloup trop mûre. La 2015 est quand à elle pimpante de vie et rafffraichissante (autant quune bière à 9% ABV peut lêtre!). Ce fût donc une expérience intéressante, mais je ne pense pas avoir envie de faire vieillir des bouteilles de FDS volontairement... La version 2015, fraiche, est bien meilleure, à mon avis.
On tap, thin white head over pale yellow beer. spicy malty nose, pleasant. very strong yeast, spice, belgian taste. slow lingering finish.

355 ml bottle for 3 bucks. Pours a hazy golden orange with a white head. At first it smelled like grapes but some spice came through as well. Taste was malty with some spice and citrus too. Body is fuller and thicker than most beers. It not bad but tripels just arent my favorite style. Overall a good beer but not something I would drink often.
This beer is as good as its name.It knocked me out nearly.End of the world! Little thick but the taste is good.I had this beer in Montreal.

On tap at APEX, PDX. Hazy light orange shade with a couple of fingers worth of head. Nice spicy, citrussy aroma. Almost a floral tinge to it. Carries those elements through in the taste. Light honey and grape with cascading spices. Very refined and stands up to the best Belgian examples.
Hazy golden amber pour. Nice head that dissipates. Flavors of apple spices and a little banana. Nice Belgian yeast. Very nice beer.

Pours a cloudy straw gold with a foamy white head and lacing. It has a great aroma of biscuit, some spices, and orange peel. The flavor is spices and some malt up front with a biscuity middle and sweet finish over a light-medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a tulip glass. TONS of aromas, heavy on the yeast. Bubble gum, green grapes, a little brown sugar and cinnamon, a hint of banana. Its a golden, apple-juice color with a thin, effervescent white head. Its got a very heavy yeast flavor thats almost a bit briny, presumably from the hops. It doesnt have a sticky-sweet finish like youd expect.

Bomber. Pours a golden orange. Very cloudy. Big white foamy head. Aroma is very sweet. Peach, apricot, yeast, malts. Taste is very sweet. Body is medium, texture is fruity, soft to medium carbonation. Deliciously sweet beer.

- Une arôme dalcool assez intense, difficile à déceler.
- Possède une couleur orangé opaque avec un léger filet de bulles recouvrant le verre et montant quelque peu sur le rebord.
- A un goût assez relativement amère avec des teintes sucrés.
- La bière offre une excellente résistance dans le palais et refuse de couler doucement. Son goût reste très présent bien après avoir avalé le liquide.

Probablement une des meilleures bière de triple fermentation sur le marché québécois en ce moment (du moins, de ce que jai pu goûter). Cette bière a su passer avec brio le test du temps et reste une excellente bière à déguster en tout temps!

Bottle thanks to Aaron. Pours a hazy orange with quickly settling fine white head, no lacing. Aroma is sweet, floral, peach. Flavor is sweet, peach, apricot, apple, sweet malt, honey, yeasty, with a mild sweet finish. Moderate carbonation, medium body, juicy texture, and mildly dry finish. An enjoyable, sweet, mildly fruity tripel.
Flesje uit een coop in Zwitserland. Goudkleurig, mooie fijnbubbelige kraag. Ruikt melig, lichtfruitig. Smaakt ook melig, gistig, flauw, vlak. Weinig nasmaak. Saai bier.
Pours a golden orange color with a white head that disipates quickly leaving little lacing. Aromas of wheat and apple. Flavors of wheat, spice, a little malt at the end. A very smooth beer.
Cloudy golden pour. Aroma of wheat and fruit. Taste is wheat, caramel, banana, clove and malts. Malty aftertaste. Very good. Well done

This pours a clear, golden yellow color with a creamy off-white head. The aroma is a mixture of yeast, banana, and spices. The taste is very fitting of Belgian brew with lots of yeast and banana in the flavor. The spices add a nice touch as it finishes with hints of coriander. Very enjoyable!

12 ounce bottle poured into a La Trapped glass. Pours a hazy pale gold with a velvety head of white foam. The aroma has dry pepper esters with some tropical fruit and banana but bread. Fairly bready. The taste is on the more mellow sweet side, and especially into the finish. Lighter in body. Sticky mouthfeel.

I keep coming back to this beer. It has this slightly sweet, peppery finish to it that is just perfect for food pairings. I believe that, when you take into account availability, this is one of the best tripels out there. Not a ton of fruit or breadiness to it, which makes it a year-round 9% indulgence. Its 75F and humid out and I am very much enjoying a glass of this. Itll be 10F with a windchill into the negatives in a few months, and I will still be opening bottles of it.

2011. Blonde dorée. Beau collet. Nez d'orange. Fruit confit. Épice. Signature levuré. Bouche: sucré. Belle effervescence. Céréale. Fruité. Ananas. Légèrement madérisé. Girofle. Muscade. Fruit confit. Anis. Abricot. Un petit délice.

Maybe it is just me, but this is pretty rough. Round three of the sampler from Trader Joes, this isnt good. Bright alcohol and yeast bitterness. Doesnt even look good, thin soap on cloudy piss (can only imagine what it would look like for people who pour in the lees). As a whole, not as bad as I am painting it, but not a good brew, and breaking it down, it is as weak as its score.

Grainy with a fruity aftertaste. Fancy blue bottle does not do it any justice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fin du Monde was my introduction to good quality beer. I was too stupid to know it back then, but I would grow to love tripels and their yeasty goodness.

Like a good summerweizen wrapped in an orange rind and fired at your head from an M-40. Powerful, tasty beer with big notes of citrus and alcohol. Pours a bright golden-honey lager with a thick white head and thins to light white lacing. 

Tasty, tasty beer, but the alcohol really makes the presence known in the flavour. Enjoy responsibly!
Bottle: Poured a orange copper with a huge white fluffy head, dissipated fast but remained thin on the top. Yeast and fruit nose that is strong. Taste is sweet fermented fruit with malt balance.
Pours a cloudy straw-like color with medium off white head. Aromas of fruits and spices with favors of the same. This one has a special place in my heart bc it was one of my gateway craft beers.
Aroma of fruits, spices and yeast. Tastes of malts and fruit. Little spicy ness. Lively carbonation. Dry finish. I enjoyed this beer.

Bottle. Poured with a light head that disappeared quickly. Light body with sweet malt and spice. Easy drinker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a whore head. Aroma of malt, fruitiness, yeast and spicy notes. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some bubblegum, caramel, fruitiness and yeast. Medium body, average carbonation.

To be honest I thought it was over rated. I love Belgians, and have heard a lot of great things about this. But I felt it fell flat flavor-wise for me. Maybe it was the bottle. I wasn't impressed by its medium body, lemony-orange colored appearance or any part of the beer at all really. So-so beer, I'd drink it over domestics. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden, moderate foamy head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is slightly acidic with notes of citrus and spice. Fizzy on the tongue with a smooth finish. Slight feeling of astringency but still fruity and pleasant. Minimal aftertaste. Overall nice but for the price...?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its a typical tripel. I dont mean that in a disparaging way because its a very nice ale, but ultimately there are many beers that taste the same and for a cheaper cost too. Worth getting if its ever an option but dont go out of your way or anything.
Bottle pour hazy gold. Nose belgian yeast, biscuit, spice some citrus. Taste similar, spice, yeast, ester, sweet mid palate. Spicy bitter finish.

Draught @ Yard House, Long Beach, CA
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, banana, clove, alcohol and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long fruity and yeasty finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Draft. Pours hazy gold with no head. Light clove and fruity and slight boozy aroma. Clove, yeasty, slight fruit flavor. Light body low carb but good.
Pours golden hazy with a medium fine head. Aroma is spicy fruit with lots of alcohol. Big mouth presence, significant carbonation, malty with some spiciness, sweet then drys out. Great beer.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 750ml vieilli 9mois. La bière a développé des arôme et goût beaucoup plus complexe que la bière non vieillie goûtée la même journée. Très belle découverte à refaire vieillir!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 Bottle. Yellow-orange pour, slightly hazy, with a thin dissipating white head. Fruity aroma, with mandarin orange, peach, and Belgian yeast. Flavour is sweet and almost syrupy, with a slightly bitter edge, reminiscent of orange marmalade or peach syrup. Bready notes and lots of Belgian yeast in the flavour too, classic Unibroue taste. A bit of caramel and apple as it warms. Dry, sweet, bready finish.

750 ml bottle with a cork poured into a goblet style glass. Pours clear straw colour with a thin, bubbly, and lasting head. Almost Champagne like. Nose has spice and pear. Very smooth taste. Spicy - cloves are present but not nearly as overpowering as I found in the Maudite. There is also fruity flavour - pear. 

I liked this beer - I disliked Maudite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden color with a finger of white head. Lots of bubbles streaming up from the bottom of the glass. Aroma is malt and spice and the taste is the same with some citrus thrown in. Little alcohol on the finish too. Really enjoyed this tripel.

Hazy apple cider orange pour with big white head that fades. Aroma of apples and spicy banana yeast. Lots of effervescence here. Alcohol hides well within the acidity of the carbonation. Taste is a yeast bomb. Bread, orange, rye flavors too. Sweet yet dry, it vanishes in the mouth as quickly as it appears, dropping a smoke bomb and disappearing like a ninja. Some alcohol warming on the finish, but its smoooth. Aftertaste of caramel. This is one of the first trippels I ever had and it has set the bar high.
This beer is almost perfect. It has incredible balance between its maltiness and its hoppiness. Its nuances of citrus are very tasteful.

This bottle didnt pop, so I suspect it might be a little off. Very thin head, color is orange/amber. Aroma is yeast, citrus, dried fruit. Taste is mildly tart, jolly rancher sour apple. Body is slick and smooth with tingly finish.
Bottle at cruise with RCC Pours a pale straw color with a thick white frothy head. Has a banana aroma and a sweet yeast flavor. Not sure about this one
Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a thin layer of creamy head. Strong aroma of yeast with hints of lemons and other citrus fruits. Taste of yeast with hints of various spices.

Cloudy Light golden. Medium fluffy, bubbly, lasting. Aroma is very yeasty, spices, light citrus, lemon. Flavor matches, but more dark fruity. Sweet. Medium body. Soft. Sweet finish. Surprisingly drinkable for the ABV. Very enjoyable.

very sweet, yeasty, lemony, light spices.
tastes similar. velvety. aftertaste was iffy for me during the first few sips, but its growing on me.

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Westvleteren XII trappist glass
From: Trader Joes in Goleta, Calif. 
Price: $8.99 for a variety 4-pack 
Purchased: July 5, 2013
Consumed: July 6, 2013
Misc.: Best before Jan. 31, 2016; Foil wrap on bottle cap

Poured an orange golden hazy color with 1-2 fingers of off-white head. Good uneven foamy lacing along the sides. Great retention all the way down.

Smelled orange rind, cloves, green apples, grapes, kiwi and faint bananas. Also unknown Belgian spices.

Tasted similar to smell. Cloves, green apples, nutmeg, sweet grapes, other sweet fruits and lemon grass. I did not do this explanation justice.

Medium body. Thin-to-oily texture. Lively-to-average carbonation. Long, smooth, crisp finish. Just goes down well.

Just so good. Im 2-for-2 (thank you Trader Joes) on this variety pack so far. Once again, just so good.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2013 341ml bottle. Pours a slightly pale golden colour with a thin white head that fades to a film. Bubbles can be seen streaming up from the glass. Smells is very slightly floral with notes of spice and citrus especially Orange peel. Taste is has hints of spice, citrus, fruits, and yeast. Medium carbonation that dances around the mouth. Light to medium body. Slightly sweet aftertaste with a small amount of alcohol warmth in the throat. Slightly lighter in taste and texture than La Fringante. A touch more of a saison taste. I?m not sure. Very interesting. More complex. Very nice brew! Will be interested to see how my large bottles age.

This is my first review but what can I say I am in love with this beer. The color is a nice cloudy golden hue. With a nice bubbly 2 finger head. The smell is fruity with spice notes mainly clove or coriander. The taste is amazing. It has a very nice fruity taste with a slight bitterness and hints of clove which for me the clove seemed to lesson after a few sips. It has just the right amount of carbonation and has a bubbly pleasant mouth feel. What else can I say this is a world class beer. I would drink again in a heartbeat. This has become one of my favorite beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of spices, orange, and cinnamon. Orange yellow with frothy white head. Smooth taste of barnyard wheat, spicy fruit, hint of raisin. Mild sweetness with a coating of bitterness at the end. High carbonation, finishes well with a warm glow.

Pours a hazy straw color with a finger of pure white head that dissipates quickly to a cap. Decent carbonation and small amount of lacing. Nose is very boozy up front. A lot of banana and clove with other spice notes. A lot of malt character. Mouth has a lot of banana and carbonation. Very sweet and spicy with a lot of clove. The malt character is once again very strong.

Bottle coutesy of chase. Pours a wild soft golden hue. Nice fluffed head that fades fast. Smells of tobacco and sweet spices. Taste is wonderfully sweet and full. Sort of like boiled eggs without the stinky taste. Very nice beer with limitless interpretations. Id drink it again.
Hints of clove and banana, with a scent of lemon on the nose.... strong flavor, this beer does not hold back. Not my favorite Unibroue beer, but still very good.

Bottle. I've heard people with issues of having watered down 12oz bottles of this, and I feel like I may have run into that issue. This review will stand for now since I don't know better, but I think this would have been better if the flavor was a little bigger.
Bottle at The Scout. Poured hazy orange with light head. Aromas of raisin and fruit. Quite smooth sweet dry taste. Good
Drinking this beer always takes me back to the first time I tried it...in an outdoor cafe in Quebec City. Life changing.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 If you like Belgium Tripel style beers this is a must try. La Fin De Monde another great example, my favourite style of Beglian beers, and this is ranked up there with some of the best in Belgium.
Espectacular cerveza, he tenido qué venir a Montreal a tomarla de nuevo, dulce, con cuerpo, un sabor de 10. La quiero de nuevo en España!!!!.
Poured from a chilled bottle into a glass. Nice golden color, sweet malt smell. Smooth triple taste.

Murky golden pour that is very bubbly with a thin white head that doesnt leave much lacing. The aroma has some faint spice to it. The taste is quite light at 9% with some good spice flavor upfront and finishing with a lingering slight bitterness. Interesting and smooth at the ABV but not worth all the hype. Good but not great!
Poured with nice one inch head, head dissipated quickly, weak earthy aroma, a little heavy on the palate, caramel flavor with hint of coriander. Overall decent.
Bottle shared by Dan. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is banana ester. Taste is bitter with a banana finish
On tap at The Foundry in KC. Pours a golden color with white head. Belgian yeasty, malty, citrus flavors.
Bottle from the six type variety mini case purchased at Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh.  Very nice and quite unique.  Loved every sip.

Fairly cloudy and the color of golden cider. Well-carbonated and a heady pour.  Rich flavor with fruity overtones and just enough hop to count.  Packs a powerful punch but you don't quite feel it coming. Well-deserving of its reputation and thank you sir may I have another. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottled, Coop, Bern  Pours hazy yellow with a thick two finger head, sweet aroma, sweet taste, bit metallic.

Bottle.  Pour a cloudy, golden yellow with bubbly white head.  Nose of spices, citrus, yeast.    Taste is lively honey, citrus, spices, clove.  Medium sweet.  One of the more refreshing tripels I have come across.  Very easy drinking and quite nice.

Golden beer. Light white head. This is a great example of a triple beer. Clove, banana, and yeast n mode and flavor. Very tasty very light, very crisp, very drinkable. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Awesome triple! Somewhat sweet maltyness, complex flavors, alcohol content is just right for the flavor.
UPDATED: JAN 8, 2015 Bottle, orange pour, white head, nose is caramel, taste is caramel, sweet, rich, nice

A - Hazy golden body with a firm 2 fingers of foam. Solid retention with minimal lacing.

S - Thick yeasty aromas. Banana, Belgian candi, golden raisins, pears, citrus and floral hops. A touch of basement dust as it warms.

T - Banana, pears, clove, lemon grass, white pepper. Wheaty malt holds strong before drying out on the finish. Mild hops provide a spicy grass character

M - Creamy, full but light body with perfect carbonation.

One of my favorite Tripels. The wheat-like malt effortlessly blends with the yeast esters and spice to create a smooth easy drinking beer.

Serving type: bottle

11-14-2011
Bela cerveja canadense, degustada na reunião da Confrabacon em Ribeirão Preto (SP), Brazil.

Tulip. Cloudy gold with a thick white head. Slightly sweet smell, notes of citrus, hopes and maybe just a bit of malts. A full bodied beer that surprisingly doesnt taste like it would be 9% ABV. Malty to begin, this changes to notes of citrus, ends a bit dry and this was the only time I really detected the alcohol taste. Pretty good.

Pretty good golden tripel... Got some good aroma ( Belgianie:)) as we as a nice sweet taste throughout... Doesn't stand out from the crowd... But good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Yellow-gold with quick-diminshing white head.  Sweet musty Belgian yeast on the nose.  Taste - sweet and mellow flavors.  Honey, spicy, maybe a touch of cinnamon, clove and belgian malt.  Even though the flavors are mellow it has a rich palate.  A top-notch tripel.

Pours a hazy yellow, floral aroma, grass and citrus favor..leaves a bit of a metallic taste afterwards. Cant tell its a 9.0% goes down smoothly if its cold enough. Dry finish on the palate. Overall good beer
Keg at West 50, 3rd may 2013. Very nice, clean and tasty, good depth of flavour and refreshing, nice Belgian yeast. Good beer, thank drank below 9%
2012.... Bomber... La fin tulip... Golden haze with minimal lacing.... Great smell and taste as usual.... Great beer.
May 2010. Bottle. Citrus and tropical fruit aromas. Pours hazy golden yellow with a white head. Flavors of malt, Belgian yeast, banana and hops. Complex and balanced.
Bottle from Trader Joes.  Cloudy gold pour.  Aroma is spicy yeast.  Taste is pear, banana, alcohol, lemon, and spicy yeast.  Body is light to medium.

light gold, rocky white head. bubblegum, citrus, floral, banana, cooked vegetables, basement aromas, alcohol. medium sweetness, lightly bitter. medium body, slick feel, fizzy. i have a really hard time dealing with the carbonation in belgian style stuff

La Fin Du Monde an Abby Tripel from Unibroue Brewery In Canada 

Aroma. Nice sweet citrusy with mild banana and orange, spice from the hops. Also light hints if the malt

Appearance. A beautiful hazy golden color with a nice white creamy head with excellent lacing 

Taste a very balanced Trappist style ale multiple fruit flavors and subtle maltiness.  With a little hop bitterness on the back end

Mouthfeel. Heavy carbonation leaves the palate refreshed for the next sip. Hides the 9%ABV very well

Overall. An Excellent Beer.  On of the best beers I have had from Canada   I am a fan of the Trappist style 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle->Trappist.  Hazy orange/gold with thin effervescent white head.  Yeast, spice citrus in a near perfect balance.  High carbonation, great mouthfeel.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a hazy golden color. Delicious well balanced triple. Good belgian yeast flavor.

Pours a hazy golden with frothy white head. Lots of yeasty booze on the notes with sweet spice. Very sweet taste and a bit of bitter finish. Overall an amazing beer and the bottle conditioner really helps provide more depth to it

Caramel, citrus, interesting. High alcohol content, quite delicious.  Another good beer from this really good brewery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells citrus and yeasty.  Murky yellow with a white head.  Complex flavor, sweet and bitter mix with a long finish.  Very yummy, 9/10!

Sweet malty aroma with aroma of toffee. Slightly opaque dark golden.  Medium body with a mild carbonation. Slight bitterness at the beginning with a a hint of sweet cranberries at the finish. Not overpoweringly alcoholic tasting which is quite appreciated for a strong-beer

On draft at World of Beers (Raleigh)

Fruity aroma. Poured cloudy with little head. Fruitiness carries over to the beer flavor.  Nice summer afternoon beer. Not too shabby on a very nice spring day, either. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden pour with medium white head of fine foam. Grainy/malty character up from with some notes of apricots, hops and bready yeast. Nice beer, but not my favourite style.
Great example of a tripel...thin head with a lot of complex flavors. Nice finish that always brings you back for another round.
Solid beer all the way around. Very balanced and refined with citrus and wheat flavors.

Pours golden yellow with minimal head. This beer has a very robust and malty flavor with a great amount of hops and yeasts used. I tasted hints of honey, and even a cheesy flavor to the finish. Excellent beer to get but a little expensive for the bottles

On tap at The Portside in Gastown, Vancouver. An orange color with a fruity nose. Fruity and spicy on the palate.  Im getting peaches and apricot flavours, and an earthy, dusty note. Very satisfying.

Pours a golden blonde. Fizzy white head. Aroma is citrusy with a yeasty backbone. Flavor is more potent than Id expect by the aroma. Quite carbonated. Wheat and citrus. Alcohol, bubblegum and banana. Quite good.
Quite tasty. Almost a hefeweiseny taste to it. Nice and thick body....................
UPDATED: APR 1, 2013 Pours hazy orange, aroma is Belgian esters and light malt.  Taste is bubbly crisp, sweet, and nice spice and yeast finish, very nice

Draft @ Trion. Banana, bready malt, Belgian yeast, and clove aroma. Hazy straw gold with a small white head. Very sweet banana, clove, bready, Belgian yeast, and vanilla flavor. Full body, moderate carbonation.

Pours a slightly murky banana-gold, with a fairly lacy, white popcorn head. Smell is of cider, tropical fruits, earthy/spicy yeast and toffee. Taste starts with sweet malts, and transitions into mild mango, pear, and spicy, earthy yeast. Very little-to-no alpha acid from the hops. Finish is grainy, and doughy, with slightly lingering spiciness. Mouthfeel is fairly carbonated and medium.

STRONG//FRUITY//SMOOTH//Smells of the finest most lively yeast and malt lots of fruit a wee bit bitter then cures you over with the sweet delicious flavor that makes you want more nice off white head and beauty dark nutty brown mmmmmmmm
From a bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a light head. Medium body and light carbonation. Slightly sweet and delicious. Tastes like raisins and caramel. Smells like pears, apricots and dates.

Bottle. Pours cloudy gold/amber with thick, creamy white head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is cookie and cereal malts, light citrus fruit, belgian yeast, grassy and floral hops, and light toffee. Flavor is bready malts forward with supporting light fruit esters, grassy hops, fresh dough, belgian sugar, and cloves; dry finish. Medium/full body and medium carbonation.

White head, poured two-finger thick. Dissipated quick. Color is golden pale with a deep haze. Aroma is banana bread, slight yeast, apricot. Taste is sweet apple, orange, pineapple.
