Palate is banana, toasty bread, slight malt and slight hop. A nice Belgian lace was left on the sides of the glass. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 Light golden. Aroma is yeasty perfection and slight fruity esters (slight citric). Definite sweetness here, but never too much. Taste is brilliant, the perfect triple balance. Like liquid honey gold. And spices. Palate is never cloying. Overall, an ABV which is ridiculously hidden makes this triple the smoothest and most exceptional. Good times.

I always see this bottle in grocery and assume I already tried but apparently not.  Pours orange yellow with nice head and nose of yeast and tropical fruits.  Tastes yeasty, of tangerines, earth, ginger, vanilla, and some wood perhaps.  Not as cloying as most triples.  Pretty good.

750mL bottle. Pours a hazy, pale apricot color with a medium white head, excellent retention and lacing. Nose is Belgian yeasty, lilies and hints of malt. Mouth is medium bodies, lots of fruity yeasts and clove up front, biscuit and bready malt finish. Really nice.

12 oz. bottle.  Served in a tulip glass.  Pours a pale golden color with a thick white head.  Highly carbonated.  Slightly musty aroma with forward nose of orange peel and cloves.  Flavor is spice, spice, and more spiceprimarily, cloves.  Did I mention cloves?  Not my favorite of Unibroues offerings, but I can see how lovers of Saison would find La Fin Du Monde exemplary.

It pours cloudy golden amber with a soapy head that leaves some residue on top of the beer.  There is a bananas, citrus and liquor quality to the aroma, and I dig that.  The flavor is delicious.  Fruity, but not overly sweet, with candied praline notes and a buttery malt.  The mouthfeel is slightly sticky, and the finish packs a little heat.
Best Canadian beer Ive found. Right up there with all but the very best Belgians. Full flavour that lasts and develops on the palate.
Cloudy, golden body with small head.  Citrusy taste and smooth feel.  Nice beer with good flavor.

Mousse plutôt abondante et neigeuse, avec une opacité toute relative mais incontestable. Couleur orange-pêche doux. Au nez, levures et houblons, et un soupçon de roses. En bouche, complexité que les yeux et le nez nannonçaient pas ; bois fort, avec des épices qui viennent brouiller les cartes, avant de sucrer le tout en fin de gorgée. Presque crémeuse et onctueuse, avec un alcool réchauffant mais	quasi indétectable au goût. Effervescence mousseuse. Un des fleurons de lunivers brassicole québécois, la Fin du Monde	a cette extraordinaire faculté dêtre parfaitement accessible à 9% dalcool. Elle nest pourtant pas parfaite (plus contenue que ses surs, et un peu aqueuse en fin de bouche), mais sait se faire largement pardonner avec son goût unique.
UPDATED: APR 1, 2013 Great aroma of Belgian yeast, candy, banana and cloves. Flavors followed but with a decent level of spice. Another really good Belgian from Unibroue.

Hazy golden hue with a white head. Aromas of dried fruit, yeast, and hints of brown sugar. Sweet malty mouthfeel with lots of complex flavors shining through. Refreshing and sweet finish great tripel.
On tap at a local joint while watching basketball.  Hazy gold color.  Belgian yeast flavors

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2013 Highly carbonated.  Aroma is of banannas, grapes, dough, and toffee.  Caramel and toffee is noticeable on the back of the pallet.  Front is of grapfruit, apples, and cherry.  Exceptional!
Hazy yellow gold with a small white head. Aroma of lemon and honey. Taste of lemon honey and yeast.  Dry finish. Very good.
Bottle (notes from tasting session). Aroma of big grapefruit, honey, medicine, candi sugar. Candi sugar flavor comes out big time, along with more medicinal stuff. Roasty. But toooooo sweet.
pours a golden with a little head, a nice breadness to the smell and taste,  creamy, overall a good brew vary drinkable.
My personal favorite thus far. It seamlessly blends all of the best qualities of a great beer; flavor, fullness, and drinkability.
Appearance is hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is a little sweet. Taste hides the alcohol well and is sweet with some strong spice. Overall very solid.

Honestly thought this was a pretty standard belgianesque ale. Pours a thick clody gold. No head at all. Has a bland fruity aroma lacking in character. Has the belgian yeasty flavor with a slight lemon hint at the end. Barely a spec of spice flavor. It tastes good, just doesnt stand out. Ive had quite a number of belgian flavored ales lately and this one is just another brick in the wall(you cant have any meat) Wouldnt buy again

Cherry/green apple fruity aroma, with some spice and earthiness. Similar fruity flavor, with peppery spice and a little Belgian-y banana. Head is large, but light, and dissipates quickly. Good high carbonation. Sweetish and bready malt flavors. Little to no alcohol flavor; and has the "warming" that a Tripel should. A little too much lingering sweetness.

Poured from a bottle into glass. Hazy gold pour. Smells fruity, yeast, bananas, spice, flowers, caramel. White head that laces a bit. Sweet up front, caramel/toffee, spices, banana, a little booze warmth at the end. Nice balanced tripel with a bit more character than most.

Poured from a corked bomber.  Cloudy, light golder, with a white head.  Lots of bubbles.  Aroma/taste of floral, grass, banana, spices, wheat, not a lot of hops or bitterness.  Good taste for a triple golden and at 9% I dont taste any alcohol.  This would be a great summer beer as it is crisp and refreshing.

Just flowery goodness!  It's such a good tasting beer. Smells citrusy and flowery at the same time and tastes that way too!  Drink one and enjoy it! One of my favorites :)

---Mr. Dizzle
On draft during the Mayan Apocalypse.  Banana and clovey aroma and flavor.  nice and light for a tripel.

Light orange to yellow, cloudy with some residue at bottom of bottle.  Aroma: grass, citrus, earthy, quite yeasty, fruity.  Taste: light hop bitterness, medium sweetness (like a wheat beer?).  Medium carbonation, medium to full body.  Very enjoyable.

12 oz. bottle poured to a Maudite tulip, displaying a cloudy, orangy gold color, with soft white fluff for a head, and wavy cling to the lacing. The aroma was mild yeast, spicy hop, citrus as orange, mid-fruit as apricot, a touch of sweetness, and a light tartness. The flavor was very similar, with a medium body, spritzy carbonation, and mild hop bitterness that seemed to combine some light, peppery phenols with a hint of sulfur. Nicely hidden alcohol, and flavorful quaffability nonetheless.
Ah, thats the stuff. Hazy golden orange with a sizeable white head. Aroma is fruity, Belgian yeast and some spice. Taste is fruity and peppery.
Thick foamy top. Smells fruity. Beautiful golden amber colour. Very robust malty flavour that lasts on the tongue. Perfect for The End of the World.

2013/01/27 - Pours a hazy golden orange with a frothy off white head that leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is yeast, spices, banana, pears, oranges and apricots. Taste is yeast, banana, apricots, sweet malts and apples with a slightly boozy finish. Very nice, but a little sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is the best Ive tasted. Pours a lovely gold yellow with a billowy head. Aromas of fruits and spice. Flavors of apricots, bananas, and the most wonderful malt flavors with a spiced finish. Less alcohol flavor than I expected. Excellent.
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 Triple fermentation! This beer has a really nice cloudy yellow colour. The flavour is nice. Has that distinct unibroue yeast. For sure worth a try!

Bottle from beer fridge at the lake...golden yellow with thick frothy head...quickly dissipates.  Nose and initial taste is all spice, cloves and pepper.  Sour edge...really good...tasty.  Have to get back to the lake and have another before sherm1016 returns!

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2013 Pours deep golden, half finger head thick lacing dissipates slowly.  Spice, cloves, fresh dough malt dominate the aroma. Spice, clove, fruity yeasty esters front of the mouth, fresh dough malt, spicy, fruity mid mouth, sweet, slight alcohol, fruit, clove finish. Lots of carbonation, peppery spice, slight alcohol heat, medium body. Overall very good, I would like to see it a bit dryer, a little less carbonation, still am A beer.

Golden yellow pour with a thick yellow-white head. Aroma is fruity. Very balanced taste: banana, malt, a bit of nuttiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Solid tripel. Nice sweet flavor. Exceptionally well balanced, although a bit uninteresting nevertheless -- the brewer nailed it, but maybe it's almost too close to the ideal? Nevertheless, quite good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle, procured from the beer fridge at the lake.  Pouts a bright, clear yellow color with a big white head.  Aroma is yeasty, banana, clove. Medium on the palate with soft, creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, bready, spicy, clove, a little bitterness on the back, with a light spicy finish.  An excellent tripel.

Belle biere de couleur orange voile. Elle degage des aromes dorange floral et depices. Au gout on y retrouve presque les meme agrement toutefois lorange est moins presente quau nez. En gros la meilleur abbey tripel que jai bu dans ma vie.

Un très bon classique de chez Unibrou. Très bonne biere avec une légere consistance. Au nez, elle a lair famillier présent dans la ligné dunibrou. Une certaine acidité est resenti en bouche parmis les nombreuse saveur dépice. Malgré sont bon pourcentage dalcool, je concidere quil ne se fait pas trop ressentir.

Aroma is of sweet fruit banana, pear, apricot. Pours a nice golden haze color with a bubbly frothy white head. Taste is sweet with caramel apricot pear banana and a little bit of clove. Notes of orange peel. Very well done Tripel.

Bouteille 341ml. De couleur dorée-orangée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes) et épicées (clou de girofle, léger de poivre et de coriandre), léger dalcool et de grains de malt avec quelques traces de caramel. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures assez épicées (poivre et clou de girofle, léger de coriandre) et moyennement fruitées (agrumes, notes de poires, traces dananas) lors de lentrée en bouche  auquel se rajoute un léger goût de grains de malt sucrés avec des notes de caramel puis en finale lon retrouve une légère chaleur dalcool avec une légère amertume de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen,composé dun léger goût de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes) aux notes épicées avec des notes de houblon herbeux et des traces dalcool.

Pours a golden orange with medium head that leaves nice lacing. Aromas of banana, clove, prominent Belgian yeast, and spice. Taste is much of the same with a warm alcohol touch and malty sweetness. Finish is sweet and has a medium mouthfeel.

12 oz. bottle poured a cloudy,light amber color with a bright white bubbly head into a Duvel tulip. 1 finger head thats spent after about a minute leaving a tiny ring at the edge of the glass.. Aromas of yeast,clove & orange peel,alcohol. Medium-high carbonation with flavors of orange peel,cloves,biscuit reminiscent of a Franziskaner Hefe. slightly tart at the finish with a alcohol burn. I havent had too many Belgian ales but have been drinking them more frquently lately ie. GI Pere Jacques, Duvel, etc.
This reminded me of a strong GI Matilda.This may have been the first tripel Ive had. Very nice. Will have again.

A very tasty trippel!  Less nose than others; and not great to look at.  Easy to drink but a more substantial taste than others.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mmmmmm....nice trippel.  Could drink this all day if only my wife would let me.   Pour from bottle, cloudy golden color, mild white head. Nose is strawberry, bananna bread and alcohol.  Pretty much the same flavor, with maltomeal and light hop chaser. Moderately high carbonation. Really easy to drink. Great on a warm afternoon, cold a.. morning, middle of the night, after breakfast........pretty much any time!

341 ml. Blonde brumeuse, avec mousse qui ne dure pas très longtemps. Odeur fruitée d'agrumes. Gout de blonde belge très réussi: bon dosage d'alcool, de carbonation, de malt... La meilleure bière d'Unibroue!

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2013 This poured a hazy sunshine yellow with a tall head of loose bubbles that receded to  an attractive collar and cap. Good lacing and alcohol legs.  On the nose is plenty of yeast, sweet malt, sugary lemon and tangerine.  On the palate its buttery smooth, spritzy carbonation and a little thin.  It reminds you of a hefe with a little banana but its too sticky and the alcohol warms you and gives it away that this is a tripel. Short sweet finish, no hops on the palate at all.  Understated and bewitching.  This is a very well turned out tripel that would meet the end of the world with an attitude of aplomb.
Aroma is apples, cloves, booze. Appearance is golden yellow and hazy. Taste is malty, apples, booze. Mouthfeel is average. Overall, I severely dislike the style, so theres that.
Hazy golden color, poured from a bottle. Enjoyable tripel with some honey and fruit notes.
Excellent for the price.......you can order through Costco Liquors for about $7 per bottle

A:  A clear golden beer with a thin but sturdy layer of white foam on top.

S: The smell of sweet apples, juicy fruit and yeast. There is also a touch of alcohol.

T: The spice comes out much more in the flavor than it does in the aroma. A lot of clove and nutmeg with some fruity esters and a hint of yeast.

M: Medium body with more carbonation than I prefer. 

D: Not one of my favorite Belgian trippels.  A little too sweet for my taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. I used to love this beer, but my interest in Tripels has come and gone in recent years. However I figured that I needed to cycle back and rate this one for old times sake, and I am glad I did! Pours hazy golden yellow with a medium white head and some lacing. Aroma is yeasty with strong fruit notes including green apple, and light spices (coriander). Taste is about the same, lightly sweet, no bitterness. Body is medium with a ton of prickly champagne-like carbonation tickling the tongue. I (still) like it!

When folks ask me what my favorite beer is, I say this.  Epitomizes what I want in a beer.  Noticeable ABV - check.  complex belgian profile - check.  Bottle big enough to share the joy with friends - check.
From a 12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy pale orange with an off white head.  Orange zest and yeast dough aroma.  Notes of lemon, coriander and bubblegum.  Tart bitter finish.  Nice Tripel.
Aromas of bread, clips fruit, and spice. Golden with a lot of bubbling and a firm white head. Balanced but a touch sweet. Crisp medium bodied with a snappy bitter finish.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2013 Cette triple jaune légèrement voilée, titrant 9 % dalcool, mérite ma note parfaite pour être une de mes bières favorites à ce jour. Au bouquet, il me semble évident que le miel au trèfle est prédominant. En bouche, le goût sucré et de céréales quon attend dune triple est au rendez-vous. Belle finale sèche, arrière goût agréable. Bière très belle au visuel avec une mousse parfaite. Verre éponyme à se procurer. Cheers!

It has a cloudy orange pour with a beautiful full head. The aroma is sweet and promises a slightly different flavor than I experienced. As others point out there is a hint of fruits including banana. A good flavor but I can't enjoy more than a glass. The higher ACL is well hidden in the flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hops and yeast almost a wheatish aroma. Pours a murky yellow-orange with thick white lingering head. Thick velvety mouthfeel. A slight honey sweetness. Bready. The mildest of hops flavor.

The embodiment of its style. On tap and proper stemware at Antons Tap Room, Kansas City. Pours a hazy gold, fuzzy  big bubbles in a quickly dissipating head. Read all the reviews as Ill only be repeating whats already been said.

It has a wonderfully full head on a heavy pour, and it smells like typical belgian yeast, banana and clove. However the taste is much more complex with a taste of baked apples and cereal grain. The hops hit the back of the tongue so this beer isnt a sweet bomb, making it perfectly balanced in every way. La Fin du Monde is the class of Canadian triples, and is among the best made in the entire world.
Absolutely delicious stuff. Gorgeous aromas on the nose. Smooth and easy too drink. Always have some on hand.
330ml bottle. Spicy, yeasty aromas. Pours hazy golden, white head, some lacing. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is yeasty, spicy, some citrus, banana. Dry aftertaste. Enjoyable.
Growler to taster. Looks solid; a mostly transparent orange with white lacing. Smells doughy and yeasty. Tastes like it smells with some spice. Good on the palate. A solid example of the style.

Cloudy light orange pour with thin head. Complex nose, mostly grass and wheat but hints of banana and other fresh fruit. Malty flavor, hardly notice the higher alcohol content. Fresh fruit lingers in the long finish.

Very good.  Slight grain, citrus, white grapefruity aroma.  Appearance is clean, clear, pale yellow, soft foam head.  Taste is very nice, flavorful soft winey & grapey light crisp with wit style yeast.  Palate is nice, not saturated, balanced.  Soft inviting, easy to drink but hides its abv well. Awesome

Bottle at the parentals. Pour is hazy lemon peel, with a frothy, long-lasting white head. Citrusy/tangy aroma, banana, lemon peel, biscuit, clove, and coriander. Taste is big banana and clove, with complimentary notes of biscuit, citrus, wax, and white pepper with a big spicy finish. Creamy mouthfeel with crisp carbonation and dryness on the finish. Very nicely crafted; fruity, spicy, crisp and dry. Delicious!
Strong and spicy flavor. Quite the aftertaste.  A one drink beer. .............

On tap @ Specific Gravity, Salisbury Md-Cloudy golden pour w/a slight head. Sweet belgian aroma. Sweet fruit flavor, yeast, banana, candied sugar, some spice/cloves. Smooth & easy to drink, very enjoyable. Liked everything Ive had from these folks, gotta look for them more often

Pours a hazy yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma has spicy/yeasty notes...notable clove.  Flavor has a hint of juicyfruit and significant clovey spice...nice subtle bitterness.  Mouthfeel is medium and silky with a dry clovey/fruity finish.  Very spice forward tripel.
Not too crazy about the aroma. Prickly carbonation. Decent. good. Nothing that really makes me want to try it again. Medium body.

Unibroue sized bottle supplied by, and shared with, ck1 after the end of the world, thanks bro! Pours a banana color with a white head. Nice lacing. Aroma has sweet fruits, spices and some earthiness. Taste is of banana, cloves, cinnamon and tangy fruit. Smooth and sweet. Very little alcohol presence. Finishes sweet with spices. Very tasty and enjoyable.

Golden hazy pour with thick creamy white head. Aroma of citrus and banana.  Smooth complex citrusy flavor with alcohol umph. Long acidic finish.  Great beer.  One of my favorites.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cerveza de caracter tipico de su estilo. Genial con quesos fuertes. Beber a temperatura ambiente. Cuerpo solido y cabeza espumosa. el paladar es largo, pero su aroma es leve en comparación. Y si, me la tomé en el supuesto fin del mundo...

à la votre!
UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 2011 bottle. A little bit of age did this brew well just a fantastic beer. A little bit of citrus up front with some rich and complex notes on the way down
Good beer just wish it had a little more bite on the tail. I would drink it again. I bet it would be great on tap.
Pours amber with large tan head that is quick to dissipate. Aroma of cheese, cereal, toast, and grass. Sweet and sour, not my favorite combination but fairly well done here.

Golden, hazy, fluffy head. Dry, biscuity, cracker-like malt, floral and slightly perfumy aromas, some peppery phenols, some light pear-like fruity notes. Touch of residual sweetness in finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden pour with a thick white head. Bread malt, doughy yeast, some sugar, grass, coriander and other spices. Reminds me of a Belgian witbier. Spicy taste, crisp and somewhat light bodied - masks the alcohol content quite well.

On tap a Global Brew for an end of the world celebration.  Pours a hazy gold with a full white head.  Has a bread dough and spice aroma.  Taste is sweet pale malt, with just a little banana and clove to enhance the experience.  very good brew, and the ABV goes unnoticed  in both the taste and after the swallow.
This is a great trippel. Pours golden with a lovely white head. Great aroma of spices. Has a yeasty taste and a medium mouth feel. Definitely worth picking up.

Pours a hazy golden yellow on tap with fluffy white head and good lacing. Aroma of belgian yeast, banana, wheat, slight citrus. Taste is sweet, tart fruits and belgian yeast. Alcohol is well hidden and good overall, but nothing too special once you have had better.
Bottle and Draught.  This is an odd duck of a Tripel.  Its slightly less sweet and slightly more yeasty than I am used to.
Decent maltyness  with stong spice flavor.  Not much aroma, but good enough to drink on this day.

Bottle thnx to Duffman. Found this beer to be appropriate for this evening. This pours a lovely bright, hazy orange beer with a beautiful white head. Aroma is very yeasty, sugary and certainly has some malts in it. Flavor is nice and sweet, soft and subtle mouthfeel. This is how a decent tripel should be. Definitely one of the best Ive had.

A fitting brew to drink for the impending apocalypse. On tap! Silky smooth, creamy body approaches perfection. Rich malts, a kiss of Belgian yeast and spice, hints of sweetness and more malt. I always forget how good this is. Superb.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2013 The aroma of this beer is reminiscent of sour white grapes, flowers, and freshly baked bread, and the appearance is a cloudy golden amber color with a bubbly consistency and a large white head that fades quickly to a small white head that stays on the top of the liquid. The taste is quite sour, mildly sweet, and a touch umami, and the mouthfeel combines a medium body, lively carbonation, slick texture, and a long finish.
Cloudy yellow, nice foamy head, yeasty sweet aroma and flavours. Very nicely balanced

Pours a cloudy yellow with a small head that leaves no lacing.  Aroma is spicy bananas, cloves, coriander and pepper.  Taste is a sweet-and sour medley of bananas, funky spices and coriander.  Palate is alive, bubbly like champagne.  Alcohol is well hidden but you still get a slight taste - nothing overbearing.  Overall a great tripel and another home run from Unibroue.

Pours golden yellow with a very heavy haze. Good head retention with bright white head. Aroma comes off skunky/sour but quickly fades into spice. Very spicy with a slight malt and banana clove similar to a hef but spicy. Palate is very small and disappears very quickly. Finishing with alcohol mouth feel. Overall a good strong beer. 
Favorite part: spicy strong belgian

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml corked and caged bottle bought at Super 1 in CDA, ID. Best Before 1/12/15. Pours hazy yellow with a large off-white head with good retention. Aroma is initially skunky (this goes away pretty quickly), but leaves behind a banana and clove presence. Taste is sweet and savory, spicy (peppery, clove, coriander), alcoholic; finishes with a little tanginess. Has a slightly watery mouthfeel. Nice tripel.

Draft at the Khyber. Hazy honey gold pour with a pillowy lacey white head. Grassy. Floral. Orange. Dry hops mixed with amber fruits. Complicated delicate mix. Some caramel in the mix but not nearly as chewy as some Belgium Quads (i.e. La Trappe) but a very nice malt presence. Mostly a grassy sage thyme herbal mix with some apricots and kumquats. Decent palate. Quite nice.

Bottle. Spicy aroma with maybe a hint of fresh grass. Hazy light golden color with a thin head. Fizzy with a robust spicy taste - cloves, ginger, orange and a bit of malt. Slightly on the sweet side. Great feel in the mouth. Very nice and refreshing.

It had been a long time since i first tried this beer. I didnt care for it back then but time has changed my mind. Slightly cloudy yellow color, bubbly but not much retention our lacing. Nose is Belgian yeast and coriander. Body has bite. Bread, coriander, citrus bitters, dry in the mouth.

Carbonation is soft on this one. Smell is spicy, but I can not make out any specific one (cloves, pepper, etc.). Sexy looking with a big white fluffy head. Im not a fan of most tripels, but tonight its ok. Overall this one is a bit inferior to the Fringante I just had earlier. Nice beer, classic Unibroue here.

12 oz. bottle at the Brown Derby Walt Disney world. Pours hazy bright orange with a tight sudsy head that rest to a thin film and collar. Aroma is fruity yeast some spice and a nice malt character. Palate is medium chalky and drying. Solid!

slightly cloudy, dark golden pour with a thick foamy white head.  smelled both sweet and sour... lot of fruit sweeetness on the tongue up front with a sour dry, tart finish.  Not much bitterness, at least not compared to what I was expecting based on what else I had read about this beer.
Bottle at the tavern in orlando....strong spice malt aroma... taste is orange malts.veey mild hopps...  delicious
Nice dark amber color with a medium white head. Really flavorous beer : aromas are spices, banana, clove, yeast and honey. Medium body, fizzy carbonation. A great one !

750 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a lightly cloudy, bright golden yellow with modest-sized white head.  Aroma is bursting with musty Belgian yeast - notes of banana, apple, clove and pepper.  Flavour very Belgian too - lots of tropical-ish fruit including banana, apple/pear and , somewhat sour/somewhat sweet with a real clove and pepper spiciness.  Alcohol is fairly subtle.  Quite nice.

Pours a bright, cloudy yellow with a fizzy looking, quickly fading white head.  Pleasing aroma has banana, pineapple, spices, and honey.  As happy as I am with the taste, I am even more so with the flavor.  It has a spicy notes, clove, banana, and lots of Belgian yeast.  Slightly sour and dry when drinking, with a spicy, yeasty aftertaste.  Medium bodied with a foamy texture, as well as fizzy carbonation.  The alcohol content hides itself well here.  It really doesnt feel or taste like a 9% beer.  It feels very Belgian altogether.  This is a very good beer.
Golden colour, bright white foamy head. Has a sweet Tripel flavour with some banana and clove and some peppery yeast. Very soft feel, easy to drink.

Great belgian type beer. Very tasty and spicy. not bitter not sweet. Easy to drink and combine with any food

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle enjoyed by myself over the course of an evening. Poured into Leffe glass - no head, but lots of sparkly champagne action. Aroma is alcoholic and sweet (Listerine). Slightest of lace. Uninteresting pale colour (Lovibond 5/6). Taste doesn't disappoint though. Sharp bite of alcohol and a sweet initial tang. Finish is balanced though. No aftertaste to speak of. Dry mouth. Leaves a squeaky soapy mouthfeel on the palate. Pretty good.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2013 Ambrée opaque avec une mousse moyenne blanc. Larôme de levure, dhoublon (parfum légèr dagrumes), et alcool. Carbonation moyenne. Cest aussi sucré comme du syrop ou peut-être du miel. Un gôut fort et légèrement épicé. Un peu de malt et houblon, sucré mais pas trop. Lalcool ne sort pas dans le goût mais il y a definitivement une chaleur. La finale est très similar au goût initiale.

One of my favorites. Also reasonably priced. Awesome complexity. A unique beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy golden straw colour with a bit of head that dissipates quickly and a good bit of active carbonation. Smell is quite sweet, a bit spicy with some yeasty goodness, and a bit of fruitiness. Palate is medium bodied with quite active carbonation and a bit of an oiliness in the aftertaste. Taste is typical Quebec Belgian, nearly on style but with a bit of a plastic taste, aftertaste is a bit sweet, just like the initial taste. Not bad overall.
Ah, thats the stuff. Hazy golden orange with a sizeable white head. Aroma is fruity, Belgian yeast and some spice. Taste is fruity and peppery.
Draft! Pours hazy golden hay with a slight white head. Aroma is sweet, spicy, white bread. Taste is slightly hoppy, but especially spicy belgian yeast. Nice funk, crisp, dry finish.
Bottle. Pours a dirty yellow with medium head.  The flavor is slightly spicy wi some fruity orange flavors.  Ok overall.

Light tan and slightly cloudy. One finger head that leaves some good lacing.

Smells a bit like pineapples and pears with a slightly floral, yeasty, clove-like background.

Tastes absolutely great, a terrific tripel. Sweet light fruity flavors, bananas, apples, pears; cloves and yeast accent a beautifully spicy, peppery malt backbone.

Lovely to drink. Just a hint of warming, but virtually no trace of the taste of alcohol at any point in the experience. Rich and smooth mouthfeel, a great example of how good a tripel can be.

La Fin Du Monde has a thin, fizzy, champagne-like, white head, and an initially clear, extremely bubbly, yellow-golden appearance, with a bit of lacing left behind. This beer really clouds up after one swishes and pours in the sediment. The aroma is of sweet, spicy, lightly bready malts, and the flavor is the same, with some sourness, grapefruit, sugar, hard candy, and spice cake (the taste of which grows after the swish & pour operation). Mouthfeel is light to medium, and La Fin Du Monde finishes mostly dry and pleasant. Alcohol is barely detected, and drinkability is super. Overall, this is a sure winner, and I think it is outstanding. RJT
Wow!!!! Golden orange color, I smell banana, clove, lemon yeast and raisins. I taste all of the same and more! One of the best I have had!!!
Hands down, my favorite beer. Amazing aroma and a taste that keeps you coming back for more.
smells and taste more like a german-style of beer ( heffen ive heard from the other guys. wouldnt know, cant tell them appart) sweet, not that complex. drinkable...

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 Golden orange color..aroma of banana, clove and honey notes..quite smooth palate for the high abv...pear, apple and spiciness on the finish..quite impressed with the flavor profile and all around goodness..Much better with about 1 yr at least of age..recently tried a fresh bottle and it was like two totally different profiles..
12oz bottle.  Fantastic beer.  Spicy & incredibly easy to love, youll remember your first.  Fun times.
Nice medium ale with great spicing.  Frothy head and medium sweetness.  Not quite as good as the similar Don de Dieu.

Bottle is a bout 2.5 yrs old, enjoy by date of 9-17-12, well aged.

Crazy foam in the pour, surprisingly sharp and boozy for a 2 year old bottle, more bitter than some good tripels I have tried, doesnt really knock me out, I have had better, definitely drinkable but there are some less expensive options that are better.  Average.

12 oz bottle to a Duvel tulip. Pours cloudy golden yellow with a finger of white head and decent lacing. Aroma is banana, lemon, coriander, orange, white raisins, and barnyard funk from the yeast. Taste is lemons, funky Belgian yeast, sour bubblegum, apples, white raisin, coriander, and a little clove and banana. Mouthfeel is medium and easy to drink. Alcohol pretty well hidden. Great beer.
341mL bottle pour.  Dark golden colour nice head.  Spiced yeasty funk aroma with some malty hints. Very nice medium sweet with light sour tastes that fill your whole mouth followed by a dry finish.

Bomber.  Pours a cloudy gold with thick off white head and minimal lacing.  Nose is honey, pepper, yeast, and funk.  Taste is well balanced - funk, yeast, pepper, somewhat sweet but dry.  One of the finest triples.
Yeasty with fruity apple notes. Well balanced for a Belgian Abbey. Slightly higher ABU masked by the yeast. Rich flavor but not overpowering.

Pours a very pretty, lightly clouded gold with a giant foamy head. A lot of bread and spiced citrus on the nose. Taste is strong yeast, grapefruit, bread, and a little alcohol. Nicely bitter finish, not too strong. Good stuff.
. Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm........ Ndndncndjdjrjrjdbsjdidjejejejdudjehdbdhdudjdhehegh

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 Bomber sampled @ RBBSG 2012 - Left -over edition. Thx. to Vincent I believe. Pours a bright apple golden, solid white head. This is quite sweet with plenty of banana, white bread, light hops, sweet spices, soft malts, white sugar, bubblegum, esters, soft peaches and flowers, very well-done, different, almost german touches, better than most local stuff /// Tried again, wonderful beer, lots of bubblegum, I get the love but this is not a Tripel, it doesnt even feel BE inspired to me. This reminds me far more of DE, this has more in common, taste-wise with a Hefe than any Tripel made in BE that I have tried so far.
Poured a clear golden color with a fluffy, long lasting white head. Aroma is banana, clove, apple, lemon, raisin, ginger, and sweet. Taste is grapes, banana, pear, melon, with a dry finish. Love it.

Great beer. A spicy mouthfeel which leads to a clean finish with hints of pears or fruit 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml bottle in Geneva Switzerland. Pours a nice dark amber with a fine off white head. (warning a gusher) Aroma is maple, walnuts and sweet fruit. Taste is very mellow for style and smooth and really complex and tasty. The alcohol is not overwelming like a lot of beers of this type. Best beer of this trip. Even if it traveled futher than I did.
An amazing beer perfect body and color if you come to Canada try this you will love it

Pours a hazy golden sunrise color with a tremendous towering white head that slowly dissipates in chunks leaving a rocky lace and spider webs across the glass. Nose is of fruity esters with notes of banana, clove, bubblegum, and a bit of spicy alcohol. Fairly full in body with a very fine champagne-like carbonation that is oh so smooth. Taste begins with a good deal of fruitiness (nectarine, pear, peach, mango, and white grape) and flowery honey blended with peppery clove. Next comes some powdery yeasts and a bit of bready malt followed by a touch of drying alcohol

Look: lighter shade of honey gold with a 3 finger white head. Smell: Lemon, spices, pepper, corriander, yeast, wet straw and faint honey. Taste: Follows the aroma nicely, wheat malt sweetness, citrus tart, peppery dry finish. Feel: Light body with lively carbonation. Overall: This is a solid Tripel. Better than some Ive had. Only one thing that lets you know it is 9% is a slight warmth in the finish. Recommended.

La Fin du Monde, the beer that woke out of lager-induced stupor and put me on the right path. Still love it to this day, to the point where I will happily buy a $75 case of 750ml corked bottles to cellar away. Fresh from the store, the alcohol has a sizeable part of the aroma and taste, but after letting it sit quietly for a few months that will settle down and the rich fruit and malt will take over. Also helps if you give the bottle a gentle swirl while upside down to get the yeast in; smoothes out the flavours and adds a subtle toastiness.

Pours a cloudy bright yellow hue with a large, fluffy head that took some time to subside. Nose is musty tripel yeast and grain, but contains a sparkle that is sort of citrusy in quality. Taste is all that, strong tripel yeast funk, and lots of spice (I can go with citrus, coriander, and clove as others have suggested). Hard to get too much malt or cereal as the yeast and spice flavors are so dominant. Feels a little heavy on the palate, so perhaps could be classed as sweet, but thankfully isnt too sticky. A good, clean, tasty golden tripel considering the strength of the flavors and high gravity.
First Triple Golden Ale that Im aware that Ive had.  Golden color.  Taste was smooth and rich.  Much richer than normal ale.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2012 Bought a case of bottles cost me 75 bucks. It pours a thick yellow cloudy golden hue. The abv% is hidden great. Great powerful  flavors that last on the palate. Over its worth a try. It?s a very unique abby.

Bottle from Kensington Wine Market, Calgary. It pours clear straw yellow, with a thick white head. The nose is spicy yeast, farmyard, hay, straw, underlying sweetness (like icing sugar) and mouldy wood. The taste is farmyard, spice, honeysuckle melon, pear, pear drops, red apple, white grape, medicinal notes, straw and underlying alcohol warmth, with a dry, spicy finish. Medium body and high, harsh carbonation. Interesting, but Im not a great fan of the style and the carbonation is too much.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2013 First beer that I?m going to have to say is over rated. Good smell of cereal & breads on the nose and pours a nice golden color with a big white head. Taste is a bit sour with the alcohol not being hid well. Maybe I just got an off bottle.
cereal, toast, floral, golden, hazy, frothy, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, creamy, lively carbonation
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2014 bottle. golden with small head. sweet and tart with plenty of yeast. slight citrus. alcohol pretty well masked.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle at Ava's Pizzeria and Wine Bar in St. Michael's, MD. 

Hazy, sparkling bright gold with 2-finger ivory head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of lemon, coriander, banana, clove, caramel, apple and yeast. 

Taste of banana, orange, sweet caramel, coriander, yeast, citrus and clove. 

Medium body and high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bouteille 341ml. Couleur ambrée, mousse blanche. Arôme dagrumes, de citron, de levure, avec un côté sucré. Goût de levure, de malt, de citron. Carbonation moyenne.

Blond beer, white head. Aroma of candy, sweets (zuurtjes), citrus, dark fruit esters. Light sour flavour, light sweet, sweet malts, light hops. Light bitter finish, sweet malts with fruity yeast notes..
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBSG II, Wilrijk. Courtesy of tderoeck. Thanks Tim!)

Dark, cloudy, golden/orange color, with very generous head.  Aroma is of bread, yeast, some citrus.  Flavors are earthy, doughy, basement.  Some bitterness, and the alcohol taste is definitely present, though not overpowering.  Pretty good overall.

On tap, pours hazy, orange. Great smell. Citrus, wheat. This is a good beer. Smooth. It has gotten sweeter as I have started drinking other beers, but this is still very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I too do not buy into the hype, good beer but so many better ones. almost like a hoegarden?? Damm, I heard so many good things about this!! Dont get me wrong, its still good, I was just expecting more.

04.08.2012. 12 fl.oz. Big Bowl, Ohio St, Chicago. Golden colour with white head. Very strong citrus aroma. both sweet and sour. Lively carbonated. Wheaty. Sweet with notes of strawberries or some kind of summer floral stuff! Aftertaste, bitter with notes of green apples.

Da el pego...así se puede resumir esta cerveza CANADIENSE. Si se puede considerar una cerveza de calidad...sus maestros cerveceros han sabido darle una característica presente en otros caldos triples de paises bajos mucho más conocidos. No es nuestra cerveza favorita, pues el tránsito resulta demasiado alcohólico y cansado...es verdad que las trlples no son el adalid de la bebida refrescante.

A classic go-to Belgian style beer. Good for any occasion. Pour a hazy pale color. The smell has citrus notes, alcohol, sourdough, and of course a slight yeasty funk. All around, wonderful taste that is well balanced, subtle, and drinkable. If the world to end tomorrow...not a bad selection for tonight.

Poured from bottle into glass.  Awesome!  Sweet palate with citrus flavors and full body.  An awesome beer that is good at any time. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

at RBBSG thx to Tderoeck(?) for sharing !! 
Head: white 
Colour: hazy blond 
Smell: yeasty, citric, malts, some wheats 
Taste: typical unibroue carbonation, malts, citric, some dose of sweet hops and yeast, dry bitter taste, some sweetcorn in the end , pretty nice !

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2012 S: Very interesting - doughy, lemon citrus, slight alcohol and must
A: Gold, slightly hazy - Great foamy/creamy/frothy head, leaves a substantial lacing
T: Follows the nose - yeasty lemon citrus. strong malt character.  Clove and spices as well. Increasingly interesting with warmth
P: Medium to full bodied - kinda sticky with soft carbonation
O: Great tripel from a great brewery

Exceptional. The first time I tasted this beer it was a favorite.

roasty, citrus, banana, woody,
Light foamy head over hazy yellow body. Aroma of yeast, banana, coriander, and Clove. Taste of yeast and banana. Feels like a glorified wit beer.
Cant believe that I havent rated this yet. Great tripel. One of the best you can find produced outside of Belgium. Notes of lemon, corriander, white pepper, and banana. Damn fine beer. Very smooth.

One of the best I have ever had.  Best in a specialty glass and slightly chilled because it releases the sublte flavors that Unibroue incorporates into this masterpiece.  I have had many friends state the flavor from caramel to citrius as well as some odd ones like "The smell of new leather"... makes one think about their friends a little more intently.

I really don't understand it. Picked up a bottle to settle in with some breaking bad. Poured nice, smell was amazing, but  the spice notes killed every other aspect of this beer. I read reviews of pear and banana, pineapple and yeast. But all I tasted was clove and spice. Taste improved a bit as the beer neared room temp, but not much.  I will try again...someday. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750 ml Bottle. Quite hazy, yellow orange appearance with a white head and not much lacing. Nice tripel with some fruit notes I recommend it.
My go-to tripel for a few years. Sweet, spicy and malty.  Complex and meant to be sipped. Evolves and gets bigger as it slowly warms; hides its ABV well.
Sampled at RBBSG. Hazy yellow color, no head. Smell malts, yeast, some orangepeel. Taste malts, fruits, orangepeel. Quite high carbonated, medium body.

A-- Poured a cloudy straw yellow color. Yeast had not settled when pouring. Beer is also a bit too cold about 5-6 c. Short lived bright white head that became film too quickly. Very good head retention though and able to get a 1 finger head after a few swirls of the glass. Once warmer the beer holds the head much longer and shows more carbonation. Beer shows wine like legs of an upper ABV%.

S-- Sweet bread, apricot, white grape, green apple, banana, and clove. Citrus and apple come out more as it warms up. ABV is very well hidden with the aroma. Becomes more complex and the flavors change as it warms up. ABV is well hidden with the aromas.

T-- Large dose of sweet bread followed by banana, clove, and green apple. More it warms the citrus becomes a bigger player in this. Mostly lemon but a bit of pineapple as well.

M-- Highly carbonated, lively, and creamy. Sweet bread followed by citrus tartness to it. A bit of the apple crispness in the end. No real hop presence. Mostly about malt and the yeast. A little bit of an ABV burn at the end and it does get bigger as it warms up more.
This beer has great balance with a hint of citrus and spice.  It has beautiful color and goes down smooth. I would definitely recommend it...if you can find it...

Not my favorite beer, but with that said, its still a great beer. Bready sweet yeast on the aroma some nice fruit notes maybe some banana, pairs well with the nice fluffy head. Looks delicious in the glass orange with some yellow. First your mouth is bathed in smooth bready yeast and then some spiices clove and maybe nutmeg then a slight citrus crisp clean finish.
I must start my saying Im not a fan of this style of beer.  With that said, probably the best tripel Ive had.  Very good looking beer.  I would try again.  Not too spicey - I likey.
So complex and yet so well blended. Definitely one of my favorites and arguably the best tripel on the market. Wish this was available closer to me. Worth every penny and more.
Great smooth taste with a crisp finish.  A fine triple that doesnt have the usual strong triple bite.  Best served very cold.

Bottle @ home (re-rate). Previous rating was a 4.7 but that seemed overly high, so I figured a re-rate was due. Quite hazy, yellow orange appearance with a white head and not much lacing. Fairly spicy yeasty, peppery, banana, tangerine citrusy, bready aroma. Moderately fruity (banana, lemon, orange, tangerine), clove, black peppery, white bread, wheat malty flavor. Really a tasty tripel with some very nice fruit notes that are balanced by a spiciness from the yeast. There is a bit of booze but nothing very offensive. Really a nice beer. (4.3)

caramel, cereal, resin, grass, floral, citrus, earthy, banana, bubblegum, golden, hazy, frothy, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, lively, astringent, bitter, light spicy heat

A great tripel - having been to Belgium and loved the beer, and being a Canadian, its great to see a Canadian brewer do such an exceptional job with this style.  Pours a great golden colour with frothy white head, great Belgian yeast mix for aroma, finish is smooth with spicy/fruitiness lingering.  Well done Unibroue!
12 ounce beer poured a light orange amber color, aroams of wheat, citrus, light spice, and some yeast.  Flaovrs are the same, decent beer overall.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2012 341ml bottle. Healthy golden colour with bubbly white head that lasts and gives fine lacing. Initial aroma has that typical Unibroue yeast, but is richer/deeper with orange zest, cloves, hint of banana and sweet dark caramel malt. Bready taste, sweet like cane sugar yet not too much so. Medium-bodied, not quite thick in texture. Lively carbonation, smooth and subtle finish.
One of the best beers Ive ever tasted. Flavor was spot on. Would be my favorite tripel if not for westmalle. I will definitely drink this again.
One of the many winners from Unibroue. Best served between 5 and 10 degrees to really bring out the flavour.
just the right belnd of spices and taste. Not too heavy. lots o fruity smell.

On numerous occasions in 341 and 750ml bottles. A hazy golden body, good white head with excellent retention. Aroma dominated by easy recognizable Unibroue yeast, floral hops, banana, good dose of spices, orange peel. Taste is sweetish, with a good dose of yeast upfront, intensely floral, spicy, banana, and a late alcohol heat. A "safe" tripel.

Bottle.  Drink this in a chalice, it livens it and lets it breathe.  The look is generally what I would expect from a Tripel, and the aroma gives you a slightly sweet, very inviting smell.  At first sip the wonderful flavors burst in your mouth.  Alcohol content is a little high, but doesnt affect the flavor. First found at World Market, then at my local grocer.  So glad its available.  One of my new favorite beers.  However, its not an all time favorite.

Appearance was cloudy gold with creamy lasting whitish huge 3 finger head, no lacing though. Aromas are complex thing of beauty with spice of cloves, malts of caramel, pilsner and grist of orange peel, bananas with fruity yeasts, yummy. Taste is wonderful with slight  wheat bready toffee, cara malts cloves, lemon, spices, cereal corn flakes  and warming alcohol towards the end. Palate is silky smooth soft CO2 with meduim-full body. The finish is spicey intertwin with hops and malts  with a touch of alcohol and a thick creamy texture. The best Tripel Ive ever had...

This might be the single greatest carbonated beverage Ive ever had. The perfect tripel. Find this beer and savor it. Floral, spiced, subtly citrusy, overwhelmingly delicious. This is an incredible adult beverage.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 Aroma is mostly floral.  Taste is phenomenal with citrus and spice, the perfect belgian yeast flavors.  Dry and well carbonated.  This is an excellent example of the style and is also my favorite tripel to date.
Floral aroma.  Very light body.  Malty citrus flavor.  Sort of spicy finish that liners.  Very good got the style.

I like the taste to a certain extent. I cant see myself drinking a six pack of this nor drinking it reguarly. Very strong citrus/lemony wheat taste, pours a heavy head and high alcohol %. Definitely will try again, but I wouldnt drink it more than on occasion.

Aroma Intenso. Principalmente notas herbales, abundante malta y citricos. Aroma complejo.
En cuanto a la apariencia, excelente... Color amarillo Oro, tradicional de las cervezas triples. En mi opinión una carbonatación superior a la normal para dicho estilo. Corona de espuma perfecta. Abundante, de larga permanencia. Burbujas pequeñas y consistentes. 

En boca, elegante, cremosa, espesa.

Al paladar es sensacional. Al igual que el aroma, el sabor es sumamente complejo. Cuerpo medio, bien estructurado, alcohólico y de final intenso.

En resumen, una excelente cerveza, disfrutable, degustable, pero de cuidado debido a sus 9%.

A: Beautiful pale orange, with effervescence utterly filling the area of the glass. Bubbles rise to the surface in rapid unison like diving beetles gasping for...more La Fin Du Monde? Ive read some other reviews on this brew, and a few folks mention a lack of head and/or lacing. I am having the opposite experience. My glass is coated in lace, and there is still 1/4 inch head left after 15 minutes.

S: The first whiff made my mouth water. Thats always a good sign. Belgian yeast, clove, oranges, banana, spices, citrus. Theres a lot going on here, for sure.

T: Absolutely delicious. Incredibly complex, this is one of my my go to beers. Spices and citrus blended beautifully, followed by warming alcohol. There is a yeasty, bread-like quality that I enjoy very much.

M: So smooth. Great carbonation level. Alcohol blended in perfectly.

D: So tasty and easy to drink, I could drink this all night...and the next...and the next. The 9% alcohol, while not overwhelming, will sneak up on you in a hurry.

Notes: This beer is world class and very accessible. One of my all time favorites.

I think I may have gotten hold of a bad bottle of this beer..  either that or Im just different that others..   The group of people that tasted this with me shouted things like.. "Taste of Pickled Ham"... .. Overty hoppy and hard to describe..   Im going to have to come back to this some day and hope to get a more fresh bottle of this beer.

...pours golden with a white head.  Lots of yeast in the nose, some interesting flavors, and alcohol is not noticed untill it warms up in the finish.  Not as well balanced as the others, but has a decent flavor.  Complex, hard to pick up all the notes in there.

This is always a classic, always consistent and tasty. Aims is heavy like a yeasty Belgian. Pours hazy yellow with foamy head that sticks around. Taste is banana, clove, with all the spice a Belgian imparts.palate is thick and nice.

Yeasty, malty, and a high alcohol content that hides itself until the end.  A really good beer but the bar is so high with Unibroues other offerings like Trois Pistoles, Le Terrible, etc., that this one is a bit of let down.  It is definitely a fine beer but its a lesser Unibroue offering.
Pours with thick, foamy head. Sour, clove, citrus aromas. Hazy amber color. Taste is smooth with bread, citrus. Very nice and high alcohol % is not noticed.

Pours cloudy, light-honey-gold with large, soft, off-white head.
Slightly sour aroma.....cloves, lemon, yeast.
Taste is wheat,clove, citrus (banana,lemon/orange)
Tart to sweet and back again, very lively, spicy and busy.
This has a remarkable saison-ish-ness to it.
No matter what style it is referenced as, it is quite good, indeed.
This is a very tasty beer, if my memory serves me correctly.  A wonderfully complex beer.
Bottle from Trader Joes. Slightly spiced, wheaty, citrusy. Great flavor. Easy.
Bottle at Gallos Tap Room. Hazy orange pour with a medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, banana, pepper and spice. Banana and orange flavor with malt and spice before a semi-sweet finish.

Bottle pour.no head. Hazy corn color. Sweet pineapple nose. Continues in palette with tropical tartness, pineapple, prominent hint of cinnamon as it warms slightly, light hops cleans palette, another hit of pineapple,a bit off biter, and fades to almost vanilla aftertaste.finish lingers and lingers.fantastic brew!

Bottle served in a tulip. Best before 11-02-13. Right in its prime. Pours light orange with a slight haze, a little sediment, and a medium-short white head. Bright aroma of yeast, more yeast, bubble gum, and fruit. This one is developing all the time. Very nice. Medium sweet flavor. Light-med body, plus carbonation, yeasty-sticky mid-palate, and a long yeasty, light bitter finish.
a lovely combination of great belgian flavors.  a nice yeasty taste with a combination of light spice and fruit flavors

Bottle.  Pours golden clear with a thin white head.  Fruity and spicy aroma.  Taste is fantastic - spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, etc - that classic Unibroue yeast taste), slightly sweet malt, and a clean dry finish.  Medium-bodied with good carbonation.  A wonderful Tripel!

750ml bottle aged for a year poured into trappist glass.  Wow, Im from Quebec and I actually never rated this. Pours dark-gold, with a minimal head which reduces to almost nothing...not a tiny ring however, there is no ring at all, just tiny bubbles scattered in the middle.   Aroma is of banana, yeast, and maybe a bit bready.  This beer is not the best at hiding its abv, at 9%.  Tastes only slightly bitter, and lightly sweet.  Drank at 9C, sweetness gets a bit more pronouced as it warms up (13.5C).  Body is rather full,  texture is slick, and carbonation is very very light.  Slightly bitter, medium finish, which leaves a weird feeling, as if you still had the beer in your mouth and were feeling the carbonation.  Overall a good trippel from Québec, but for the style, not my best, sorry.  I would think about alot of other trippels I would like to purchase before purchasing a Fin du Monde.

Golden as golden gets. Lively carbonation, 9% alc! Tropical goodness, banana and citrus. Its like a fruit smoothy without all the fruit to get in the way, plus thrice the calories. It should restore your strength and revive your constitution... or knock you out if you have too many.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2012 Zesty citrus aroma, orange and lemon peel, cheddar jack cheese, a little booze, even a hint of banana.  A very pleasant aroma.  Clear golden color with large-bubble head.  Taste alternates from sweet to bitter at extremely low amplitude  and high frequency but the coupled overall flavor is  pronounced and strong.  While slight thickness is evident, tingly carbonation makes it hard to gauge.  Overall an impressive introduction to Canadian brewing.(never had a molson). This beer has all the characteristic goodness of a true Belgian golden ale while at the same time presenting a Canadian uniqueness.  Make a point to check it "oat".

Bottle shared by a neighbor. Pours hazy golden yellow with large white head. Nice carbonation. Aromas of yeast, lemon, spicy malts, and some earthy notes. Flavors of light spices, lemon, and some warming alcohol. Not the best beer to have on 95 degree day, but thought this was nicely done for the style.
Smells of yeast and spice (pepper and clove).  Taste is subtly sweet and the body is very light, with high carbonation.  Finishes fairly dry and has some alcohol bite at the end.  Its a solid tripel
Im not a fan of Belgian style beers. Its too sweet and awfully carbonated. Medium-bodied, but nothing Id really pursue.

25 may 2012, bottle. Light yellow, clear,  occasional bubbles. Nose is earthy, peppery Davison and slightly peppery. 
Thin body and fizzy. Sugary strong Belgian ale. Pretty nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy yellow, golden color. Great nose of lemon, orange, some spice & that unmistakable yeast. Flavor is lots of sharp, clean citrus up front- giving way to a creaminess & a hint of caramel malt. Finishes w/ a surprising, bitter bite. A great representation of the style & a great beer!

75cl bottle, lightly cloudy, yellow amber, slight lattice head. Strong notes of coriander and orange, yeasty finish due to being refermented on lees delightful hidden alcohol content, very drinkable for 9%. Huge amount of carbonation, great beer, one of the worlds best.
An exquisite beer. Quite dangerous, too: Ive never seen such high alcohol so well masked. Huge amount of carbonation, which makes fun to drink.

Pours golden color with a moderate head. Light wheaty, orange and spice aroma. Light yeasty spice note and coriander. Light orange fruity flavour into the finish with a light mellow yeast note. Fine, just not special.

One of my all time favorite tripels.  Nice banana, spice on the nose with a big fruity yeast punch.  Taste of citrus, slight banana, tang.  Very dry and effervescent.  For the ABV this beer is extremely drinkable and deceptive.  Amazing

750 ml bottle. Pours a very cloudy yellow/orange with a resilient white head. Smells like citrus. Taste is citrus, orange, yeast and sweetbread. Slight acidity and subtle dry, bitter finish. Body is medium and creamy. Excellent triple, great on a terrasse.

Bright light and refreshing. Fruit forward with a tart yet clean yeast flavor. Bubbly crisp mouthfeel. Nice golden color.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pale yellow color in the glass with some carbonation. There is spice on the nose along with some citrus. Taste is crisp and clean. There is also some fruit and pine. Easy drinking.

Bottle. Highly carbonated. Cloudy dark yellow with white head. Yeast aroma. Very nice and drinkable brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Backlog summer 2010 La Rochelle, France
Bottle
Full body & high complexity
Well balanced & nice yeast
Very enjoyable

Pours a cloudy pale, almost yellowish golden, with a high rocky head. Complex aroma with heavy citrus over yeast and spice, with a hint of soft caramel malts. Tastes mildly sweet and a little sour, almost like orange. Not much bitterness, but a little bit of a spicy bite, probably from coriander. Mouth feel is medium bodied, with a slightly creamy texture and average carbonation for the style.  Finishes with an abrupt medium bitterness and a little bite.
really liked this one.  had lots of yeast and spice, some tartness. firm and warming alcohol note in the finish.  very complex in flavor and aroma

Smells like your typical Belgian trippel - yeasty, bit spicy and fruity, nice and fresh.  Taste is a bit of a letdown - more malty, but more in the aftertaste than opening flavors, which are a bit too tangy for my expectations.  Solid, but for Unibroue and this overall beers reputation, and my general love for trippels, I was expecting more.  I have definitely had better.
bottle- nice golden colour with a white compacted foam. Nice floral and yeasty aroma. Full bodied with a slight taste of the alcohol. extremely well balanced.
This might be the most perfectest beer in the Monde!  Great pour, great color and fantastic and full taste. If you like tasty brews, you will not be disappointed.

Wow, I almost have to give the aroma a lower score due to the strong vegetal component verging on rotten celery!  However, I know this is most likely due to the spices and yeast, and it gets better over time.   And thats where the complaining ends.  Slightly hazy medium yellow with a soapy white head.  The first sip tells you this is something special.   A wild blend of spices that has that vegetal edge but gets more peppery with coriander and ginger notes.  The delicious dry yet lightly honeyed malt follows this and then what seems like a slightly wild yeast component.  There are some floral and citrus notes here too and might be from the hops which are hard to pick out against everything else thats going on here.  Ends up being somewhat like a Saison flavor in the end with lasting spice and yeasty flavors.  This gets better and better as you drink it, and I dont think its due to the 9% ABV which is very well hidden (although it probably doesnt hurt).

1 or 2 finger soapyish head that dont last long with some bubbles in it. Orange looking and unfiltered. A little carbonation but cant notice aloty but hard to see. Smells of like orange,honey,warmth & spice. Tasste of orange soda a bite mabye a little honey,some pepper and heavy bodied. Warm in belly. More like an Belgum abby or trappist ale then pale ale that the box says. Cheers.
Nice head, banana bread, nice carbonation, above average tripel; it was good; pales in comparison to the Chimay and the Karmeliet.

Slightly cloudy yellowish orange pour with a big head that quickly fades.  Looks very carbonated.  Fruity aroma, bananas, berries, red fruit and yeast.  Sweet taste at first, very fruity, then it quickly turns dry and mostly bananas and earthy yeast come through.  Very carbonated making it taste a little like champagne.  A very good and unique beer.

It poured a light orange color with a white head. The aroma was of spice and some fruit. The taste was sweet citrus and a little pepper or spice on the palate, with a yeasty and somewhat soapy quality as well.

750ml bottle pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of yeast
And bananas.  Taste was yeast, bananas and a hit of spice.
Pours cloudy gold with quite a bit of white head. Smells almost exactly like a hefeweizen wheat and a hint of alcohol. Tastes of wheat, bread, caramel and alcohol with a hint of banana.

33 bottle. Yellow hazy. Butterscotch malts, fruity esters and yeast on the nose. Fullbodied, soft. A touch of coriander with loads of yeast flavor. In a good way. Not as sharp as many tripels, but soft and mellow. Quite enjoyable.-- rated with lankku

Bottled, aged 4.7yrs, 330ml from LeClerc, Vouziers, France. Orange gold, carbonated with white head. You know you are into a big beer right from the start, there is a strong, slightly tartish, yeastiness along with pear drop candy notes and a full on alcohol fruitiness. Still not fully rounded even after the ageing, but really interesting drinking. This is about the malts overall though, the taste of the barley and for that it is really very good.

Bouteille 750 ml. Bière veillie quatre ans (2008). Couleur dorée foncée. Arôme plus complexe que pour la Fin du Monde non vieillie: épices et caramel. Goût plus sucré, caramélisé et vanillé. 
Une bière qui gagne à être vieillie. Lexpérience est saisissante, ce nest plus la même bière!

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2013 A nice lemon flavored belgian ale.  Very enjoyable mild on the aroma.  Nice sweet lemon flavor pretty unique.

2nd taste.  More respect.  lemon malty.  nice head that laste.  Actually alot of aroma for the style.
Pours a cloudy golden with a creamy white head. Lots of carbonation. On the nose its, banana, alcohol, bready. Taste is banana, fruity, yeast some alcohol. Smooth drinking for 9% abv.

Bottle; hazy yellow with medium whiye head, beer on lees; aroma-yeast, corriander, cloves, spices, some citrus, peach; taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, fizzy. Very satisfying

Wow ! Nectar of the Gods. Beautiful amber color witha slight orange tint. aroma was fruity, and spicey with elements of orange, clove and coriander. Citru provided the balance to the rich malt, very little hops, but beer is well balanced. Incredibly smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Layers of flavor, vanilla , orange, pine, toffee. Long finish, and as other have mentioned, little or no alcholo burn.  Great aftertaste , leaves you wanting more more more.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2012 Light amber, cloudy beer with an imposing off-white head. The aroma is of spices, orange peel, dust, ripe fruits, and juniper berries. The taste is mainly of orange peel, dust, wood, and yeasty spices--quite dry and even astringent. It feels very natural and Belgian. Im not a tripel guy, but I like it and appreciate its complexity.

Originally rated January 2005. Poured a yellow-orange colour with a big white head and some foamy lacing. Aromas are very strong in alcohol at first, but when the beer breathes, the usual Unibroue beer on the lees smell comes out. Pears, and many other fruits are there. Like most of their brews, the mouth is full of spices. Mouthfeel is creamy. Even though this is good, I prefer their Eau Bénite (same style, but less strong in alcohol).
The aroma is great and the beer goes down so smooth. It makes you forget that it is 9% alcohol.

A: Pours a yeasty, cloudy golden amber color. This one doesnt have much of a head...whats there is a .5-finger eggshell-white affair, with poor retention and good lacing (both of which improve if you let the beer warm a little). In addition, it also features faint trails of carbonation bubbles, and if you let it sit in the glass a while, some yeast sediment.

S: Banana, cloves, and bubblegum. The ale esters really take this one over. No alcohol on the nose.

T: The bubblegum flavors are the first thing that stick out to me, with the banana, cloves, and yeast blending very nicely with the wheat base. The balance between the sweetness and tartness is excellent, but the best (worst?) part is how stupidly easy it is to drink. Apart from a slight warming on the back end, I refuse to believe this is 9% ABV. Fer chrissakes, it goes down easier than some 6% beers!

M: The carbonation is high, but its only high enough to make it superbly refreshing. The sensation plays incredibly well with the buttery smoothness on the tongue. Terrifyingly easy to down.

O: Wow is all I can say. This is a beer that where you WILL need self-control so as to not down the whole bottle in 10 minutes, lest you face its alcoholic wrath. Its an amazingly refreshing and flavorful drink that will lull drinkers into a false sense of security (seriously, this is 9% ABV?) Needless to say, it lives up to the hype.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2013 Poured into a tulip glass. Hazing golden straw color with a finger of head.

Strong fruit smell backed up by some malt. Orange is the biggest player with some lemon in the background.

Layer taste and complex. Fruit sweetness, then a malty middle, orange, lemon and a biting bitterness to finish. Alcohol heat a little while after. Kinda nice, really nice.

Medium and sticky body, moderate carbonation but really bubbly on the tongue.

Its a great one. Tough to beat.

Pours a pale golden with a beaded white head.  The aroma is spicy belgian yeast, orange peel, and some coriander.  The taste is much like the nose, semi-sweet, and finishes quite dry.  A very solid Abbey Tripel.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2012 12 ounce bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head that seems to last for quite a while. Smells of banana with some nice floral spicy hints and maybe a sense of the alcohol. Taste is very clean, a little sweet initially. Some alcohol on the backend but very well balanced. Medium body, not overly-carbonated. Overall a great tripel.

Very solid belgian triple. Pours a hazy golden-orange with medium white frothy head. Aroma is banana, fruit, spice, and yeast. Taste is slightly sweet but not cloyingly so. Even at 9% abv, the alcohol is practically undetectable. I think my favorite thing about this beer is the yeast-- its perfect, and balances really nicely with the fruitness. Easy to drink. A good choice for introducing others to the glory of the belgian triple.
Cloudy golden color.  Nice aroma.  Really tasty. Bananas, citrus.  Nice mouthfeel. Overall a really good beer.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2012 The typical Belgian smells and flavors of banana, clove, coriander, and yeast are all present in abundance. Very crisp and clean with nice spice and fruit notes. The ABV is hidden well. Another great offering by Unibroue!
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2012 Aroma is very sweet and fruity. Thick head when poured. Appearance is a hazy golden yellow.Has a very complex rush of spices and wheat! Delicious!

Mild aroma and dark golden appearance turns to strong but smooth taste and great mouthfeel.  Easy drinking and flavorful beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

hazy orange color, aroma of celery, orange, coriander, banana, all spice, flavors of bitter orange, banana, coriander, yeast, lots of all spice, pineapple, med body, some what high carbonation, very good for the style

Golden brown with an average, creamy, white head. Leaves an average amount of lacing. The nose has a lot of fruit, lemon,pears,white grapes, and some citrus. Taste is very clean and crisp really taste the fruits come out in this beer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy, golden color. The aroma is fruit, citrous and banana. The taste is very smooth with similar flavors.

Candy sugar, banana, and citrus in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet and malty and finishes with fruit, spice, and a little alcohol.   Lots of flavor, but really smooth and drinkable at the same time.  This is as good as any tripel Ive had.

From notes.
Pours a nice clowdy light golden orange with a thin white head that doesnt stick around to long. No lacing.
Smell is spicy, with some light sweet fruits, strawberrys, banana, maybe white grape.
Taste has a nice spicy bite that is also pretty sweet, its pretty hard to pick out the 9% ABV, well done.
The carbonation is pretty strong on this one. The whole bouquet of flavors really sits on the palette. The body is pretty light and the finish is super smooth.

Bottle 750ml (2008, 4yo).
Pours golden, with low white head. Particles in the beer. Darker than fresh one. Aroma is of caramel, sweetness, faint spices. Taste caramel, some spices. Benefits alot from aging. Loses some spices, but gains a very nice caramel taste. Alchool is well hidden. Very good beer, maybe becoming just a little bit watery with aging, due to spices lost. [8/4/8/3/15]___Bottle 341ml. (2011). Pours golden, with low white head. Aroma is spices, strong yeast, citrus. Taste spices, yeast, citrus. A good, complex beer. [8/4/7/3/14]

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden lemon color with a thick layer of sparkling white foam and lots of active carbonation. The aroma is sharp and yeasty with lots of clove, nectarine, apple cider and lemon rind with a little bit of malt in the background. The flavor is heavy on the honey, banana and clove upfront along with some white peach, pear and coriander. Also some brown sugar sweetness, bread and malt notes toward the end. Mouthfeel is full-bodied with champagne-like carbonation leading to a mildly tart, spiced finish. Excellent balance between the fruit, yeast and malt flavors in addition to the alcohol being barely detectable. An outstanding beer and one of the worlds best Tripels.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2013 OK I love tripels so I am biased, this beer is enjoyable, crisp, clean, and fun to drink. The beer pours blonde with a hazy look, light head that covers the surface, carbonation is good with a real crip taste and the second great Trip from the same brewer...

Vertical tasting.

Bottle 750 ml [2008]. 
Appearance: Pours apricot/dark golden with a low white head. 
Aroma: Sweet, caramel and spices. Unibroue yeast aroma disapeared. Taste: Sweet, strong notes of caramel, honey and spices. A bit watery at the end.
Overall: Very complex, well balanced and easily drinkable. Way better than the non-age one, doesnt look like the same beer... 
[Ap. 4/5, Ar. 7/10, Ta. 8/10, Pa. 3/5, Ov. 16/20, T. 3.8/5]

Bottle 341 ml [2011].
Appearance: Pours clear golden with a low white head.
Aroma: Unibroue yeast, strong notes of spices.
Taste: Spices, citrus and yeast.
Overall: Need more time  to develop is complexity and gain balance. Maybe more refreshing young.
[Ap. 3/5, Ar. 7/10, Ta. 7/10, Pa. 3/5, Ov. 14/20, T. 3.4/5]

Pours a hazy light peach color with a small white head turns to a lasting film. Aroma is yeasty with some citrus, banana, and spice.  Taste is orange peel, clove, yeast, and a hint of sugary sweetness. Very nice carbonation.

12oz bottle from a Unibroue mix pack. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head and plenty of carbonation. Very well done Belgian style ale. Citrus aroma with lots of flavors going on including apricot, clove, and lemon. As with the other Unibroue this too hides the high abv extremely well. Another good one here.

Excellent!  Unfiltered amber color combined with a spicy, clove, Hefewesen taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep orange and yellow in color, slightly hazy... Aroma of citrus and candi sugar.... Flavor is sweet and citrusy, notes of Belgian yeast, slightly sour... Pretty delicious

Light yeasty aroma with floral notes present.  This beer pours a cloudy lighty yellow, with a giant white craggy head.  This is not on overpowering beer on the flavor side.  Theres light floral notes, a touch of spice, and the faintest hint of alcohol heat.  Light on the palate, with a lot of carbonation.  This is an exceptional beer.

Pours hazy golden. Nose is fruity, belgian type yeast. Taste is sweet fruit, clove, followed by a sour note at the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75 cl bottle @ home, bottled 06.12.2011
Aroma is rather rich and refreshing with soapy citrus and some orange peel. Flavour is sweetish with lots of citrus, some orange peel and hints of spices. Also some warming alcohol and honey. Reminds me of Glazen Toren Ondineke.

750ml bottle from BC Liquor Store, Vancouver, BC
Bottled on D06110823Q (bought on July 2011) - Pours light orange with a small white head. Aroma of sweet malts, spices, fruits, grass and orange.  Taste is quite sweet with earthy notes, honey, spices and malts. Finish is malty and sweet with some bitterness and spices. Okay, quite sweet tripel.

750 ml bottle.
Pours a deep yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of fresh sweet fruits, honey and weak hops. Flavour of sweet malts, mandarin orange, honey, yeast, spices and some lemon. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a sweet malty finish. Way too sweet for a Tripel, but I like the spiciness here.

75 cl bottle.
Pours hazy golden color with medium sized white head. Aroma of apricot, citrus, herbal notes, grass, caramel malts and hoppy fruits. Flavor of apricot, citrus, spices, herbs, grass, caramel and yeast. Quite sweet and carbonated.
5435

Poured from 750 to snifter:
Pours like a murky apple cider with a couple of fingers of delicate, short-lived white froth.  Minimal beading.  Smells lovely - cloves, banana, soft citrus, candy-like booze.  Very unique taste.  Its got all the elements of the nose with the addition of some white grapes or apple?  Very smooth and virtually zero traceable alcohol burn.  The body is light, easy-drinking which really goes a long way here.  A well executed, refreshing Tripel.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a huge white head.  Smells of major citrus, specifically orange.  Taste is medium bodied with a lot of sweetness and some dryness on the finish.  As this beer warms up, a small bitterness comes out on the tongue.  This is a really solid Tripel that hides the 9% alcohol well.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2012 New Rating: 7/3/7/3/14[3.4]

Shared at a tasting, Pours orange to yellow hazy with a medium head, aroma of yeast, apricot, vanilla and a touch of wood, flavor of yeast, vanilla, wood, sugar can some herby hops some spices, zesty, medium to full bodied, nice
7/4/7/4/13[3.5]

Smells of strong orange, vanilla and floral hops. Pours into a very light golden color with a massive foam top. Taste is an explosion of flavorful orange, vanilla, citrus. fruits and spice. Pleasant carbonation with a thin, creamy texture and a spectacular citrussy finish. Overall, a delicious brew with a ton of flavor and a creamy palate. A lot of alcohol taste in the background. Id give this an A+ rating.

pours cloudy marmalade orange, minimal head, little retention, small CO2, very active fast moving CO2 streams. Citrusy-peach and apricot on the nose, very inviting. Starts 7/10 sweet, highly creamy CO2, stone fruit peach, apricots, bananas in the mid, sugar rush hits, and fades into a slightly alcoholic 2/10 wheaty off-dry bitter finish. Medium complexity, medium depth, great transitions, great carry, med-full bodied, superb drinkability. Initially drinks light but hits alcoholic hard at the finish. Great party beer to share.

This might be my favorite tripel, and of course it would be Canadian rather than Belgian. Cloudy orange golden. The nose shows loads of brioche and Meyer lemon. Medium bodied with a killer mouthfeel. Coriander and orange peel. Nearly perfect!

Arome de levure Unibroue et de fruit. Robe dun blond opaque surmonté dun col blanc très généreux. Goût de fruit séchés, abricot peut-être, typique des triples belges. Carbonatation généreuse. Bière très réussi.

Very nice well-rounded beer. Nice floral malty nose. Fantastic palate full of bubbles, malts, bitters, a pinch of heat ending clean and refreshing. Taste is sweet, rounding out to fruity spicy yeast. Awesome beer. 

-Fish!

La Fin Du Monde has a great body, fantastic aroma, and is easy on the palate leaving no real after taste...but rather your mouth clean and refreshed.  The major downfall to this brew, in my opinion, is that the floral and coriander flavors come off far too strong. 

While this beer was definitely not my cup of tea, it was clearly put together with great care and excellence.  I plan on trying other brews from Unibroue.  La Fin Du Monde is an excellent beer for lovers of coriander.

From notes.  First reviewed 11/25/2010.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a tulip.

The appearance is bright like an orange sunrise, Fin du Monde is slightly cloudy from a bunch of Belgian yeast just waiting to impress me. A calm white head forms upon pouring but fades rather quickly and does not leave any lacing.

The spicy Belgian yeast pops out of the glass and into the nose. Pepper, cloves, green apple skin, soft pear, and sweet sugary bread all make themselves present.

Sweet, especially up front. The first taste is of spice and candy, with the apple, pear, and more complex flavors stepping in a bit later. The flavor is a bit tame compared to some of my favorites, so I swirl the bottle and add all of the yeast to give it more pop. The finish is a light floral hoppiness, a touch of alcohol, and more sugar sweetness.

Less that medium carbonated, slightly sticky sweet, all in a medium body.

At 9%, this can really kick you if you let it.  There are a couple of tripels I like better than this, but to be fair, this is still a stellar beer.

2012.02.26 - 12oz. bottle in tulip glass.  Pours a lightly clouded golden yellow.  Foamy active white head.  Nose is fruity and sweet, taste is banana with just a hint of spice. Well carbonated.  Reminds me of (my recollection of) Weyerbacher Merry Monks.  Tasty.

Pours a slightly hazy, light straw yellow with a thick, foamy white head. The aroma is of sweet malt, bread yeast and pears - almost cidery. The taste is dry and crisp with hints of cloves and bananas. The clove/banana taste is a little less subtle than I prefer, but its not quite as overwhelming as with other beers of similar styles. Not a bad beer, but a little odd IMO.

Reviews by UDbeernut:
UDbeernut

3.75/5  rDev -13.4%
look: 4  smell: 4  taste: 4  feel: 3.5  overall: 3

bottle poured into snifter

a: straw yellow color with foamy 1 1/2" head that reduces nicely into lacing
