s: buiscuit smell, hint of apples

t: malt and yeast flavors dominate, clove

m&d: full bodied

Honey colour with a tightly laced 2 cm head. Nose is very floral of apricots and apples, but citrus dominates. Clean and crisp in the mouth with plenty of carbonation to fizzle your tongue. Alcohol is barely noticeable.

Pours a nice cloudy golden with a decent sized head that kinda lingers. Aromas of tea, lemon zest, yeast, light malt, and floral. Initial taste is semi tangy. Different for this style. A lemon-esque flavor with the normal Belgian yeast flavor smoothed out with a nice floral and tea like flavor. Very smooth, very easy drinking and delicious.
This tripel has a heavy decency factor. Smells like the Quebecois stole rosary from Belgian monks, chewed it up and breathed the stuff out in incense with a decent head... Castros bottle.

dark stout-like appearance with rich sweet malty aroma. seriously complex flavour. This took at least a three or four mouthfuls before i even had a handle on what was going on. Berries, roasted malts, some choclate i think but not bitter. Would be interesting to try a cask form with a little less carbonation possible resulting in a smoother palate. A meal in itself!
Nice head when poured. Fruity aroma. Subtle fruity characteristics with slight liquor finish. Top shelf beer. Absolute short list. Nice buzz.

Cloudy deep gold with a persistent head-covering and a light lace bead that drops back into the drink.  In direct light , an appealing opulence that makes it glow.  Excellent look.  Clean fresh yeasty wheat taste with light spices.  Carbonation and bittering move in toward the end to provide a well-balanced finish.  A superb brew that has a well-deserved reputation.
Buona Tripel, reperita alla coop...buon aroma, il palato parte bene con un buon maltato poi si perde un po nel finale. La mia bottiglia probabilmente non era in formissima...da riprovare..
I had this one a long time ago. If I have the chance to drink it again, Ill update this rating

Pours a hazy orange with a bubbly head. Aromas of yeast, grapes, bananas, citrus, and maybe some cloves somewhere down in there. Tastes very close to the smell but a little butteriness comes through and the carbonation is rather high, but thats normal for the style. It has a zesty kick up front with a smooth silky finish and the alcohol is masked all they was until the warmth hits the stomach. Overall a great beer. Unibroue has never disappointed me. SKAL!

Slightly cloudy bright yellow with a big white head as thick as cappuccino milk. Aroma is very lifted, fresh citrus and loads of spice come jumping out of the glass into you nose. Taste like ripe citrus fruits, ginger and other spices, and warm alcohol. Carbonation is pretty high of this one. Overall it is a very refreshing yet intense brew. I love this style, and think this is one of the best triples Ive had so far.

Pours a cloudy blond with a lacy white head.  Smells earthy and spicy, some bread, and noticeable alcohol.  Nice balanced taste, dry bitter aftertaste.  Pretty full-bodied.  Extraordinarily good overall.

Pours golden with a mostly lasting strong white head. Hazy cloudy appearance. Inviting aroma with a medium intensity. aromas of citrus and slight hay. Medium intensity and body with a long aftertaste. creamy round texture with apricot, spices, and a alcohol flavoring. Rich quality. Appreciated

UPDATED: APR 7, 2012 Pours a honey color with thick foamy white head.  Aromas of spice and fruit. Sweet citrus and a bit of pepper or spice on the palate, with a yeasty and soapy quality as well....delicious.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks zvikar. Pours cloudy yellow with thin foam, banana, cream and peach aroma and Belgian-like bitterness in the mouth. Lingering, long finish, medium carbonated and balanced.

Pours hazy golden with a small head. It has a lovely yeasty bready smell with pleasent notes of fruity esters and fine champange like carbonation. 

It has a lovely spicy and and peppery flavour that compliments the smooth balanced malts, for its alcoholic strength this beer hides it well, it finishes dryish but very moreish..

Bottle poured into a NB globe.

A - Pours hazy golden yellow with a nice one finger tall white head leaving thin streaks of lace down the glass.

S - Smells of clove, apples, pepper, and bready yeast. Sweetness builds as it sits in the glass with some booze creeping in at the end of each glass.

T - Starts off with a candied sugar kick quickly giving way to a mix of peppery spice, clove, apples, and bready yeast. Alcohol is well hidden, only coming to light after it warms up. Finish is a mix of chewiness and light sweetness, lingering on the pallet for some time.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Smooth, crisp feel with some booze creeping in as it warms up. The flavors, while tasty, begin to wear on the pallet over the course of the bottle.

O - A solid Triple for sure. This style really isnt my preferred cup of tea but I still have great respect for it. This particular one has lots of tasty flavors going on and the booze is well hidden. One of the best I have had.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks zvikar. Hazy golden-orange color. Yeasty aroma, fruity (peach, some apricot), a bit sourish, with some nice citric tones and some spiciness. Sweetish fruity flavor with some yeast and a dry spicy finish. Medium-bodied. Quite nice.

A - pours deep apple juice straw, with very high creamy head that lasts. 

S - aromas of Belgian yeasts, lemons, spices ( cloves), bananas and bubble gum. 

M - full bodied creamy mellow drinkable Belgian.  

T - Belgian yeasts on the nose. Lemons, wheat, spices, bubble gum  hints on the palate. Lingering drier malty ending. 

O - well balanced drinkable Belgian . 

6

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy gold with light amber hues and fluffy white foam.  Complex citrus, ripe fruit, yeast esters in the nose.  Flavor is tangy citrus and fruit, mild alcohol, and malt nuances.  Finishes with a solid, refined bitterness.  Residual sticky malt sweetness.  A tad less dry than other true tripels.  Great example.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2012 bread, nuts, grass, leather, earthy, banana, alcohol, vanilla, soy sauce, golden, cloudy, rocky head, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, full body, average carbonation, sticky, astringent, long finish,

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2012 Pours light blond with four or five fingers light fluffy head. Smells light and citrusy, think it comes from the yeast. Taste is very smooth, very refreshing. Orange peel. Very well done triple. 

Re review on tap at bottleworks clear blond big head, smell hoppy fluffy belgium flavors. Taste sharper, banana and clove and gum. Think it might be a bit different on tap.

Special brewers reserve bottle using spirals of oak from the 17 Grand Reserve. Darker than the regular, hazy, smell tart bitter oak fruit and honey. Taste carbonated, herbal, sweet oak, caramel, soft yeast, spice, pretty awesome stuff.

From a Beer Store 6 pack.  Hazy coper coloured pour,  1 finger of head.  Complex aroma - slightly boozy, wheat, cloves, spices, some banana and assorted fruit,.  Taste of Clove, Pepper,  Banana, dry lemon, spicey and fruity, very slight hint of booze, wheat, yeast - a sipper.  Fairly lively carbonation.  one of the few reasons to visit the Beer Store in Ontario.

A deep golden beer, a little bit cloudy. Nice bubbles and beautiful aspect with a two finger persistent head. Nose is very citrusy, with a hint of floreal and cereal. Very pleasant spicy bittersweet aroma with some touches of maltiness and orange peel.
It is so drinkable, though its 9% ABV.
Pours a hazy orange colour with a big bubbly whtie head. aroma is citus and clove. flavour banana clove and a little yeasty
UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 Its very nice on the palate, great and different aroma. I love the very robust flavor and malt characteristics.
Bottle pours slightly opaque gold, minimal white head, aromas and flavors of citrus and clove

Havent had this one in a long time so decided to try it again to see if I liked it as much as I used to. Poured from a 750ml bottle a creamy yellow with a very thin head that dissipates quickly. Smell is of banana cloves and very mild yeast. Flavor is mainly banana, sugar and a lot of fruity sweetness. You can taste the alcoholin it and small hints of yeast comes through at the end. The lack of the belgian yeast flavor and the always present sugary sweetness is whats holding this beer back from being well balanced.

Poured into a Tulip and left to warm. Sparse lacing and quickly dissipating head. Cloudy golden appearance as you would expect from a Tripel. Tight bubbles gathering around the outer edge of the vessel. Earthy tones and Bananas in the nose. Mild citrus and yeast in the palate and high drinkability make this one of my favorite Tripels to date.

Really good tripel, pours cloudy gold with nice foamy white head, strong spicy yeasty aroma, the usual clove and banana notes. Flavor is upfront fruity with banana and has a nice bready kind of finish. Nice carbonation and overall mouthfeel.
UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Oh no, it?s the end of the world.   I wouldn?t be so upset if I had one of these in my hand.  Very smooth for a Belgian style.   A slihr citrus feel.   Cloudy color.

This is one exceptional Tripel!
Nose: Yeast, dried fruits, bread, sweet wheat beer
Taste: Very unique, yeasty, mild apple cider, dried fruits, perfect amount of sweetness.
A very good bavarian beer. A bit on the pricey side. Very smooth and rich flavor. Great for celebrations, not a beer you want to drink several of in one sitting.
#1066 Bottle (2009); Nose is quite heavy yeast, sweet alcohol, weak sour apricot, little moldy, feel Is mediumwatery, carb is mediumheavy, taste is pear, hay, little barn yard, alcohol bite

Olor a banana y fruta bien intenso fantastico,al paladar un gusto de una trippel aromatica muy parecida a una weizenbock,el resultado es una cerveza fantastica,amo siempre mas a las cervezas de unibroue la recomiendo mucho
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: This may well be the beer for the "end of the world." Outstanding Tripel and one of the best on this side of the pond.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Cant believe I havent rated this yet.  Nose is varied straw, honey many notes like a wheat beer. Very nice pour, plenty of smooth carbonation.  Taste is sourdough bread, honey, wheat, nice winter spice in there.  Medium mouthfeel.  Finishes light and tasty.  Enjoyability 4.5/5.
Aroma is bananas and alcohol.  Looks like foamy urine.  Creamy mouth.  The alcohol is hidden well.  Taste is a little one note.  Not super complex, just sweet and fruity.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a tulip glass.

A: Beautiful hazy orange with lots of swirling carbonation bubbles and a thick white head.

S: Sweet, yeast, fruity. Slight cloves hint. Cant exactly put my finger on the fruit, perhaps banana?

T: Yeasty into a malty banana bread type flavor with a spice finish.

M: Very refreshing the high amounts of carbonation make this beer a real refreshing drink.

O: Theres a reason why this is cult status at this point. Very easy to drink and well made.

slightly hazy yellowish-gold color. Thin white-colored head with fine bubbles.  The taste of this beer is very complex.  It took a feel sips to really discover it true taste. One of the best parts of this beer is the smell...unreal. The clove and yeast come through.  It finishes very clean even after. It is wonderful if you are into tripels

Pours a murky gold. Good sized creamy head, excellent retention. Scent is orchard, acidy rain, bubblegum and citrus. Taste is.orange, banana and clove. Mouthfeel is an appealing medium body. 9% alcohol is well hidden. Not my favorite from this outfit, but a good example of the style and very Belgian in taste. That yeast sure tastes like it came straight from the old country.

Bottle.  Pours a slightly couldy orange with creamy white head that takes some time to settle.  Aroma has big banana up front with a doughy hint.  There are some spices on the back end but they stay pretty tame.  Has a huge banana taste initially that fades to a slight tart almost pear like taste.  The taste ends with a spiced alcohol with the main spice being clove.  Mouthfeel is very creamy with good carbination.  Overall this is a good beer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden with a white head. Smells of a mellow banana, and spices... cant really describe it. Creamy mouth feel. Soft carbonation. A superb triple.

A cloudy, orangish-yellow pour with a white head.  The aroma is a little grassy with some apricot.  The medium body has a crisp texture with fizzy carbonation.  The taste is sweet from start to finish.

Hazy yellow with a large white head that doesnt leave much lacing. Aroma is heavy on the yeast, some citrus, green apple, bread with a hint of banana and spice. Taste is slightly tart, peach, green apple, grape skins and some lemon.  Somewhat tangy in the mouth, medium bodied, with a dry finish. Enjoyable but not quite up there with the Belgian tripels.

Poured from a 75o mL into my Chimay glass. Slight fruit in the aroma but the taste is where this beer excels. Very complex brew, very fruity at the start for me and finishes with a great mix of alcohol and bread. I would recommend this beer to anyone.

Bday gift from Tanya:pours clear golden, fluffy white head. nice retention and lots of carbonation. Nose- clove, banana, Belgian yeast, esters. Taste- honey, grain, clove, pepper,  lemon zest, bread, dough malts. not too sweet as many Tripels just overdo the sugars. a bit thick on the palate. balanced and sneaky drinkable. Solid
Golden haze in appearance, somewhat high carbonation, with a nice one finger white head. Bananna, apricot, bread, with some spice on the palate. Good beer overall.
Bottle. Pours a golden light brown color. Very thick foamy head. Smells of apricots and honey. Taste is similar with a slightly boozy after taste.

12 oz bottle.
Pours a cloudy gold clor with a frothy, foamy head.
tastes of belgian yeast, fruit and spice. On the tongue there is a fairly heavy body, more belgian yeast funkiness, spice and a sharp bitterness toward the end. Its exceptionally well balanced, complex .
A wonderful beer - with a kick.
9.0% cloudy gold colour with a thin head, fruity aroma, strong but very fruity taste.
Poured into my Chimay glass. Color was orangeish. Thin bubbly head. Aroma is banana and Clove. Flavor is like a Belgium, but not quite a triple.

Une odeur dagrume et des pointes de sucre (Miel?)
Une couleur orange-jaune brumeuse avec ue mousse pétillante comme du champagne.  
Goût peu amer, il y a un peu dépice que je ne saurais identifier, lalcool est très discret, le sucre est présent.  Une bière au goût complexe qui se marie bien avec des viandes assaisonnées.

Probablement la plus blonde/dorée des 4 grosses pointures dUnibroue. Beaucoup de foin de grange dans larôme, épices et miel sont également dans le portrait, a les caractéristiques dune saison en plus robuste. La saveur est semblable à lodeur avec un arrière-goût assez prononcé herbacé. Leffervescence est agressive, sans surprise.
Orange, fruity aroma.  What a beer.  Palate like a good witbier, but with miles of additional flavor.  Hops, malt, orange, medium body.  Great beer.

Bottle. Poured orange amber color with offwhite head. Aroma of fruit, spice, acidic for sure. Feels like its going to be a bit more boozy but its very well balanced. Smooth, high carbonation with a dry almost champagne like finish. Sweet, but not overwhelming like some Tripels brewed in America. La Fin Du Monde is delicious and is another fine example by the Canadiens at Unibroue

A cloudy golden yellow beer with a big white head.  The aroma is wheat, citrus, and nice yeast.  The flavor is similarly yeasty and wheaty with a fruitiness.  A very tasty beer with good spice flavor.
Pours a dark yellow Orange with a white creamy head. The aroma is fragrant and pleasant. Taste is mellow with nearly no alcohol bite a very elegant feeling beer.
A very nice sweet fruity triple.  Light in color with a sweet triple yeast finish.  Taste of doughy bread and citrus. Very good beer.

Bottle ; Pour is murky light golden with a fine bubbled white head in this tulip - retention seems to be fairly average. The nose begins with lighter fruits - like apricots, coupled with caramel, sweet breads - typical belgian notes come through but are mild overall. The flavor profile is lightly bitter out of the gate, but the general sweetness is more noticeable. There is a touch of spices, like pepper present on this one - giving way to the fruity peach and apricot, sweet bready malt profile and again, light belgian notes - I have to say I enjoy this one overall -
One of my top three beers, unfortunately it doesnt travel well. Big and tasty it balances with the alcohol perfectly

Bottle into a sniffer. Smells a little fruity, apricots and citrus. Its orange in color and a good amount of carbonation without going into seltzer territory. Its one of the best beers ive had in a while.

Rating #100.  Notes of yeast, wheat in the nose.  Pours significantly lighter than I would have thought, being a tripel.  Nice white head that lasts for a while.  Wow.  Thats a good tasting beer.  Reminds me a bit of Duvel, but a little maltier and sweeter.  This is a good beer.
Yeasty and malty in the aroma and taste. A somewhat heavy, cloudy beer with a good taste.

6/10/2011 75cl bottle @ Pumpkin BYOB restaurant, Philadelphia - BB: 4/22/13 (2011-541) 
Cloudy light orange beer, fluffy aery white head, unstable and non adhesive, dissipates completely very fast. Given the young age of the bottle, this doesnt look very good. Aroma: bit of fruits, lots of grains, bit cheesy, yoghurt, yeast. MF: effervescent, full body, thick creamy texture. Taste: citrus start, grapefruit, flowery, spices (garlic), bit of honey, some grassy hops. Aftertaste: lemons, oranges, bitter hops, English marmelade. Pretty good, too bad it lost points on appearance.

One of my favorite beers of all time. This one is consistently great and a fine representation of the style. I love the nose, swiftness, and mouth fell of this beer.  La Fin Du Monde has a specific yeast characteristics that stays with you throughout the taste. I like how I often pick up new nuances of flavor when I go for a long period of time without have one of these.

Tasted bottle at City Museum Cabin Inn into tumbler. Poured a medium amber/orange color with some yeast haze and huge, creamy off-white head, lasting Belgian lace. Powerful aromas of malt, rising bread dough, pear, apricot, sweet naval oranges, lemon zest, pepper and clove yeast esters, even some bubble-gum as it warms. Flavors of complex grain-bill, marmalade, some caramelized brown sugar, balanced bitterness but few late addition hops. Medium-heavy body, round and creamy, almost "chewy" mouthfeel. Sparkling carbonation, very Champagne-like bottle fermentation. Fades to crisp, dry, slightly spicy finish. High alcohol percentage, but well-hidden. Delicious. Its not my all-time favorite Trippel, but thats not a slight. Were talking about one of the most sophisticated brewing styles in existence.
12 oz bottle. Pours an opaque honey color. Aroma of bubblegum, pear, pepper, coriander, orange.  Flavor is spice, pepper, bubblegum, fruit juice.  Absolutely fantastic.

Ported from BA.

Appearance:
Pours a hazy yellow/orange color with about an inch of head that dissipates quickly, like a cola. Carbonation is easily visible.

Smell:
yeasty and dry, but fruity. Very soft and mild smell with some amount of light fruits, like white grapes and a lot of pear. very smooth and champagne-y.

Taste:
Again, soft. A lot of pear flavor and a bit of grape in the background. A bitterness similar to fruit peel.

Mouthfeel:
Sharp carbonation and with a creamy feeling behind it.

Drinkability:
I dont think Id have more than one of these in a night, partially because of the ABV and partially because Im not really into this. Its a decent belgian, but it just doesnt quite click with me. That being said, I can recognize it as a quality beer.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2014 Bouteille 750 ml. 9%. Jaune assez foncé, mousse blanche, belle effervescence. Arôme de levures et agrumes..En bouche, agrumes, levures belges, alcool. Un peu dépices, malt, caramel, levures.
Interesting aftertaste. Cany really put my finger on it. Light on the tounge. Slight citrus aroma.

Oh, Canada! La Fin Du Monde  the end of the world. Probably one of the finest tripels I have tasted thus far! This brew poured up a cloudy apricot colored body with a thick foamy head with amazing retention and lacing. Scents of fruits (apricots, maybe peaches), bready yeasts, tropical fruit and cloves. The flavor is absolutely amazing; full of fruits (apricot) and cloves. Medium-bodied, smooth and creamy, with a dry, bready finish. A spicy pork meal would be the choice of mine for this hearty tripel!

Aroma of pear other fruits and the highly distinguishable Unibroue yeast. No noticable hops. additional notes of clove.Appearance is clear off-yellow amber orange.  When (if) yeast base is poured out, the beer becomes more opaque. Pours with a thick quickly dissipating to the point at which it just sits and blankets the beer. Perfect. Taste is medium sweet and lightly sour. medium bodied almost creamy texture with lively carbonation. slightly astringent and dry yeasty finish. Overall this is an incredible beer. One of the, if not the, best triples out there. Taste improves dramatically when paired with cheese. Will have to try side to side with tripel karm.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Dark, golden-orange color... huge white head that quickly fades... lots of lace

S: Mostly fruits (banana, oranges, apples), and spice (coriander and clove)... slightly biscuity in the middle.. some belgian yeast too.

T: Follows the nose in many ways... but lacks the smoothness and delicate transitions the nose (and the much more refined belgians) have.

M: Medium bodied. Crisp. Refreshing.

O: I think something is to be said about the long tradition of brewing the belgians have perfected... unibroue has a good beer on their hands... it just needs a few tweaks...

Cloudy pale golden with medium white head.  Aroma sour citrus, yeasty baking bread, grass.  Medium bodied with prominent carbonation, touch of alcohol.  Flavor of citrus and tropical fruits, spices.  Very well made, interesting, drinkable.  Not a huge tripel fan but this has most of what you would want in a beer, best North American one of the style I have had.

Pour is a deep hazy yellow nice head decent lace. Aroma is heavy on citrus light cardamom white pepper coriander. Taste is lemony wheat with a fresh grass and slight tartness. Mouth-feel is great  fizzy and lasting

Lovely golden pour with big white head and high carbonation. Sweet fruity nose with a hint of floral hops. Creamy body with sweetness for the tongue.
Slightly drier finish. 

Tripels not my style but this is nice to drink.

12oz bottle. Time for me to try this classic abbey tripel (Im usually pretty underwhelmed with the style, although I appreciate the ABV). Mostly hazy dark yellow color, nice big persisting white head. A bit of soft lacing. Nice spice in the aroma. Light fruit taste (citrus?). Taste is slight bitter, some spice, some umami. Good, crisp carbonation. Aroma has a nice rising crest that you ride. Something odd about it, though.. The 9% ABV doesnt bring down the taste at all, which is impressive, but it does have an odd "bite".
Tart, bitter, and tasty! Some fruit and spice notes. The color is a hazy gold. Full head.

Straight from the shop, no maturity. Poured into a pint glass. Have had many before, always delicious and refreshing. Malty banana, cinnamon, cactus, chestnuts. Smells as it tastes. Uniquely high carbonation leaves a tender mouthfeel and perfect finish, including more banana and clove, with a touch of pins and needles. A beautiful beer that I will cherish for years to come. Nearly perfect.
Lots of carbonation. Similar to a champagne with a slight grape tartness. Mouthfeel was like sparkling wine. Color was pale yellow with very little head  Thanks to Brad for the bottle donation.
Bottle. Cloudy golden with thin white head.  Light aroma with spice and grass. Can taste those notes as well plus a sour note and maltiness. Dont like the sweet ending on this either.

I can never remember the name of this one, but every time I stumble into it I completely enjoy it. Its super delicious and full of flavor. The only downside I can think of is I tend to get a little overwhelmed by the flavor towards the end of the bottle.

12 oz bottle. In my opinion Unibroue is one of the top 10 breweries in North America. This beer is bears this out. It pours a very cloudy pale orange body. Cloudier, of course, if the yeast from the bottle is added, but I prefer the beer without the conditioning yeast. Fruity and yeasty aroma with lots of wheat, bubblegum, alcohol, and pepper. Intense fruity and alcoholic flavors over sweet malt, spices and yeast. Mouthfeel is full bodied and chewy in consistency. Intense fizzy classic Unibroue style carbonation. A very nice beer. The flavor and consistency is always high.

This has become my go-to beer. It is almost universally available where I live and extremely good. Aroma includes belgian yeast, fruit and spice. On the tongue there is a fairly heavy body, more belgian yeast funkiness, spice and a sharp bitterness toward the end. Its exceptionally well balanced, complex and delicious.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Snifter.

Appearance: Hazy light orange with billowing head that quickly dissolves into a thin white layer.

Aroma: Strong banana, some clove, citrus and peppery hops. Great semi-sweet fruity and spicy aroma overall.

Taste: Sweet banana and clove upfront, which then broadens to include slightly sour, almost wheat-like malts. Ends with a long lingering fruity and peppery finish. The cloves stay fairly prominent throughout.

Palate: Very effervescent, chewy body, with a dry finish. Slightly warming overall. Not a huge fan of the effervescent/chewy combination, although this improved a lot as the beer sat in the Snifter.

Overall: Very strong example of a Tripel, which I could certainly have many more times. However,the body slightly misses the mark for me, and I could have used a touch more hops and a touch less clove. These are minor gripes - simply explaining why this is not my favorite for the style.

Color is a cloudy gold with sediment throughout and a short lived white head. Aroma is sweet, with hints of apple, clove, and citrus. Taste is sweet, with the perfect amount of yeast to balance it out and a small flair of malt, with a short lived bitter finish. Slight carbonation and with a medium heaviness. An excellent beer all around.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Two year old bottle. Cloudy orange with a thin, white, bubbly head. Smells of orange zest, coriander, soft peach, and light grass. The yeast is much lighter on the nose than before. Dry medium body. Sweet initial taste of peach and apricot with earthy tones with wood and finishes with a bit of soft alcohol and coriander and cloves. It is not as pungent as a young bottle. Smooth and frothy. Lots of lingering peppery cloves. Stil has some booze I would like to age out. But much improved on a fresh bottle. 

Original rating from 2011 - Orange colour with sediment, sweet and fruity hints, earthy, peaches, oranges, heavy apricot, wood, dry and spicy, complex, taffee. heavy feel.

Bière de couleur blonde-ambrée légèrement trouble. Léger col qui se dissipe assez vite. Les arômes sont composés principalement dagrumes et de levures. Goût agréable de zeste dorange, dépices poivrées en harmonie avec lalcool, qui laisse une fine amertume en bouche.

Pours cloudy golden with a pale wet head.  Aroma of apples and spice (clove, cinnamon, etc...).  Brightness of apples with vinegar bitterness and some understated sweetness.  Juicy mouthfeel with some foaminess and a slight bitterness.  I always get the abbey styles mixed up, so i wasnt expecting this, but i was pleased nonetheless.
Bottle - big foamy head that fades quickly, hazy dark straw color, very yeasty fruitful flavor, very good
Bright Golden in Colour, with a huge head. Citus smell, with banana and spice. Tastes of banana and bread malt. My 1st non Belgian triple. A fine example of the style

750ml. Poursa beautiful vibrant orange. Notes of vanilla, lemon peel, white pepper, lots of esters. Taste is creamy with more notes of vanilla and a very pleasant, fruity finish. Sweet malt body with a complimenting dry finish. Lively carbonation. Very drinkable.
750 ml  bottle pours a cloudy yellow color with a big white head.  Aromas of yeast, clean hops, earthy.  Just a great example of a tripel

Pours a cloud light gold color with white head. Very light and sweet aroma that does a great job of masking the 9% alcohol. Taste if very well balanced with a nice warm and sweet feeling to it with only the slightest bit of fruit flavor. It is hard to pinpoint the exact flavors which is always a good sign to me. It means that the beer simply tastes like really good beer, and this one is especially nice, light, and almost fluffy like drinking a piece of cake.

Pours a light, cloudy honey color with a thick white head that fades fairly quickly.  Aroma is full of apples and banana with a general fruity sweetness.  Taste is bready malt with a medium sweetness.  The finish is warming and a little bitter with the hops shining through.  Very full bodied and complex.

Pours a hazy, nearly opaque amber/orange with a white, two finger head that dissipates rapidly. Nose is zesty citrus, orange, grapefruit, banana esters, peaches, apple cider, cereal, bubble-gum, yeast, coriander, cloves, and piney/grassy hops. Mouth feel is medium-thin to watery and decently carbonated. Taste-wise, bread malts and spice come in first on top of the classic Unibroue yeast; lemon, clementine, and lots of banana esters follow, with a hint of bitter hops near the end, but generally staying on the sweet side. The finish is semi-dry, and of moderate length, leaving banana bread, lemon and bitter grapefruit. A very pleasant tripel with nicely balanced flavours and aromas, and my introduction to Belgian style brews nearly a decade ago. My favourite Unibroue offering. It is very affordable, and goes well with pretty much any meal.

Good brew.  Pours hazy yellow with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is full of bread and citrus.  Very full in the mouth, sweet sticky citrus bite with a little bit of clove.  Very solid, would drink again.

Pours hazy golden orange with a fluffy white head. Smells bready and then moves to citrus and spices. Tastes of citrus up front and moves to fruitiness or candy sugar on the back end. Full-bodied with a smooth, creamy texture and present mouth-carbonation, La Fin Du Monde finishes rather sickly sweet.
Holy crap so good. My first tripel and definitely not the last. Sparked my interest in the style. So smooth!
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2011 Bottle. Excellent abbey tripel from Unibroue. Bold and strong, and quite malty.
500ml bottle. Yeasty and malty in the aroma and taste. A somewhat heavy, cloudy beer with a good taste.

Pours pale golden with a fluffy fading head. Nose is a wallop of pungent yeast, cloves, and some banana and other sweet fruitiness. Taste is sweet with a slightly tart bite to the finish. The palate is something else, as it pops on the tongue, finishing dry. Quite an experience. The 9% alcohol is wonderful and barely noticeable. Very well done.

La Fin du Monde ?  more than one of these and its La Fin du moi.
great beer, very strong in terms of alcohol and flavor as well.

A - the appearance of this beer is similar to a very light champagne. Not the most impressive appearance to the beer. Poured into a snifter glass with one half finger of head. Color is golden yellow. 

S - yeast notes and faint sweetness dominate the smell of this beer. Other than that there is not much of a smell to speak of.

T - Very good. Not the best beer I have had by far, but still some pleasant notes detectable in this beer. Can definitely taste some yeast funk in here with some sweet notes. Some dried fruits are present as well, but not to a great degree. Near the end of the sip there is some definite hop bitterness that becomes present.

M - very smooth mouthfeel to this beer. Some slight carbonation notes can be detected as well.

O - Overall there is not much to set this beer apart from other beers out there. The one thing that it does have going for it is that it is very drinkable and smooth on the palate. There is some hop bite near the end of the sip that makes a little less enjoyable for me, but overall it is an above average beer.

Appearance - Cloudy gold, not much head.

Smell - malt and spice

Taste - Fruity, especially banana. The spice and malt also come through. Great first impression and it stays great to the end.

Mouthful - Creamy and full.

Aroma-Alcohol is immediately apparent, very yeasty, with a sweet odor, bananas, vanilla especially

Appearance-Deep golden color, cloudy with a bright white, effervescent  head.

Taste-Very sweet and very yeasty. Sour, but pleasant finish.  Alcohol is apparent but not overpowering. 

Palate-Medium body, effervescent, with a slightly astringent finish.

Overall-A very good Tripel, surprisingly brewed in Quebec.  I think this can compete with any Belgian Tripel Ive ever had.
Pours a deep yellow with a small active off white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, clove, banana. Taste is lemon light fruits. A touch of sweetness. Very nice.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2012 Pours a hazy golden sunrise color with a tremendous towering white head that slowly dissipates in chunks leaving a rocky lace and spider webs across the glass. Nose is of fruity esters with notes of banana, clove, bubblegum, and a bit of spicy alcohol. Fairly full in body with a very fine champagne-like carbonation that is oh so smooth. Taste begins with a good deal of fruitiness (nectarine, pear, peach, mango, and white grape) and flowery honey blended with peppery clove. Next comes some powdery yeasts and a bit of bready malt followed by a touch of drying alcohol

Belle bière brumeuse couleur de paille, coiffée dun ample col blanc mousseux.  Des arômes floraux de miel et de girofle.  Légèrement amère avec une pointe de sucre.  De texture soyeuse, elle est moyennement effervescente et laisse une longue fin arômatique en bouche.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Appearance: 33cl bottle into Unibroue tulip. Beer is a cloudy gold color with a large white head.

Aroma: Estery and fruity. Bananas, cloves, peaches, coriander, vanilla. Its quite floral, also hints of caramel and white chocolate.

Taste: Unibroue signature flavor. Very sweet and fruity with a vanilla touch. Hoppy and sour finish. 
 
Palate: Pretty complex, medium mouthfeel, carbonation is on the high side but it complements the beer. 
 
Overall its pretty nice, though something about this yeast and a tripel doesnt sit right with me. The Unibroue strain for a dark ale on the other hand is excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2012 Poured a foggy orange into a trappist glass. The head was white and creamy, with thick sudsy lacing to follow. Aromas were compelling and sweet, full of honey, fig, vanilla, cinnamon, alcohol and a hint of bitter hops. The flavor was as fantastic, lightly carbonated and smooth. Notes of sweet tangerine, vanilla, raisins, cinnamon and alcohol are an escalator of robust complexity. The finish was warm and spicy, with a slight bitter aftertaste and warmth of alcohol. Quite the beer, even better probably, aged until the end of the world.
Excellent tripel. Proof that French speakers can brew a decent beer. Very smooth.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a generous white head. Aroma of barnyard, yeast, spice, dough and some earthy notes. Big taste of spices, cloves, banana bread notes, some bubblegum and yeast. Palate is huge with a really nice mouthfeel. Cloves leave a huge finish with some sugar. Alcohol is really well hidden. Wow, some really big flavors then finishes really clean. Nice.
Pours a straw color with a white head.  Fruity aroma.  Spicy, earthy flavors with clove, coriander, banana, and lemon notes.  Crisp, clean, and refreshing beer that hides the 9% abv.  Well balanced.

750ml bottle. Pale yellow, white head. Nice unibroue yeast, booze, sweet hops, and bubblegum. Huge carbonation, slightly sweet but gets sweeter, bit of hops, great spice and delicious taste. Finish keeps on going, great beer with a year or so on it.

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours a cloudy orange/amber with a small bubbly head. Aroma of grapefruit, peach, hops and yeast. Flavour very similar but also with some woody hints. Great carbonation and is well balanced. Bright and lively.

Sparkling clear amber color, pillowy white head
Smells of herbs, bread, nuts.
Sweet and sour, tastes as a champagne-beer hybrid.
Lively and refreshing in mouth
One of my favorites

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2011 330ml bottle (Beertopia, Nebraska) BB 6 months before drinking
7 Super full sweet fruity aroma, lots of peach and fleshy fruits. Really heady aroma. Classic, and restrained despit its boldness.
4 Mid orange, small tight head.
8 Super massive fruity taste, so much fleshy fruit, but a lovely aged barrel taste, so much sur lis, so dry in places, yet so full and woody.
4+ Smooth and soft, soft carbonation. Finish so woody and dry, but so smooth and soft.
16 Super mellow belgian brew, really appreciates the aging. Dont drink this young, let it age.

bottle 330 ml bbf 10/16/10 shared with FatPhil and Anna. Golden yellow white head and lovely fruity bit perfume scent.This bottle matured 3 years thanks to Anna\s parents. Taste rich fruity peachy and hints of perfume. I have tasted this beer last time 1996 and this is still rocking.
Im not a big fan of tripels and i wasnt really feeling this when i drank it. It is pretty good for a tripel. Standard qualities.

Le goût exceptionnel dun microbrasserie dont la constance est à tout épreuve est encore présent dans la Fin du Monde qui a de légères bulles qui roulent sur la langue et le goût dalcool qui nous reste en bouche est sublime.

Bottle 341 ml from Drinks of the world, Basel. Poured cloudy golden bronze in colour with white head. Malty and yeasty in aroma. Very tasty dried fruity flavour. Easily one of the best trippels Ive tried.
Golden color with a thin head. Overwhelming yeast aroma with slight hints of hay and roast.  Light body with carbonation similar to a champagne.

Poured from 750 ml bottle.  Somewhat hazy orange color and a nice tan head.  The first thing I smelled was banana and yeast, but the first taste rested my fears that this would be another simple bubblegum one. The taste is sweeter than I thought it would be, with a less sweet aftertaste of fruit and spices.   Ive seen this in many stores and finally got around to checking this out today. (2 days after the day my wife thought the world would end for us).  Im sure Ill try this one  several more times.  It goes well with the 1970 Sun Ra Arkestra recording "Its After the End of the World (Dont You Know That Yet?)"
Pours a dusty amber with a citrusy and floral nose.  Head is white and champagne like.  Fruity and light on the tongue with rolling carbonation.  Very delicious.
Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Yeast, malt and fruits in the aroma. Dark fruit, spices, yeast and sweetish malt. Medium body.

A - Pours a slightly haze bright golden-orange color with a big two fingers of super frothy white head. The head fades slowly down to a think ring leaving behind lots of lace.

S - Aroma is full of citrus fruits (orange) and banana and Belgian yeast. There is also some bready aroma, some light spices, and a touch of other sweetness.

T - Starts off with some tart lemon flavor and some light yeast. There is also a bit of spiciness in the background and some bready malt. Through the middle, the fruit flavor gets stronger with some banana flavor. The finish is a mix of citrus flavor and some tartness/sourness and some yeast and spices and a touch of alcohol that lingers very nicely.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Really smooth and crisp without being even a touch watery. The finish is a really nice blend of flavors with just the right amount of lingering tartness.

D - Very drinkable. The 9% abv here is dangerous, since it is hidden so well. Everything feels very well balanced and blends together very nicely.
Not my favorite Unibroue beer. A good one to try though. Pours a light tan color, fair amount of carbonation. Notes of caramel, hay, nutty. Alcohol is masked very well.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a cloudy golden straw colour with a big and fluffy white head. Very complex nose on it. Cloves, banana, honey, faint alcohol. Taste comes through just as complex. Rye bread, dried fruits, banana, spices and cloves. The yeast is the main man in this one. Great beer

Murky straw yellow body with huge head. Lots and lots of foam from the bottle... Strong flavor, but not as offensive as some stronger ales are. Lots of flavor, but not overpowering... Not sure what to think of this one. Flavorful and inoffensive, almost sweet, pleasant to drink. Ill definitely be getting more from these guys...

Cloudy Golden pour, white head.  Banana, yeast, honey and other fruits in the aroma.  Spices and fruits in the flavor as well.  Great mouthfeel, though some dont like the carbonation.  Goes down nicely.

Opened the 341 ml bottle and poured into a tulip, was a cloudy lt. gold, that had a nice head that reduced to a very nice lacing.
The aroma was complex light hints of spices and fruits and alcohol, well balanced.
Tasted as the aroma suggested no surprises here mild fruits, spices, honey, barest hint of alcol that left hardly any unpleasant after taste.
Medium to thin body, medium carbination, that leaves the mouth clean!
Overall I will revisit this one often it could become a favorite.
UPDATED: SEP 15, 2011 Pours a cloudy orange with a light white head. Aroma is banana, yeasty and alcohol. Flavor is pretty mild with banana, bread, belgian yeast, and a bit of pine. Not bad.
Pours apricot tinged yellow from bottle with an inch of foam. Yeast baker spice notes on the nose. Warmth and goodness on the tongue. Gets more intriguing as it warms. Finishes smooth.

341ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange, with a white head.  Aromas of honey, banana, clove, dough, faint alcohol.  Beautiful.  A giant complex nose.  The taste is just as complex.  Dried fruit, dark rye bread, alcohol, yeast, tropical fruit flavours, banana with a spicy burn in the finish.  I could pick apart the flavours more, but I just dont have the time.  Tremendous stuff.

Poured from bottle, pours a hazy golden with a nice white head that gave away to some lacing in the glass, aroma is of spices, cloves and a hint of grass, the flavor is very smooth and crisp with touches of fruit mixed in with the yeast and the spices, pretty enjoyable.

A: Golden and slightly hazy with a very nice white head that leaves behind a good amount of lacing.

S: Lots of sweet malt comes through before its overtaken by the yeast, which has a good amount of spiciness dominated by cloves.

T: The cloves spiciness dominates again and the 9.0abv exudes a nice alcohol warmth. Some grassy malt in the background, but this is all about the yeast.

M: Medium body with quite a bit of carbonation.

D: Sublimely drinkable. One of the beers that truly turned me on to the good stuff.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-01-2009

Bottle poured into tulip.  Huge, pillowy white head...pale yellow color, hazy.  Aroma is yeasty, spicy, pepper, slight apple, slight champagne, and candied fruits.  Complex and nice.  Nice medium body that rolls through the palate with some creaminess and soft carbonation.  Taste starts bitter and ends with a lingering thick sweetness.  Notes of Belgian ester fruit, candied sugar, slight caramel, slight vanilla.  Good, but not amazing, beer.
Bouteille 341 mL - Arômes citronnées, épicées et de grain. Beau corps malté en bouche. Goût de pommes avec la levure typique à Unibroue. Je redécouvre enfin Unibroue!
Nice Triple, bottle conditioned, citric notes, spice and green apple. Solid representation of the style.

Poured from a bottle into a tiny plastic stein at Brew Fest in Athens, GA. This sat palest yellow, almost the color of a pilsener, in the glass. Flavors of green grapes, green apples, and pears indicated the tripel style, with a slightly dry but not particularly satisfying finish. The body was a bit thin, which was pleasant amidst all the heavy beers on offing but not particularly Belgian. Overall, this is a good example of the style, but to my tastes not better than, say, Allagashs interpretation of the same.

I had this beer served in a La Fin du Monde tulip. The beer is dark brown with a beige head. The aroma is yeast and spiced. The taste is quite good with spices and low yeast flavors. Medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation. Overall this is a terrific example of the style and a very tasty beer. I drink this every New Years Eve just in case.

6 pack of 341 mL bottles bought from The Beer Store in Guelph, ON. Appearance is bright and hazy with a frothy white head that dissipates to a 1/4 inch lacing. This is my first Abbey Tripel, aroma of citrus reminds me of a German hefeweiss. Flavour is yeasty with a lingering bitterness on the back of the tongue 9% alcohol is relatively well hidden. Interesting beer but probably wouldnt go out of my way to buy again.

There is some spice to it and goldish tones followed with medium head. Full bodied for sure and very punch you in the mouth with flavor. Very blunt beginning and lingering finish. I like this beer for me and our future.
Love this beer. Even though these guys are are big, they have made no compromises.

Poured golden yellow and an off-white, lacing head. Yeasty aroma with honey, coriander, vanilla, somewhat fruity with hints of white grapes, peaches, and hops. Fairly dense with low carbonation. A pleasant surprise, well done.

750 ml bottle poured into pint glass. Pours cloudy orange-yellow. Aroma is very nice; spice, yeast, banana, bready malts. Mouthfeel is quite lively. Lots of banana in the taste, spicy. For such a high alcohol beer it is very refreshing. Nice stuff.
I consider this beer an alternative to delerium tremens and really nothing more. I dont drink either any more, however; it is a decent beer that has strong floral notes and carries good carbonation.

Bottle, Innisfil, Ontario, Canada.
BANG, KAPOW, BOOOOOM!
Shot straight to the midsection right here. Awesome golden pour, wicked carbonation - wasnt really expecting that (left this in the fridge for a week after opening and there were still plenty of bubbles!). The floral aroma is almost overpowering, but so is everything about this beer. Not for the weak at heart. I enjoyed it, but Im a little surprised at the lack of deep flavour; its clean and crisp but could do with a little more depth. Not my favorite style or a beer Id drink every day, but it is a pretty impressive beast.

This pours a very cloudy pale gold with a white head, decent lacing.

There is no distinct flavor, mostly hops.

Its taste very plain, its good, reminds me of Duvel. To me its a very high alcohol session beer. So Id drink tihs when I get to drunk.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a slightly hazy and bubbly pale gold with a small white head. The aroma is bananas, oranges, bread dough, cloves and some spiciness. The flavor is sweet up front with a mild bitterness and sour note in the finish. The palate is medium to heavy, high carbonation, and an astringent and acidic feel. Overall, a great tripel.
12oz bottle. cloudy golden color with a big white head. spicy nose, cloves. tasty first sip, light cloves again , a little bit of fruit and breadiness in the finish. Delicious

Hazy to cloudy yellow with healthy white carbonation.  Flavor and Aroma are of strong astringent wheat/grass.  The hop bitterness and flavor really melds well with the grain.  Almost tastes wheaty, and at times I detected hints of tartness from the yeast.  Less fruit than anticipated; relatively boring and balanced yeast character for a Belgian.  Only somewhat light-bodied and not very crisp.

Delicious, smooth and - if you dare to go for the big bottle on your own - like a sneaky thief that takes your legs out from under you. The subtle spice makes this a triple worth its rating. Plus, now that Ive found it in regular sized bottles, its a more regular treat.

Bottle pours hazy orange with an off-white head.  Aroma shows notes of banana, pear, peach, and some yeastiness.  Flavor shows the same with additional notes of apple, coriander, and white pepper. Overall
body is moderate and oily with a hint of alcohol on the finish as well as the nose.

I dont know that any substance can be rated as perfect, but this is as near as it gets. Sneaky alcohol content is the only possible drawback, as this beer is so smooth, refreshing and tantalizing, its easy to get carried away. One of, if not THE best beers Ive ever tried.

Pours from a 750 mL bottle with a beautiful hazy golden yellow color and is capped by a huge, light, fluffy, eggshell-white head. The aroma is more expected than exceptional, though, with a light musty yeastiness primarily, but also a bit of clove, fruit, and even a hint of earthy hops. The flavor is more impressive, with a combination of yeast, lemon, unripe pear, orange rind, and clove again, the overall impression is a wonderful dry, dull fruitiness combined with a characteristic Belgian-style yeast. The texture is creamy and delicate, but not in any way thin-bodied. Overall, this is certainly not one of my preferred styles, but this beer is addictive.

One of those beers that is always on the shelf, so I often overlook it... but it really is a good one. pours a foggy yellow. Smell is yeasty with a tangy citrus hop. sweet. Taste is delicious. Not usually a huge Tripel fan, but this one, for some hard to describe reason, is doing it for me.

Hadnt tried this since spring of 1995...until 03/05/2011! I wont even bother writing down my tasting notes from back then! Colour: medium yellow with surprisingly white head. Nose: Wheat, fall grass, bakery oven, wooden warehouse musk, red wine vinegar. Taste: Light sweet, medium bitter, medium sour. Heavy tannins, peanut, sweet pea pod skin, pumpernickel bread. Lots of voice from each distinct aroma and taste, nobody hides in the background here! Typical Unibroue quality.
Pours a cloudy pale gold. Yeasty, fruity on both nose and palate, orange, spices, creamy with some weight, finish lingers, quite delicious. Very good.
Hazy orange pour with with medium sized off white head. Aroma of cloves and yeast. Taste much of the same. I love this beer and start every weekend with a friday night beer. Unibroues signature beer.

Pours hazy orange-yellow with nice white head, aroma has big notes of clove, spice, some slight banana and yeast notes.  Taste is lots of spice notes, fruity esters with notes of apples and pears, touch of banana, finishing yeasty and spicy.  Nice tripel, tasty and drinkable, a bit harsh on the palate.

Nose very fruity, apples, pears, Belgian spiciness, Unibroue yeast. Pour cloudy golden orange big fluffy white head decent lacing. Taste lemon, coriander, clove, Belgian spice, breadiness, and citrus fruit. MF very crisp slightly dry champagne like feel. Excellent beer I have enjoyed many times.
Excellent tripel with a complex taste full of flavours and high alcohol content yet very drinkable without heaviness. Like Maudite it hides the high alcohol content well.

Appearance- Pours a murky honey gold with a huge white head that disappears completely in a matter of seconds.  



Aroma- The nose is very subtle and besides banana you have to search quite a bit to pick up any discernible aromas.. Other than banana the most prominent aroma was an earthy, soil like scent akin to the air on an early spring day. I also detected bubble gum and bready notes as well as a bit of spice and alcohol.



Taste- Rather sweet,  funky bubble gum like fruitiness with hints of banana and caramel followed by a touch of bitterness and no alcohol at all. 


Mouth feel- light.



Drinkability- As easy drinking a beer that Ive come across. Its almost to restrained in some ways.

This shit is bomb. Fruity (apple, citrus, grape) without being sweet and shitty. Gets a bit sour in the finish, like a crisp squeeze of lemon. Cant even taste the 9% alcohol. This beer is almost champagne-y actually. Just gorgeous.
Pours a light opaque blonde with quite a lot of sediment. Aroma is strong banana. Flavor is very smooth and not nearly as sweet as the aroma.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2016 Pours hazy with eternal white head. Estery banana pineapple pear nose, airplane cabin. Flavor esters bready sour yeast. Flavor could be more intricate. Benefits from warming - everything is the same, but better. Just slightly off on the mouthfeel - fizzy/thin. This is a good Belgian-style ale.
Previous rating 2/14/2011: Bottle in a Trappist glass. Nice and clear, head dissolves pretty quickly, carbonation stays active. Love this beer - a great Belgian-style brew. Aroma of bananas, orange and lemon, cookie spices, plus the faint hint of something sour and nasty. Lovely bright flavor, crisp and peppery and sour. Great balance of sweet, sour and bitter. 8/4/9/4/17

La fin du monde is unfiltered and golden yellow in color. It smells of Belgian yeasts and of light hops. The taste reflects the aroma, but there exists an explosion of awesomeness fitting perfect to this beer profile.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2012 pours hazy golden, slight orange hue, with a 2-finger white head, not so good retention, good lacing though. citrus aromas, cloves, orange, and sweet excellent-quality malts. finish is peppery (nice!), yeasty, orange blossom and great supporting hops that balances perfectly the sweetness - never cloying at all, that is. champagne-like bubbles, medium to full body. spectacular interpretation of the tripel style.

Bottle served in trappist glass. Very nice brew overall. Poured a nice clear light amber color with a solid head that slowly dissipated. Aroma was fruity and strong. Taste was full of spice such as clove and cinnamon with hints of citrus flavor. Very nice brew and very different. Enjoyable and definitely worth the price. Cheers!!!

Aroma is sweet and floral, similar to a hefe.  Pours a hazy, orangy golden with a thick, white head that dissipates quickly.  Taste leans much more towards a citrusy Belgian, than a strong Pale.  Light and fizzy on the palate, but dont let that fool you, as it is 9% alcohol.  Overall, this Abbey Tripel stands tall.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2011 bottle in a snifter.  Hazy golden pour with huge head like a hefe.  Mild aroma of cider and spice.  Very mild flavor for such a big tripel.  Well balanced and delicious.  Excellent beer.
A solid tripel that I have had in bottle and on draft. It has a subtle frutiness and spiciness.

The look of this beer elicits weather analogies for some reason. I would describe it as a gloomy golden orange  cloudy, with a chance of two fingers of fluffy white head. Head recedes to clear skies after a couple minutes.

The nose is spicy  I can smell coriander and pepper. There are also distinct floral notes. There is a touch of sweetness that I would be inclined to say is honey. You can still smell the malts in the background. Quite complex

The taste is equally complex and a lot of the same players are present. Spiciness is again at the forefront of the charge but it is being backed up by a touch of clove not detected in the nose. The beer tastes a little sweet and some fruit starts to come through along with sweet understated honey. The alcohol is clearly present but subdued  well at least until the beer begins to warm. There is a dry finish.

The texture is smooth and creamy with wonderfully balanced carbonation for the medium body.
Love the smell of this beer every time I drink it, pours cloudy with a great head. Smooth and very flavourful even for a wheat beer, sweet after notes. Amazing beer for the price.
Just an all around wonderful beer.  Hides the alcohol content nicely behind a malty taste and beautiful head.  These Canadians do little wrong.

Bottle poured into a trappist glass. Pours a cloudy pale gold/orange color with a minimal white head and minimal lacing. Nose of golden apple, fancy maple syrup, white grapes, citrus hops. An initially sweet honey flavor that ends with a spicy kick. Heavy carbonation gives this brew a seltzer-like effect with a pleasantly dry palate. This is a subtle tripel; none of the flavors are too overbearing and there is a nice balance between all of the flavors.
Wow what a crazy beer. Beer produces great head has a hoppy yet suttle taste. Very enjoyable
Very strong alcohol kick mixed in with the tropical fruit mixed in with the sediment makes it easy to choose this as great.  No clue why its a twist top with foil on it, though.

Pours a cloudy golden/straw color with a rather large fluffy white head that sticks around for a while. Lots of carbonation here, I almost overflowed my glass. Aromas of bubble gum, fruity esters, spicy yeast, oh my this smells great! Taste is spicy, peppery but not over the top. A bit of alcohol lingers in the finish. Full body, prickly carbonation, almost creamy mouthfeel. Great brew! This was one of the first Belgian inspired beers that I tried oh so many years ago, I cant believe Im just getting around to reviewing it now.

Bottle- Pours a hazy golden color with a good head that fades slowly to nice lacing. Has a mild fruit aroma with some sweetness and a hint of spices mixed in. Not a over powering aroma just seems to be "spot-on".
 There is a nice mixture of spicy sweetness. Has a perfect touch of bitterness with a slightly dry finish. Medium body, creamy and smooth. Beer has an fantastic balance with the 9% ABV well hidden. Great drinker. A benchmark to measure others of this style by. It is a excellent sipper to savor.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2011 Minimal head with no lacing over a hazy, pale amber.   Aroma is nice, light fruit soap.  A subtle, lightly sour, peach beer.  A sticky, fruity palate but soft and sophisticated.  A good Abbey Tripel.
(bottle)  So easy to drink and simply enjoy.  Belgian spices and mild malty flavor.   This brewer continues to get it right.

750ml. Bottle. Pours clear and fizzy with a heavy frothy head. Strong yeast and malt flavors dominate the aroma. Both the palate and taste comes together as a perfect team. Excellant combination of taste and drinkability in this perfectly crafted beer; as must for beer lovers...add it to your bucket list!
La Fin Du Monde is a great Tripel. Lots of floral, spice, and citrus aromas. It tastes like it smells and is a very nicely balanced beer. I also got some alcohol taste in it.
awesome trippel . Full mouthfeel, slightly cloudy. Very aromatic belgian yeast notes follow through on the palate.

I first had this at Rudyards Pub in Houston years ago, and other than Guinness and other common imports, was one of the first beers that helped get me into craft beer. Hazy golden, slightly orange, with a nice little white head. Delicious aroma of yeast, fruit, spices and hay. Taste is sweet and yeasty, but well balanced by a soft, slightly dry bitterness. A touch fizzy, dry on the palate, and medium bodied. A tad muddy on the tonge, but otherwise, really nice tripel.
Lovely belgian style tripel.  Full mouthfeel, slightly cloudy.   Very aromatic belgian yeast notes follow through on the palate.

Hazy orangish pour with a ton of thick foamy and lacy head.  Strong citrus and spice... cinnamon.. scent.  Very ballanced and well blended.  Citrus, spices, hops.  Lots of hops.  All blended very well.  Really digging this, which shouldnt surprise me as my favorite styles are double and tipples.  The reason it does though is back when I bought beer to get drunk, I bought this due to the high alcohol content and just didnt dig it.  I much preferred Maudit.  Im actually known locally as the guy that showed up to parties with Maudit.  I could have sworn I still preferred Maudit.  I was wrong.  This is a great beer.
Another great offering from Unibroue.  Phenolic clove aroma and flavour.    Med - High carbonation with a slightly dry finish.

It has a very flowery aroma rich with spice. Pours with a thich head which displays the picture of the smell well. This beer reminds you that beer doesnt have to taste like beer. I found it smoothe yet the aftertaste was a little harsh. You can taste the alcholol and it is present through the finish. La Fin Du Monde is a beer that each beer lover should try and many will love. The only issue  is that i felt the finish was a little bit more harsh than others I have had recently. I do enjoy La Fin Du Monde, but the fact you can taste the boozyness may put others off.

Had this beer at dinner with marcus and the wifes at out friends restraunt called Kuprows in dowtown Sacramento. Beer had a citrus aroma and a classic belgium tripple taste. Very sweet and citrusy. Poured a cloudy golden color with a light wjite head.

Poured into a Czecgvar lager glass.

4.0 A: Hazy yellow orange color. Lots of bubbling. Two fingers of white frothy head. Average retention and some lacing.

4.5 S: Really nice. Big phenolic clove. Light fruity esters.

4.5 T: Big on spice: clove and pepper. Sweet mild malts. Alcohol is hidden really well, but still warms. Not a whole lot of hop character, but what is there balances the beer well.

4.0 M: Medium body. Really smooth and creamy, but a bit too much carbonation.

5.0 D: I could drink the hell out of this.

I fail to see what the big deal is with this beer. Its amazing for sure, but not "world class".

Update: I get it now. After the first bottle of this I ended up craving another. I had another and then still wanted yet another. Im going to review this beer again someday, and I think it might make it to "world class" in my world.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-21-2008 02:17:31

Pours a very light yellow/gold color that is a hint of things to come. Aroma is of citrus and spice, and a decent amount of each. Head is thin and frothy pure white. Tastes of spice and a perfect amount of alcohol, citrus is of lemon and peach it seems like, with spices most evidently being of clove and cardamom. Decently bodied beer that seems royal in both appearance and taste.

A pungent, interesting and complex beer, but Im not sure all the flavours match. I spent half an hour trying to pinpoint that delightful, mysterious peppery slightly sweet/slightly floral aroma from memory, then remembered my moms Biryani recipe ... which uses lots of ... CARDAMOM spice! The aroma translates to the taste too ... definitely CARDAMOMmy. Sadly, a pine-needle, junipery-aroma overpowers the delicate cardamom. 

Taste is predominantly citrus, but theres an overpowered peach too ... again, sadly. GOOD but not that drinkable really --rather a very sharp, strong, spicy beer that you have to be in the mood for. In an excellent value 750ml bottle, best for sharing. Personally I dont care for the slight meaty/gym-sock pungency and the sour aftertaste. But at 9%, this beer is worth consideration..
Hazy orange beer with a small white head. Smells of fruit and spices. I taste a lot of peach in the beer. Its a nice flavour. Sweet, spicy, with peaches. nice.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow with small white head.  Aroma is spices, earthyness, wheat and citrus.  Taste is sweet with alcohol providing a warming sensation on the finish.  Very light mouthfeel with good carbonation.  Mummers 2011!

Pours a cloudy golden color with one finger foamy white head. Smell is of yeast and fruit; distinctly Belgian here. Light citrus and banana notes, alongside an almost wheaty smell. Taste is big on the yeast; spicy, peppery, and fruity. Fizzy carbonation; as often as the term is thrown around I could consider this the champagne of beers. This leads to a creamy texture, along a medium-thick body. Alcohol well hidden, dangerously unnoticeable.

Several 750 ml bottles shared with friends. A cloudy golden amber beer pours into our  La Fin tulips  and produces a 2 to 3 inchhead which disappears leaving some nice lacing. Aromas of spices Belgium yeast esters. hints of bananas apricots pears necterines spices such as cloves and sweet toasted   malts. Tastes similar to smells mainly sweet roasted malts Belgium yeasts and fruits. Medium mouth feel due to carbonation. Finishes sweet with very little hop presence. 9 percent abv is not noticeable. One of our favorites along with Mauldite and Golden Monkey.

Sometimes a beer just catches you at the right moment. I love the look of a cloudy golden beer. The aroma is sweet and wheaty (is that even a word?). This is probably more of a summer beer, but Im enjoying it after shoveling it snow for the last few hours.

Oh "The End of The Word" If its here I would definately want to be drinking  La Fin Du Monde. This is my Favorite Beer since the first time, I shared one with a friend of mine who introduced me to other beers. "Wow what a beer I said to him this is it ". There is a reason why this beer has won so many awards and its flavor which I call it Nectar of the gods comes through till the last drop. I have tried other beers like Chimay, Duvel, Pliney the elder, Arrogant bastard, Hoegarrden, But your the one La Fin a great beer that I would recommend to my friends and Brothers. Enjoy I surely will!

Just from the look of La Fin Du Monde, the experience had me thinking of champagne with the foil top and the cork. It even smells a bit like champagne and sweet grapes. The color is a delightful, hazy yellow. The taste starts citrusy, then on to grapes, and finishes a bit dry with a spicy, peppery bite. The 9% ABV is present, but not overpowering. This is complex, smooth, and quite enjoyable.

It pours with a medium white head, nice redish colour, a little cloudy, 
Then the pungent acrid smell of wet feet and gym socks assaults the nose... pushing past it to the first taste a green grape winey sharp taste with little body and the flavour of sucking on those gym socks mentioned earlier.
The finish was long into the next beer we grabbed for to rid our minds of this swill, bringing a shudder and a throat closing memory.  The white wine headache will be a lasting reminder for a few hours of why I will avert my eyes and stay clear of this in future

750 ml bottle. Pours hazy orange gold with a fluffy white head. Floral nose, yeasty, overripe fruit. Nice amount of carbonation, medium body. Taste is fairly sweet, notes of fruit, pears, apples, grapes, candy, balanced with a big yeasty stanky spice. Great beer.
Overall, not a bad beer, just a little florally and punkey tasting for me a one and done... average at best.

A thicker floral tasting beer which is definitely an acquired taste. Cloudy and pours with a fantastic head. Has an aroma of strong hops and an overall floral taste as mentioned before. A great winter beer that at 9% will keep you warm on those cold nights. So far my favorite of the Unibroue brews Ive tasted.

Citrusy sweet aroma with Belgian wit tones
When pored, it appears golden amber with a small white head, plenty of carbonation, slightly hazy. 
It has a bitter taste with strong flavors of alcohol.

My best guess with this beer is they were trying to develop a Belgian White (Wit) and had problems with the first fermentation. They then did a second fermentation with Champagne yeast, and a third with Ale(?) yeast. 

Not quite a White, Not quite a Ale, Not quite Wine......

Dont get me wrong... its a good tasting beer (?) but it makes me wonder.
Sampled from a 750ml bottle. Pours a cloudy light brown, minimal head. Aroma is sweet. Taste is quite smooth. Genuinely a pleasure to drink.
Pours golden hazy yellow-orange; attractive sweet Belgian aroma; tripel tastes with cando accents and largely sweet overtones; finish is sweet and almost a little syrupy
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2011 pours a cloudy golden with a white head and very little lacing.  aroma is yeasty.  taste is light and complex.  taste is lightly sweet and bitter.

750ml bottle shared. pours a hazy yellow with minimal head that quickly dissipates. nice floral/citrusy nose. the taste is of a triple with lots of carbonation and mild hops. well worth the pour and taste if you ever get a chance.

A nice hops aroma with a hint of citrus/floral.  The beer pours golden with a medium white head and dissipates quickly.  It stays a hazy golden.  It has a medium sweetness, light body, fizzy carbonation, and a nice smooth finish.  I would suggest this to anyone who likes to try new beers and is looking for a good beer to frequent and tell others about.

Pours a hazy yellow with a fluffy and full white head.  Decent retention, minimal lacing.  Smells of Belgian yeasts to the core, citrus and spices adding to that.  Wonderful smell.  The Belgian yeast, citrus, and spices show themselves first in the taste.  Making way for slight hop bitterness and warming alcohol to finish it off.  One of my favorite representations of the style.  Bubbly and light.  Very inviting drink.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2011 Hazy, dusty orange. Fresh yellow fruit, sourdough, lemon, leaves. Nice aroma. Oily, rich texture giving rise to a sweet yet balanced body and loads of taste in the mouth. Stays there for some time. Great ale that suit my taste well.
9th July 2006  Warning! Early amateur rating! Opaque beer. Strong taste with a bitter undertone. Dry almost woody finish. Okay.

Hazy light orange-yellow body with a slightly off-white head.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, citrus, and spice.  The flavor is that of an excellent tripel.  Fruity, but not too sweet.  Spicy, with some subtle alcohol warmth.  Its nicely carbonated, but not overly so.  Very crisp.

12FL oz bottles pours a wonderfully rich and complex beer. Delightful full aroma starts off this great brew.With an amazing cloudy fibrent light golden color with pleanty of body this brew delights every sence. One thing canada got right is this beer. Catching up rob.

Tasted from corked and caged 750mL bottle at Lush West Town.  Pours hazy golden with a thick white head that leaves thick lace after receding slowly.  The nose is fruity and spicy with signature Unibroue yeast and a good amount of caramel malt with alcohol burn.  The beer has some lemon sweetness up front with the spicy yeast taking over from there, and leaving light hops bitterness and caramel malt.  The body is medium but oily with lively carbonation and a long sweet malt finish.

12 oz bottle from Zipps.  Cloudy orange pour, LOTS of foamy white head that leaves very nice lacing.  Spicy, yeasty aroma, Im picking up the notes of honey that the brewery mentions.  Smells awesome.  Flavor is also spicy, yeasty with some citrus notes and a sweet finish with more honey.  I really like this beer.

Poured into small yard, cloudy gold in color, perfect head in my opinion, nice aroma. Very smooth, glides across the tongue leaving a very good aftertaste, a touch warming as well. Thank you sir, may I have another!

22oz bottle pour into 8oz tulip. thin white head  breaks up fast, cloudy deep honey color. Smells of orange peel, mild sweet notes, some spice and fruit. Taste is a very good mix of citrus & herbal hops, apples, mild sweet malts, spice notes, medium alcohol warmth. Lite bodied, carbonation is crisp effervescent. A very good balance of hops, malts, alcohol, carbonation. 9% abv comes thru as a lingering warmth. Nice one to sit and enjoy!
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2012 Smells similar to a hefe, looks like one too. Yeasty taste, some fruit I cant quite place, spices, hops; almost has an orange juice like flavor as it warms. Very good beer.
n kanadensisk abbey tripel som hade mycket trevliga kola- och citrustoner, aningen söt men helt klart prisvärd.
Cloudy. Not what I expected. Some taste that I like but mostly what I dont like.

Golden with a lovely white head. The aroma is somewhat honeyish, with some orange peel, bread dough. The taste is moderately sweet upfront but also very floral. The finish yeasty, peppery. The alcohol well hidden. Creamy medium body.

750mL Bottle. Pours light orange with white head. Aromas: Cloves, banana, yeast, sweet malt. On the palate there are soft, sweet malt flavours with yeast esters and a hint of spicy hops - all sitting in near-perfect balance. Very good tripel.
12oz bottle. Scent is floral, spice, citrus and banana. Pours a soft hazy yellow. Taste is sweet, citrus, with pleasant spices. Good, but Im not a lover of the Belgian style to start.

What a magnificent beer this is, light amber and a thin white head, with a floral nose and touches of clove and banana. Pronounced fruitiness and refreshing spiciness. Given its ABV, this was a superbly smooth beer and not at all harsh.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2017 bottle.  Poured hazy straw coloured with a thin white head. Strong fruity aroma of peaches, orange citrus. Full mouthfeel, dry palate. Soft malts and spicy peppery notes. Yeast and alcohol prominent.

Golden pour with a big, pillowy, white head with loads of champagne like bubbles emanating from the bottom of the glass.  The aroma is a bright and delicate mix of wildflowers, orange peel, lemon zest, candi sugar, bread dough, and bubblegum esters.  The taste is moderately sweet upfront but also very floral.  Theres some bright notes of citrus zest upfront as well.  The middle is chewy and doughy with a little straw and estery notes.  The finish yeasty, peppery, musty and funky in that classic Unibroue way.  The alcohol is well hidden.  Creamy medium body with lots of tingly carbonation.

Notes from Monday, June 21, 2010
12 oz. bottle from Benz Beverage Depot, Marion Iowa

Ar: Big banana nose with a bit of funky yeast and light malt, light clove/ginger.
Ap: Pours a completely opaque gold with a creamy two finger head of tightly knit bubbles.  The head lasts quite a long time, and leaves a good bit of lace on the bottle.
T: The clove follows through on the tasting, and with some light malt and classic Unibroue yeast.
P: The creamy head contributes greatly to the body of this beer.  Nice medium thick body with a good deal of effervescent carbonation.

O: Another great Belgian from Unibroue.
O:

Pours dark and hazy gold-yellow.  Citrus, spicey aroma with a hint of dough.  Taste is of fruit, wheat, spice and a bit of earthiness - a lot of subtleties here I have a hard time putting into words.   High carbonation, medium body.  It really does hide the higher ABV, with a very smoothe finish.  Outstanding beer.  A little more wheaty than other Tripels Ive had, but overall, an excellent, well balanced brew.

Hazy golden colored brew with aromas of fruits, spice, and dough. The taste is one of bananas, oranges, cinnamon spice, wheat notes, and some other mixed tropical fruits. Very complex mixing flavors actually, but all quite delicious. Goes down smooth, very enjoyable. Would order up again.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2011 Pours golden, pretty cloudy. 
Aroma is floral, bread, cereal, apple, dough, spices.
TAste is Pear, apple, malt, coriander, cardamom, really wheaty. Alcohol is present, but somewhat well hidden considering this is a 9%ABV (and more). 
 Extremely non-bitter, perfect carbonation.  
At times, if feels a bit like an Imperial Weizenbock due to the fact that this one is very wheaty.

This beer has a beautiful cloudiness, some opacity though its more translucent. Lighter golden color. Aroma is dried floral hops, some rustic barnyard-esque qualities, caramel, nectarine, and some cinnamon. Taste is granny smith apple, caramel, some dried pear, and white pepper. The alcohol comes through too strong on the palate, too -- just too hot -- which is the only glaring imperfection here. Otherwise a very nicely balanced brew!
Pours hazy pale gold with thick foamy white head and lacing.  Aroma similar to a hefeweizen with notes of wheat, orange peel, and corriander.  Taste is well balanced; smooth and sessionable.
Bottle. Nice aromatic notes - peach, grapefruit, melon... Hoppy base to the same fruity flavours. Im half-assing this review, but its a good one.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2012 Fresh aroma, Cloudy yellow golden color.  Decent head.  Medium sweetness, you can tel the alcohol level is there.  Light to med body.  Carnonation more on lively side.  A spicy beglium beer.  Not my fav of the Unibroue beers that ive had, but still worthy of a try.  Very complex flavor that you have to try.
Off whtie diminishing head, pours a clear amber, lemon and spice aroma, spice and wheat taste, very smooth.

Has a white like colour due to cloudyness imparted by the yeasts and has great foamy head. fruity esters that are almost citrus like. very appealing aroma. it is a highly carbonated beverage and has some fruity esters and vanilla like qualities. good balance for the alcohol and a very very good drink!
Howevewr, having had quite a few tripels in this the last few months i would say that it does have some competition in this category.
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2010 aroma, not very rememberable, light. this is an ok drink, I prob wouldnt buy this again.

Aroma is lemon, spices and mild horseblanket. Orange peel. Sweet and pleasant.

The appearance is a cloudy matte of golden yellow. Golden lava lamp with bubbles. Decent white head. Great.

Flavor is hints of sour apple, pear, lemon and orange rind. Puckery on the swallow. Some Belgian funk, but beautifully matched by the sweetness and pucker. Some soil as well.

The palate is fizzy, spicy, prickly.

Overall its a sweet and slighly sour, prickly tripel. Sweetness offsets the earthy funk. Good-to-excellent.

Bottle:
Big white foamy head.
Color is slight hazy orange.
Smell lots of fruit (peach, orange, apple, citrus), spices, sweets, hint of hops and hint of alcohol.
Taste is hoppy and sweet with hints of fruit, sugars, malts, yeast and spices.
Soft and creamy mouthfeel, long pretty fresh and fruity/bitter aftertaste that turns just a hint to a light dry end.
Very well balanced which made me enjoy this one.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: From 12 oz bottle poured into clean jar (while camping) displays aroma of simple syrup and syrup from canned fruit, punctuated by some clove phenols. Color is just past golden, with moderate haze and persistent white head that leaves lacing. Flavor has a foundation of pilsner maltiness with clove, plus pear glaze turning to honey as the beer warms. Theres a definite hop note that is metallic- this balances nicely. Mouthfeel is medium-lean and creamy, which is counterbalanced by effervescence. Complex presentation of yeast character, well-attenuated with dry finish.
Bottle. Fruit, flowers and alcohol in aroma. Unclear yellow-orange colour with white head. Sweet flavour with ripe fruits and honey. Slightli dry finish. Very elegant.

Aroma: Sweet fruit aroma, with a hint of alcohol.  Apple, pear and banana are the fruits that I picked upAppearance:  No head at all.
