Also some alcoholic esters and yeast are evident. Fantastic taste of peppery clove and other spices, aforementioned fruits, and sweet malts on the finish. Slight hops bitterness brings it all together in the end. Medium to full bodied, very nice caqrbonation, soft pillowy mouthfeel, and the alcohol is exceptionally warming. This is terrific.

750ml bottle. NIce white head- not rocky but firm and lacing stays on glass nicely. Nicely carbonated, lots of bubbles, straw coloring. Mild and pleasing aroma, spicy with some mile hoppyness. NIce taste with a mild bite of bitterness.

A nice beer for the price.
cloudy and light colour with a big head. Complex fruity and bready flavours. Interesting aftertaste, almost tasted like baked beans, in the best possible way. A very good beer.

Another exquisite brew from these guys, I have enjoyed all of these so far... I also get the TJ versions too... starts with a sizable head that settles to a 3/4 finger head/lacing with fine champagne like effers, very nice aromas of candied dried apricots, citrus zest, baking spices and some bready yeast, almost white ale like but with heavier malting and fruitiness... this may not be the traditional triple but go for it anyways, it wont dissappoint... flavors are a complex balanced creamy blend of apricots, peaches, citrusy zest some ginger and nutmeg like spices... the fruits expell themselves on the light creamy finish... I like this one a lot.

Poured out of a bottle created a head so big I only got 3/4 of the bottle.  The head died down to a solid finger that stayed throughout the rest of the glass.  The color is a very attractive cloudy dark maize.

Very complex and smooth aroma, with an alcoholic warmth to finish.

Taste is fantastic.  Very complex fruity flavor up front with clove and spice on the back end and I cant taste the alcohol, which is quite impressive for its 9% abv.

Palate is also fantastic, it is very thick, rich, and dare say creamy.  It goes down exceptionally smoothly and leaves your mouth watering for the next sip.

Overall this beer is fantastic.  With the ratings so high for everything else, how could my overall score be any less?
from 750ml bottle - need to find my notes from the Unibroue tasting at my local supermarket.  Very easy drinking ale.  One of my favorites.
Pours a cloudy orange with a nice white head. Aroma of belgian yeasts, cloves, citrus. Flavor is yeasts, spices, coriander, wheat, esthers. Nice fizzy mouthfeel, and super easy drinking at 9%
Orange with a grey head. Orange-like aroma combined with yeast. Sweet flavours dominated by sugar, peach, pepper and yeast. It’s refreshing and powerful. A nice tripel.

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy honey color with one finger creamy head.  Nose is cloves, yeast and fruit bubblegum.  Taste is tangy citrus, spicy Belgian yeast and a souring finish that fades into sweet fruits again.  Medium mouth feel.  An easier drinker but quite warming at 9%.
Golden wheat color with little head.  Very malty and bitter. Strong flavor of cloves and coriander. Velvety feel on the tongue. Alcohol is slightly noticable.  Taste definitely improved as it warmed.

Sorpresissimo da questo prodotto Unibroue, comperato in una botteghella di rue des Abbesses e bevuto la sera di fronte alle previsioni meteo del televideo. Sorpreso perché lo trovo rinfrescante, come una buona birra di frumento, e allo stesso tempo caloroso come una tripel (anche se non tradirebbe mai il suo tenore alcolico). Insomma, questa birra mi ha dato una buona impressione, nonostante la sua forse eccessiva dolcezza (ma diamine, è pur sempre - o vorrebbe essere - una tripel!)

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2011 Crushed with Jakebra.  Malty as hell.  Not quite sure what to make of it.  Wheat beer tendencies for sure.  Definitely had better beers from Unibroue.  
Theres something weird going on here that doesnt agree, aight?

Corked 750ml bottle, lightly chilled. Very clean, lively, viscous-looking golden body with small dense creamy white head. Yeasty aroma; plenty of spice, clove and coriander among others, ripe apricots and pear, hay-like with a distinct sweet bread character, alcohol is slightly noticable. Lively carbonation, creamy texture, syrup-like consistency adding overall sweetness, warming on the way down. Plenty of spicy fruit complexity on the body; dried fruits, pepper, coriander seed, cinnamon bread (donut?), really ripe banana, cereal wheat, alcohol on the finish...i could probably keep on going on with comparisons, but you get the idea. Finish is slightly dry, a hint of bitterness and somewhat very well balanced. Really liked this one, for all of the right reasons, and I was reluctant to leave it to age, also for the right reasons it seems!

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 750ml from Total Wine, Durham. Still my favorite of the Unibroue beers. But funny, Ive never thought of this as a tripel at all; it still seems more like a Belgian strong of their usual variety, with tastes of darker fruits and esters coming through. True, the body is nicely light and lively, and theres a crisp, easy-drinking finish here. More of a hybrid, then. But it remains a delightful brew.

What I would call one of the defining offerings from this brewery. Pour was like a thick cider but held an impressive head. Taste was of sweet fruit to the point of almost being syrupy. Definite alcohol notes rounded that out though. What really sets this apart is the sharp carbonation along with a fluffy palate. Finally something good I can say about Canada.
(Bottle).  Fruity sweet aroma.  Gold amber color with white head.  Flavor is sweet citrus and pineapple, but luckily not *overly* sweet.   Nice comforting finish.   Well done.

Pours a dark gold with a boisterous, frothy head and light lacing. Aroma holds yeast, spice, and coriander- very nice. Flavor is excellent- yeast, spice, orange peel, with a sticky mouthfeel. Damn good brew.
Poured a golden blonde with an impressive thick white head. Aroma extremely pleasant with mostly spicy notes. Taste was smooth, with spices, hops and malts. A very well balanced and delicious beer.

Thick, off-white head that dissolved slowly yet left almost no lacing. Very dark orange-gold color with a lot of sediment. Strong, spicy aroma with a slightly fruity bouquet. It had a very strong, spicy flavor with highlighted fruity notes and a slow, sour finish. You can definitely tell that it’s triple fermented, but despite the high alcohol by volume, it doesn’t affect the flavor at all.

One of my favorites, and it only gets better with a couple of months in the cellar.
poured a nice creamy golden orange color with a dissipating head.   lots of carbonation and lots of alcohol.  fruity flavor with yeast aftertaste.
Nice color with a good fruity taste. Strong alcool volume but not pronounced. Good overall beer in the line of Unibroue’s style.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2009 lovely gold-red color with nice full white head,fruity malty taste, nice lasting palate, very strong alcohol volume.
great beer.... love it.

[1382-20080523] Tap. Fruity yeast aroma has notes of heathery grass. Hazy, light orange brown body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Wheaty fruit flavour is boozy. Light-medium body, alcohol is quite noticeable. Did I mention it was booooozy? What *is* the world coming to anyway?
(@ C’est What; Toronto, ON)

bottle poured into a tulip has a lightly hazed orange copper color and a thick white two finger head that dissipated quickly. aroma has spices, strong floral yeast, dark fruited malt, banana, and light licorice. mouth feel is medium light with heavy carbonation. flavor is a bit lighter than the nose led on but with plenty of yeast, spice, grass, wheat, and dark fruited malt. high abv. is totally concealed in the flavor and it finishes with tingling carbonation and yeast. very enjoyable.

12 oz. bottle - Poured a beautiful golden color with large foaming head with great carbonation. Aroma is mild, fruity and also alcohol. Flavor is smooth, well balanced and High ABV. is not evident. I liked the brew but not my favorite style.

Very light colored with a thin head.  Very aromatic with flower and spice throughout.  Easy to drink, definite fruity sweetness to it, maybe banana.  Overall great beer but there are better from Unibroue.
I had this in Lausanne, and I was not impressed. The alcoholic content is evident and the citric taste is not sufficient to cover it up.

Not my favorite but this is highly distinctive. Yeasty like a belgian style beer with a hint of  floral yumminess. 

I liked this one. Watch out one is a doozy. I was plowed after one 750ml bottle.

From Vinhandlen i Vibycenteret. Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 310708.
Light amber with white head. Aroma of spices and fruit esters. Flavor of yeast, orange and a dry finish. High carbination

12oz bottle at Annie Bailey’s Irish Pub, Lancaster, PA...pours cloudy amber-yellow, white head...aroma of spice, citrus-banana fruit, yeast...flavor offered much of the same, had a chewyness to it...I’m still not sold on this style, I’ll take the 9% though.  ;-)
Single from Three Cellars Milwaukee.  Good fruit and spice aruma. Big Spice taste and very flavorful.

Bottle, lovely gold-orange color with nice white head. Nose is sweet, yeasty, fruity with ripe orange notes. Sweet flavor on super-lively carbonation with booziness showing through a bit much. Sweet, strong and impractical.
A rich, yeasty concoction.  It’s light and fruity, and finishes with a quite a twang.  A great brew, but there are other Unibroue offerings that I like even more.

Flaske. Årgang 2005. Super trippel, blid og afrundet men med en imponerende karbonering alderen taget i betragtning. Uklar strågul øl med en smule rødlige nuancer. Duften er svagt gæret og lidt frugtet. Smagen er blid og rund uden at alkoholen mærkes. Super øl.
This beer is an experience. Pours a hazy gold with a lively head and active carbonation. The smell is ripe with fruit, yeast and spice. The taste is tart and refreshing at the same time.

Pours an opaque, bubbly golden color with a white head that doesn’t fade.  The aroma is lightly fruity, yeasty, lightly spicy and a bit musty.  Taste is similar with a nice refreshing lemony flavor.  Quite lively carbonation.  Overall a nice refreshing summer beer with hardly any hint of the ABV.

Bottle:  Pours a dusty and cloudy blonde with a large, frothy white head.  Aroma is light and fruity.  Some bits of florals and spice.  Flavor presents a little bit of yeast and typical spices.  Light fruitiness and hints of apple.  Not real intense, other than the heavy carbonation.  Just wasn’t feeling this one.

This is an old bottle - best before date on bottle says 2002 and it’s 2008. Giving it a shot anyway. Pours a cloudy gold. Lemon hint in the aroma, along with some apple. Drinking out of the style glass they recommend which I’m sure helps the aroma. Sweet flavor, very drinkable. A bit fizzy and somewhat refreshing, a nice summer beer. Better than I thought it was going to be.
Lots of strong flavors. This is the first triple fermented beer (i think) and I enjoyed it.I have drank a tMore importantly its 9%

I was a little disappointed with this one, I must say. Its a good ale overall, but leaves a lot to be desired. It feels like they rushed this one, not giving it time or attention to full development. Sweet apricot and tangerine flavors are present, with a little lemon peel for fun. Doesnt compare to Three Pistols or Maudite, in my opinion. I would pass on this one for the money.

Bottle:  Wow, what a beer.  This beer poured a hazy dark yellow with a small amount of white head.  The aroma is of apples, citrus, yeast and mustyness.  The flavor is refreshing, hints of apples, bananas, cloves, and bread.  Overall, one of the best beers Ive had.

Bottle pours a hazy yellow with a typical huge foamy white head and lots of blocky lacing.   Musty aroma  and o sweet vegetative notes.  Light cereal flavors with the yeasty dusty Belgian slant.  Livel carbonation and a light body.
Thabks to Jake or sharing this one that somehow escaped me this long.

I would like to say that this is my favorite beer right now. It is so refreshing in the summertime. It is a nice cloudy gold on the eye and a beautiful fruity smell with strong scents of banana and hints of clove and apple. It tastes much like the smell with a mild finish that gives it a refreshing summer feel that leaves you wanting more. love this beer
Bottle at Århus Ølfestival 2008. Pours a clear yellow with a small head. Aroma is vinious and fruity. Flavour is sweat and vinious with fruits and yeast - very nice palate.

I can’t believe I waited so long to try this. Appearance is a cloudy dark yellow woth a quickly receeding white head. Aroma is dominated by fruity esters, particularily pear, with notes of corriander and bubblegum. Taste us much the same, with pears and apricots being most dominant, with light spices, yeat and a noticable alcohol flavour following. Mouthfeel is wieghty, full and even a little creamy. A great beer.

Very nice! A beautiful and well made beer. A nice spicy and yeasty aroma. The flavours pack quite a punch. Wonderful yeasty, corriander and fruity levels of taste backed by the alcohol taste at the end. There are so many levels of taste on the tongue and scents for the nose that it really is a feast for the senses. I do have a weakness for Unibroue beers though.

Pours a cloudy yellow, thin white head--not much lacing on it.  The flavor is sweet with lots of yeast.  Banana, clove, and yeast in a  rich, long-lasting finish.  Flavors are a bit muddy on this one to me--good tripel, but not great.

Pours clouded medium gold.  Decent head at first but it fades quickly.  Flavor initially sweet on the tongue, then a burst of citrus.  Flavors of lemon, apricot, yeast, and bold cloves.  There is also a unique tartness underlying the sweet flavor, which is a pleasant surprise. Offers a nice crisp medium to heavy body and a creamy finish with lingering citrus, spice, and a touch of alcohol.  Very excellent beer.

Bottle into Chalice. Pours a cloudy gold with a 1 finger, pillowy white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Aroma is spicy yeast and ripe apricots and peaches. Flavor starts out with a light candy sweetness, then hits big with overripe golden fruits (apricot, peach, pear) and a notable spiciness from both the yeast and (less so) from the alcohol. Finish is ripe fruits, yeast spice, alcohol, slightly astringent. Carbonation is quite crisp at the beginning, providing an interesting dryness, but the beer still pulls off a creamy finish. Interesting flavor development in this beer - starts off light before exploding, matching the mouthfeel in development. An interesting take, excellent beer.
Nice spicy tripel.  Served from the bottle.  Pours light tan with a creamy head.  Flavors with a mix of fruit and yeast.
Blury, yellow, Sweet, citrus, yeasty, spicey,  with a complimentry bitter finish.

Appearance : blond (on lie)
Aroma : fruity
Flavors : fruity
Body : 8/10
Finish : 8/10
Overall experience : one of the best beer of the world.

You must have many of this beer in your reserve.  You should let it get older at least 2 or 3 years for better resutls.

Pours a very light yellow color and gives off a huge clove like nose.  More carbonated than many Belgians that I have had bur good nonetheless.  It also has a sugary sweet note to it with a sharp bitterness at the end
Very distinct, yummy aftertaste - fruity and yeasty.  Gots to keep this ice cold - doesn’t taste as good warm.  Dee-lich!
Bottle 35cl. Aroma is really spicey with some banana notes. Taste is spicey with lots of fruity notes,not the best tripel but still very good,

12 oz bottle, as i poured into a glass cup i can already smell the fruity character of the beer with a hint of clove, a pale hazy color, with a very fine foamy head reaching at about two fingers in thickness, a fine crisp feel and a fruity taste of tangerine, apricot, liquorish, and some spiciness. a strong but not over powering taste of alcohol. dry finish with a lasting bitter bite. great beer!

75cl bottle shared with larryLSB.   Hazy golden orange color with a lasting white head.   The aroma is yeasty and quite fruity with lots of tangy apricot and tangerine.   The flavor is also yeasty, with some of that apricot sweetness, some citric tartness and alcohol.   There is definitely some spiciness too.   Full-bodied with lively carbonation.   When I added the yeast at the end, the alcohol really smoothed out and this became a very nice tripel.

Golden in color with nice white head.  Aroma is yeasty and fruity.  Tastes of a triple and a strong golden ale.  Crisp, slightly tart with a mile hop bite (or is that the prickliness of the carbonation?) but the fruity notes play a more prominent role in this beer.

Sampled during Cellars Wine & Spirits Wednesday evening tasting via Unibroue representative. Pours a hazy golden pale brew with a thick white head that slowly dissipates. Aroma of sweet golden malt, yeast, some cloves, mild spice and a touch of pineapple. Taste is medium bodied, some carbonation with flavors of semi-tart fruit, golden grain malt, yeast and a touch of banana. Finish is semi-sweet with a tart fruit and yeast aftertaste.
Very pale yellow pour with a two finger white foamy head.  Clove/spice on the nose as well as banana.  Crushed bacon on the taste along with yeastiness and alcohol.  Dry finish.
Pours pale gold with big white head. Fruit and yeast. Tartness and fruit. Lots of yeast and alcohol coming through in the flavor.

Pours an orange yellow with nice carbonation.  Smells of fruit and yeast. Flavor is fruity with nice mouthfeel.  Hides the alcohol.
I really enjoy this beer. Im sure it isnt the best example of a tripel but it tastes very good.
An outstanding brew. Well hopped, bold taste, clean finishing. The alcohol content makes me happy.

Bottle, corkd and caged. Highly overrated! I can think of a million better ways to "end the world", than with a headache. Completely out of there league interpretation of a triple! Not even worth the price of admittence.

bottle; poured hazy straw with two finger white head. yeasty fruity tropical coolada of esters. slight malt up front fades to many tropical fruit esters. banana pineapple with some yeasty peach. lingering tartness with slight presence of hops.

12oz bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a honey yellow with a white, one-finger head that dissipates quickly but still laces the glass as the beer recedes. Aroma is grass, straw, and citrus with hints of complex spice. Flavor is slightly sweet with a slight spiciness as well.  Notes of citrus (mainly orange) and clove as present as well. Somewhat lingering enjoyable finish. One of our favorite tripels and a perennial drinker. . .  .
This beer reminded me of a saison or a farm house ale.  Hazy golden orange pour with a moderate head.  Wild sweet yeast flavor.  Good beer but almost deserves a different classification.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 12 oz bottle. pours golden orange. nice head, high carbonation. fruity with citrus flavors. really didnt like the metallic taste of this one. perhaps I got a bad bottle, but this beer was poor at best.


re-rate: 12 oz bottle. still pours golden orange. same carbonation and head. Lots of citrus/fruit flavors, quite yeasty. Again, not my favorite beer, but it left a better impression on me than before-- though only slightly.

re-rated again, because this beer is too good to be bad: I think the bottles I got before were simply too old. This one is lively, spicy, the alcohol is quite very well hidden. Beautiful mouthfeel, most of the flavor is early, and it subtly fades. A nice nice triple in the end.

0.33 l bottle. Hazy golden color with thick creamy head, very fizzy. Tart, fruity, peppery and clovey aroma with notes of vanilla. Sweetish initially followed by tart and dry finish. Very tart, fruity and spicy flavor with orange, pineapple, clove, pepper and warming alcohol. Very high carbonation. The carbonation is too much for me but still this is an excellent tripel!

Bottle: This was the first Belgian Style Ale I had ever tried, and I remember it blew me away.  I have since revisited this wonderful brew.  It pours a hazy golden with a fruity aroma.  The flavor is also fruity with some citrus.  A complexity of flavors.  It is heavily carbonated.

Bottle into a pint glass. It pours a magnificent foamy head. Very nice aromas, very fruity, almost like a sweet white wine. Very pale, golden color. Some caramel, citrics and yeasty (no dark malts to cover it). Very nicely balanced. Good palate. Clean finish. Great!
Bottle at home ... a gusher so very hazy orange ... a strong belgian hopped ale ... fruit estery again belgian hop ... little caramel litttle orange  ... quite tasty

Presentation: It was poured from a 750ml bottle that is corked and caged into a chalice. It has a hazy body with a light golden amber color with a pale orange hue. The head is smooth, thick and creamy with good retention. It has a creamy off white color and it leaves behind soft lacing as it is slowly sipped down to the bottom of the glass. The aroma is full and fruity. There is sweet orange citrus and spicy character with a big hit of yeast and tropical fruits like pineapple. It has a sweet rich and fruity malt and yeast flavor up front. Tropical fruit like pineapple and guava are noted. Soft spices come out and the alcohol starts to warm things up. Hops add a light citrus and leafy flavor before the yeast comes back out and turns powdery and slightly dry in the slow lingering finish. The texture is smooth and creamy with perfect carbonation for the medium body. Outstanding and wonderfully complex with great drinkability.

Great looking beer. It rivaled Duvel for foamy head, and had beautiful lacing. Head settles down to about a quarter inch that lasted throughout. Not quite as chunky as Duvel. Opaque, orangish yellow color. 

Aroma was very Belgian. Yeasty, sugary, fruity. 

Tasted much like liquid bubblegum, with some hints of orange and candy. Very well balanced. 

Nice mouthfeel. Light carbonation. An excellent finish, leaving the mouth clean and wanting more. 

This is an excellent beer. Well balanced, and each sip leaves you wanting more. A little strong to drink a lot of, but an excellent choice that I will buy again.
Bottle. Cool room temperature.  Poured pale blonde with a thick white head.  Full fruity and floral aroma.  Wonderful full all over the tongue flavor.  Lasting floral aroma.  Lovely beer.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Darker orange, murky. Fluffy white frosting head. Zesty carbonation up front which leads to spice. Warming alcohol and some light bitterness on the back end. Light fruits and orange present in nose and flavor. Cant believe this is the first time I rated this classic.

This pours a pretty golden-orange, fairly clear, not a lot of head. Aroma is malty with a strong hint of citrus. Flavor is strong and malty and has some hoppy and fruity hints. Finish is smooth and refreshing. This is an insidious beer, though, as you dont taste the alcohol, so it can sneak up on you.
Another great beer from Unibroue.  Similar to a belgian. Great fruity flavor with excellent finish.  I could drink this all day every day.
Bottled. Hazy, yellow, very foamy. Honey-fruit aroma. Very good taste, a bit of fruits and even cognac. Good, long finish.
Bottle. Poured cloudy orange with a large and frothy head. Scent of fruits and cloves. Complex fruit flavor and a sweet and slight alcohol finish. Solid tripel.
Yellow with a small white head. Exotic fruit aroma, some mango and some pineapple. Dry yeast-dominated flavour. Tasty, and not cloying like tripels often are to me.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2009 Pours a light yellow with a small creamy head. Very sweet malt and fruity aroma. Banana and clove notes. Sweet banana and orange notes in the flavor. Some spicy hops show in the finish. Alcohol becomes more apparent as it warms. Medium bodied and very sweet, this beer is an easy to drink summer beer, that has enough body to not drink too quickly. Could be very complimentary to a light summer meal.
murky gold pour. nice fruity aroma and such a tasty brew. . Not even close to my favorite style, but I will go out of my way for this!
pours honey orange.  aroma is very yeasty and fruity.  tastes about the same.  overcarbed.

This was a great beer, I dont know why but I was always a skeptic of "good" Canadian brew- shows what I know. It poured a hazey, clouded over golden colour with a big white head. aromas were sweet of nectarines, oranges and other decidious fruits. Very creamy mouthfeel. The head kept coming back. Great beer.

Golden honey-blond and hazy with a thick white head. Aroma is pleasantly fruity. Apples, pears, pineapple, honeydew melon. A little bit of hops. The flavor is pleasant and understated. Some banana and nutmeg. Extremely drinkable. Loved it.
Pours yellowish/ goldenish, and cloudy.  Smells um... stereotypical.  The flavor is sweet and fruity.  Later in the drink it tastes soapy and spicy but in a good way.  Mildly citric with yeasts.

Aroma is grainy. Appearance is hazy golden, Flavor is pretty straight forward. Heavy and sweet initially and then just seconds later nothing on the palate and just a little burn in the throat. Ultimately, not too shabby.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2008 Cloudy, hazy off yellow appearance with sediment.  Heavy cream head that dissipates  somewhat slowly.  Nice lacing.

The initial attack is of yeast, over ripe apricot, some wood and light fruit.  Though I tasted some mild soapiness, perhaps a breakdown of fatty acid.  Perhaps it was the glass (I was not at home).  Still a lot of fermentation leads to some excellent CO2.

Fruity dry finish, light hop.  This beer has a decent mouthfeel and subtle alcohol taste for its content.

 Complex flavor.  But not as enjoyable as I expected.  Though Im not sure I had a fair shake at it.
This is a good brew, but definitely overpriced and definitely overrated. Save yer money, chums!

A beautiful beer.  Cloudy golden orange color with moderate white head that really lasts and has good lacing.  Aroma is light, with citrus, coriander and yeast.  Flavor is much stronger than the aroma, with continued citrus, some banana, bread and floral notes and some spice in the finish.  I have to disagree a bit with the poster below me--I think the flavor actually hides the 9% ABV very well.  It is medium to full bodied with a smooth creamy mouthfeel.  A very nice beer and a surprisingly good representative of the style.

Pours a cloudy apricot colour with a lot of yeast sediment visible and a nice foamy head.

Has a classic belgian tripel aroma, fruits (apple, apricots and banana) and spice, but not too heavy.

The flavour is something of a letdown, it is absolutely dominated by the alcohol and the other flavours are a little too light to really stand up to it.

It is a pleasant beer to sip, but I prefer a subtler, less alcoholic tripel like the underrated Grimbergen Blonde.

On my second try at a beer and cheese tasting I combined it with a very strong cheddar (Lincolnshire Poachers Full Bore) and it really transformed the experience.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2008 (From bottle at Opal Devines on May 25, 2008) Pours a cloudy orange, looks a bit like a dark hefeweizen/weissbier.  Lots of carbonation.  Frothy, carbonated white head.  Taste is also reminiscent of a weissbier.  Slight citrus with spice.  Aroma is sweet with similar accents.  Seems light for a tripel.  Very easy to drink.

12 oz bottle, poured gold with frothy white head, which mostly dissipated and left light lacing.  Aroma of malt, yeast, apple, citrus...very sweet smell.  Taste is sweet with a crisp, dry finish.  Light to medium bodied, with fizzy mouthfeel.  A very good non-Belgian tripel, a great example of the style.  Tasty!

wow, Unibroue hits another one out of the ballpark. smells of citrus, yeast and malts. initial flavor is bread and a little malt and citrus. then after a couple of seconds there is a wallop of tropical fruit. warms over the pallete amazingly well. another great beer from this company.

2008-Apr-25 from a 750 ml bottle.  Spicy lemon and clove aroma.  Golden and cloudy with a good head.  Upon drinking there is an initial bite, then citrus, then a dry finish.  Lacks a good finish on the tongue.

750 ml bottle.
Hazy pour, not much head, aroma of bananas and fruit.  Very nice mouthfeel, nice finish.  One of the best of Unibroue.

12oz. bottle.  Orange-hay pour, very hazy, nice small, creamy head.  Inital fruity aromas, tropical fruit, pineapples, pretty yeasty.  Really nice, creamy on the palate, alot of fruits, with a soft, gentle washing effect that I cant describe.  Some sweet banana bread fights through the mangos, peaches, and spices.  Very nice.

3/15/08 notes:  from bottle, I got to try this beer again thanks to my friend Pat.  Pours a muddy peach color that is cloudy (I assume it is unfiltered?).  Smell that hits you is a sweet, fruity one, which might be effectively reproduced by mixing lemon peel, coriander, orange, grass and cotton candy.  This beer is strongly carbonated, has a fairly light body (for an Abbey Tripel), and contains minimal traces of 9% alcohol.  Strong rum fruit-cake flavor, along with banana and clove.  I found the flavor to build as this beer warmed, and that trademark unibroue fruitcakiness stayed in my mouth well after the gulp.  Memorable beer, but still not quite my cup of tea; I prefer Ommegangs Belgians.

Thin headon good carbonation,misty orange pour.Aroma is mainly clove,coriander,banana,ginger notes.Flavour banana,clove,coriander,orange mild,cinnamon,is a sweet and tasty beer easy to enjoy.Finish is peppery or ginger like,sweet dry.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2008 High quality tripel. Very easy to drink, made a good summer beer. Cloudy golden hue. Fruity, lemony smell. Taste is well rounded, fruity and spicey. Alcohol not very detectable.

Golden Amber with a slight greenish hue and a nice cream head.  Sweet baby fruit smell, and as others say, the enticing smell of raw dough.  Complex flavor, with banana baby food, bright citrus, holiday spices, a hint of russian tea.  Nice finish.  I enjoy this very much.  Makes me nostalgic for the holidays.  I need to remember this next Thanksgiving or Christmas.

Aroma is fresh dough with flours and a touch of lemon spice.  Bubbly head, nice lacing, pearl yellow gold color.  intense clove candy sweetness, slight sourness, mild bitterness.  Huge carbonation, smooth finish, alcohol barely makes itself noticeable.  This is a fantastic beer, one of the best non-Belgian Tripels available.  Awesome!
750 ML corked bottle.  Pours a dark hazy straw color.  Sweet and sticky beer.  Tastes like cake.  Very bubbly. Light bitterness on the finish.  Good but not great.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2008 12 oz. bottle.  Pours hazy pale yellow with a large head.  Aromas of sweet apple and a bit of alcohol.  Flavors are tart and sweet apple and citrus, spice, and a lingering touch of hops.  A bit of alcohol in the finish.  Carbonation is a bit too high, but its a decent beer.

12 oz into pint glass.  Hazy dirty brown pour with fizzy white head and lots of fine carbonation.  Gentle aromas of orange, malts, some hops, and apricot.  Strange citrus flavor, not too flavorful in my opinion; but it is a refreshing beer for spring/summer that is dangerously drinkable.  Fizzy and soft on the palate; medium bodied, almost champagne-like.

Beautiful tripel: opaque golden-orange with another cloud-like fluffy white head. Dusty scents of citrus, pepper, yeast, and alcohol. Taste is a little sweeter (and perhaps one-sided) with dominance from citrus and slight yeast and alcohol. Pretty dry. A good beer but not my favorite tripel.
This one was a little to sweet for my taste. Has a nice orangish color/white head. It has a bready/fruity/spicy flavor and is very sweet. This is a desert beer.

Pours a golden orange with a thick white head that leaves some nice lacing.  Aroma of peaches and citrus, with some yeast and spiciness as well.  Flavor is similar and sweet.  Nice alcohol bite.  Very nice.

Bouteille de 341 ml. La bière se présente avec une robe dorée légèrement voilée et une mousse imposante au départ mais qui par la suite laisse place à une fine couverture. Au nez on découvre des arômes de coriandre, dagrumes, dalcool, de levure, de banane, de mangue, de pêche et de poire. En bouche la bière a un corps moyen et nous dévoiles des saveurs fruitées, dagrumes, dalcool, de levure et de sucre. La finale est fruitée avec une touche poivrée.

a very nice and very drinkable tripel.  Alcohol content well hidden.  for me seems to have some  similarity in flavour to  a hoegaaden forbidden fruit?  either way is a very nice triple, not the best Ive had but far from the worst.  Very nice

Pours orange with fizzy head that goes away fairly quickly. Notes of oranges, lemon, apples, and spices. Mouthfeel is very crisp, almost soda-like. Thin, but refreshing. A bit of an alcohol burn. Definitely a warm weather beer. I took off a few overall points because I was a bit misled by the style, and it is expensive in my state. But it is an excellent example of a crisp, bready, citrus beer.

Bière forte à 9% similaire auc triples belges des trappistes. Note dépices et de fruits. Le goût du houblon et du malt sont très présent. La texture est très agréable. Légère amertûme à la finale.
Excellente bière qubécoise!!!

Finally sampled this at the Unibroue beer tasting Fairfield, OH.  This is one of those beers that youve always wanted to drink but never got around to buying it.  So this just kind of fell in my lap.  I was reasonably impressed by the bright gold body, large marshmallowy head, and decoration of Belgian lace on the glass.  I think of this color as "kings gold"... and a Duvel instantly comes to mind. There is an immediate scent of Belgian candi sugar, dessert apples in cinammon; very sweet, swimming with caramel. The taste, as expected, was strong, sweet, and only slightly bitter with fresh, bright, citrus notes, lingering candy, and tropical fruits ( a hint of mango perhaps.) Overall a lusciously soft palate and medium/ long finish.  I cant say this exceeded my expectations, but thats only because I already had set them so high.  The same goes for all of Unibroues beer.  I expect nothing but the best from them, and Ive never recieved anything less than that.

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a fizzy white head. Yeasty, light wheaty, orange and mil spice aroma. Flavour is medium sweet towards orange citric. Light yeasty spice note and coriander. Light orange fruity flavour into the finish with a light mellow yeast note.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2008 really nice, a sort of darker delirium tremens in flavor. pale, but cloudy goldenrod color, inch thick white foamy head. floral bouquet on the nose. hoppy, floral, lemony, banana on the after taste

Cloudy, very pale tan color with a foamy white head.  Aroma of yeast, spiced citrus and dough.  Flavor is malt and citrus with a complex blend of allspice, cloves and nutmeg coming in, finished off with a hit of cinnamon.  Sparkling carbonation but still very smooth with a nice medium body.  A big bottle at 9% ABV so youd better have some rats to share it with (or people, if youre into that).

its been a while since i had this beer, but i remember it being really good.  it has something like 9% by volume, so a bomber will get you feeling pretty good.  i cant say too much about its flavor since it was so long ago but its good.

Poured a hazy apricot color with a firm two fingers of head that falls slowly leaving scattered lace. The nose was variations of citrus. Grapefruit, orange and lemon with bready malt and spice beneth. The taste started malty, almost doughy then came subtle citrusy hops of gapefruit and orange. A spiciness rounded off the finish with hints of nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice and a smidge of pepper. Nicely complex. This was a very smooth, warming ale, full of body. Its very drinkable, however its 9% ABV. will put you on your ass fast.

Bouteille brune de 750 ml. Arômes de levure légèrement épicée. Robe dorée, effervescence à grosse bulles. Plutôt sucrée en bouche, elle présente une touche épicée (coriandre, poivre) intéressante. Lalcool réchauffe la gorge en arrière-goût.

A- Pours a deep golden color with a huge eggshell white head. Lots of carbonation bubbles are present.

S- Smells of Belgian yeast, spicy, funk, and a sweetness.

T- Taste is very spicy and semi sweet. Mixed lighter fruits and a bit of alcohol are present. A bit cloying.

M- Medium viscosity with a good amount of carbonation. Sticks to the inside of the mouth.

D- I know lots of other people like this beer but I just dont dig it. For me the funk and sweetness combined with the stickiness makes it less than drinkable.

Bottle. Poured a hazy orange color with a lasting white head that left a bit of lace behind. The aroma was citrus-dominated with a hint of alcohol. Lots of oranges. Sweet on the tongue with citrus and light clove flavors. Much fruitier than I had expected, but a pretty good beer.

Bottle. Cloudy golden with small white head. Fruity aroma of orange zest and spicy notes. Flavour is sweet with a nice balance of malts and spices. Smooth palate and the alcohol is hidden well. Top brew.

Bottle pours cloudy orange with sediment and a fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity, peach, orange, and spicy, cinnamon maybe. Nice medium smooth body. Flavor is sweet with more peach and orange, also clove and nutmeg. Finish is dry. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2008 absolutely terrific beer, fruity tasting easy to drink , remarkable that it has 9% alcohol, this one of the best examples of a belgian ive tried, i wish it was better distributed.

A hazy golden beer with a modest white head that doesnt last too long. The aroma is definitely that of belgian yeast, with spice and a hint of spicy noble hops. Some fruity notes as well. The flavor reminds me of a wheat beer, not unlike Don de Dieu, with some citrusy notes and an overall sweetness, but of course more intense and with a stronger malt base and definite belgian influence. A little alcohol heat on the finish. Quite bubbly on the tongue.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2008 This was declicious.  Pour was medium hazy golden with thick but short lasting white head.  Aroma is of sweet yeasty esters with spice.  The spices are blended quite well balancing with the floral and fruity characters.  Definitely a tasty brew.  Would buy again.

Hazy yellow with a large white head.  Aroma of yeast, mixed fruit and spice.  Taste is smooth and sweet with orange, banana evident.  Perhaps a little too sweet but decently balanced.  Alcohol is barely noticeable.
nice tripel.  From bottle.  Doesnt mask alcohol to well in either flavor or aroma, but hey, its a tripel.  Stong fruitiness/maltiness.
This is a high quality beer.  Nice aroma and flavors of yeast, fruit and good hops to balance.  I like this beer!!

Unibroue La Fin Du Monde is an orange beer with a small but everlasting creamy head. The aroms is very sweet with notes of fruit and hints of hops. The flavor is also very sweet with fruit and hints of alcohol. WIth many silimar aromas and flavors to a witbier, orane and corriander, I enjoyed this ale very much.

Entry 99: Unibroue La Fin du Monde
ABV: 9%
Calories: estimated at 200 C
Volume: 12 fl oz
Glass: 4 oz goblet
Purchased at: The Beer Outlet as part of a Unibroue sampler case @$64
Price: $2.66
Consumed at: home

sensory first impression: Very much like champagne. bubbles floating in streams. brilliant and clear with a singular yellowish gold color. Celebratory and beautiful. A very special treat for beer number 99.

Aroma: 8 out of 10
Malt Hop Yeast Other flavors include: apple, cider, banana, spices, cinnamon, butter, dry, crisp, sweet.

Visuals: 4 out of 5
Color Liquid Head and lace are: a simple color, but brilliantly clear and sparkling, without any head to speak of - great legs but no lace.

Taste: 9 out of 10
Malty Sweet Hoppy Bitter Sour flavors are: very sweet, layered fruit and sugars, with a carbonated bite and finish. Might as well be a sparkling wine. Alcohol is expertly hidden.

Palate: 5 out of 5
Body Mouthfeel Texture Carbonation Finish are: Very fresh, highly carbonated, crisp, dry and biting. Finish is long and fruity, with ripe aftertaste.

Overall experience: 18 out of 20. I liked the flavors, visuals, aroma, and feeling of this beer very much. A very fitting 99th entry.

Part of a blind taste test with Don de Deu and Trois Pistoles.  Liked this almost as much as Trois.  The aroma was great, dried fruits, cloves, banana.  Flavor was also good but not quite to the level of the Trois.  Overall, a great beer.
Clear golden of color with a nice white foamy head. An aroma of spice, apricot, dried fruits and sweet hints. A flavor of sweets, spice and fresh fruits.

pours a cloudy really dark yellow with a little orange tint to it, and a 11/2 finger bubbly off white head that disappears quickly. aroma is Belgian yeast, pineapple, and melon. also has a little lemon wheat to it. has a light to medium body with minimal lacing and good carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma. the Belgian yeast stays on the tongue for a bit and altogether not bad. also the 9% abv is well hidden.

Pours a somewhat cloudy, thick, blonde color. Nice sized head that does fizzle down quite a bit. That was disappointing. Strong aroma consisting of citrus bananas, cloves, vanilla and an overall strong alcohol presence. Theres a lot there. The mouthfeel is pretty full although something seems a bit off with a tangy, somewhat sour, very yeasty, citrus (oranges and bananas) flavor. There is an alcohol rush in there so you know its 9%. Ive had other Tripels recently that are better, Karmeliet and Chimay Cinq Cents come to mind, but this is pretty good.

Nice cloudy yellow-orange with a generous white head that settles down to a 1 cm thick layer. Scent is spicy, fruity and crisp. Not over carbonated. Not much bitterness in the taste, very clean finish. Subtle spicy, citrusy flavours. The 9% ABV is not noticeable, making for an easy drink. Refreshing and nice.

Pours a hazy straw yellow with a big white head that quickly dissapears into nothing. Aroma isnt anything special, lightly sweet fruit notes and some spicey notes.  The flavour is pretty decent, the yeast is pretty straight forward, with some fruity and spicey notes, it strangely enough goes quit good with black jelly beans.

Very intersting beer. 4pk from Crown. 12oz bottle poured into a trappist glass. Nice hazy gold color with a huge fizzy white head. Nose is very much like a good belgian white. Lots of coriander and spice and of course yeast. I detect some clove and cinnamon in there as well, quite complex for the style. Taste is apple, coriander and clove and tons of spicy yeast. This has alot going on and the carbonation is high which all but makes the high ABV completely disappear. This is quite exceptional. A pleasant suprise and worth the money. Its worth noting that this bears no resemblance to any triples I have had. I dunno if its labeled wrong or if this is just their unusual take on the style but despite being rather light it has none of the hoppiness I have seen in other trippels Ive had.

750ml LCBO. Bubbly cloudy gold with foamy head that disappears quicky. Surprised that the cork didnt seem to have any pop to it because in the small bottle, it would foam so much, you couldnt keep it in the glass. Strong Unibroue yeasty aroma. Sweet warm bubbly yeasty taste that hides the alcohol well. Yeasty aroma and taste are too over the top for me.
An orange and hazy beer with a lot of sediments in it. Pours an off-white head. Very spicy with strong notes of yeast, orange and citrus. The alcohol is almost non-existent.

Yeast yeast and yeast. But that is to be expected from the style. Very sweet tripel that has tons of corriander, enough to knock a building over with. It tastes a bit one dimensional to me, and with a macro tinge to it. Overall a good beer that I am glad I got to try, but not really my thing in general. I rated with a curve since I know abbey tripels arent my style of choice.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2011 Bottle - LCBO: Hazy golden orange, small white head. Citrus & wheat aroma, reminds me of la mild Hefeweizen. Flavour: A citrus and spice mix, really enjoyable, the alcohol is well hidden (I didnt notice the ABV till I went to put the rating in) it has a long lemon finish. Nice indeed

Pours orange-gold with a frothy head.  Aroma of straw, banana, yeast, citrus, and spice.  Taste is the same.  Relatively low carbination.  Finish is clean and slightly bitter.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden.  An excellent triple.
Grassy and citrus flavor, with the yeast spice one expects from a good tripel. Light and refreshing, especially for 9%.

pours cloudy golden with decent head retention. very nice light citrus aroma, there is almost a slight grassy aroma. great spicy yeast profile. light mouthfeel. definitely doesnt look as strong as it is.

bottle poured into a Duvel glass. pours a cloudy golden color with a good sized white head resting on top. smells of lemon peel, clove, and coriander, much like a Belgian Wit. taste is also much like a Wit though a bit dryer. good but nothing truly exceptional.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2009 Bottle...Pours a cloudy golden color, medium head with good retention with medium lacing. Citrus aroma. Flavor of bannana, clove, and other fruity notes & alcohole spice. Medium mouth feel with medium carbonation.....I really dont see what all the hype is...is good. ......but nothing special......

A bright yet hazy golden colour with large head. Has a great mouthfeel, taste is the perfect amount of candy sweetness and yeastiness, the 9% alc can be felt but not tasted. A very refreshing strong beer,  a staple in my rotation.

Pours cloudy peach with wavy patterns of residual yeast and a billowy, lasting two finger head. Nose of tart apricot, yeast, citrus, and spicyness in the form of ginger and clove. Flavor was citrus zest, a hint of alcohol kick, and complex yeast flavors. Hoppy for a belgian too. Quite resfreshing, smooth, drinkable, and suprisingly mellow. Dry, tart finish. Very nice- would expect nothing less from Unibroue.
Cloudy, hazy golden colored brew. Fruity aroma. Sweet, smooth, yeasty flavor with some fruity flavors. Nice one.

750 ml, bb 09-17-10. Huge foam on top of the slightly hazy, pale orange-gold brew. Honey, bubblegum, slight dry herb and resin in the aroma. Apple-grape vinous notes, bubblegum, spicy yeast, fruity alcohol, and floral honey in the taste.  Light-medium body is sometimes smooth, sometimes fizzy; with an alcohol-dryness that provides a chest-warming swallow.

Pours moderately tame for a Belgian, even if it is Canadian. Paler cloudy yellow, but looks full-bodied. Large pure white dense foam head. Intense bubbling. Smells like faint wild yeast and malt.  Taste is sweet, wild and congestive.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma is yeast/perfume/herbs and coriander and some fruitiness. Flavour is yeast, herbs, coriander and some citrus tartness.
Copper in color with a pretty good head.  Aroma has fruit, spices, and yeast.  Taste has fruitiness and different spices.  Smooth and easy to drink.

A beautiful beer with loads of flavour that sips nicely despite the higher alcohol. I could just sit on this all night and sip at it, each mouth full is as good as the last. The aroma is quite complex with, fruit and spice that flows through to the palate.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2010 tried this with the maudite.  Not bad though.  THe aroma wasnt great, just liek the maudite, but the body was nice and the flavor was smooth to drink.
Re-rate. Incredible brew. I dont know what i was thinking before. But i love this beer now. i must have been drunk when i rated this the first time.

Bottle (355ml). Poured a hazy orangey cold with small chunks of sediment and a dense frothy head which was mostly lasting. Aroma was of yeast, dough, orange zest cinnamon coriander and some cloves. Flavor was of bready yeast with a mild bitterness, some orange zest, cinnamon, coriander, cloves (mild) and a spicy finish (light). Full bodied with soft carbonation, creamy/dry mouthfeel and a long finish.
Dark golden and cloucy with a frothy white head. Spicy clove and citrus aromas. Tastes of clove with a mild hop bitterness. Has citrus and some sweet honey in th taste as well.

Pours cloudy golden color with white head. Bready aroma with fruits and Unibroue yeast. Taste is sweet and spicy. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation typical of a Unibroue beer. Another quality beer from this brewery.

Dark yellow colored with hazy appearance. Huge white head. Rich spiced and yeasty aroma, some licorice and orange here also with some added sugar note, man this is good aroma. Medium bodied, surprisingly watery palate. After excellent aroma flavor is rather thin with still spices and dry hops, aftertaste turns to dry and fruity with mild alcohol.
Strong aromas, pours darker than I would have expectd from a tripel. Cloves, raisins, a little bit of bitterness trying hard to balance the rest of the stuff. Its good, just not my cup of beer.
750 ml bottle,  very hazy golden tripel with huge flavors of clove and some citrus, clove is overpowering at first but mellows as it goes down

Glad I had it but not something I would seek out again.  The thickness just isnt there - other tripels have a weight to them which I like.  This texture, though is more like liquid and less like satin.  This does help the flavors come through though: orange peel, lemon and very light raisin.

Bottle. A lasting,  white cream head over an unclear, golden brown colored body. Fresh acidulous fruity and fresh yeasty aroma with bubblegum, citrus and perfume. Taste is semi-dry crisp malts, acidulous fruits and mild spices. Good body. Clean and crisp in the mouth. Acidic-bitter end. A wonderful Tripel.

Bottle. Moderate malt notes of cookie and cereal, hop notes of perfume, flowers and lemon, yeast notes musty and mold, with white wine, bubble gum, pear and clove in the background. Head is large, frothy, white with fair lacing and is fully lasting. Color is murky yellow/tan. Flavor is slightly sweet and moderate to heavy in acidity to start, and finishes moderately acidic and lightly bitter. Palate is light to medium, oily to creamy with a fizzy carbonation. Well balanced aromas and crisp flavors and mouthfeel make this beer a very drinkable Tripel

Comes in a 750 ml bottle where I live (though I have seen it in 4-packs in Windsor).  Decent sized head with a pleasant aroma.  The taste is hard to describe, though I think I could taste apples (very similar to a cider almost) and citrus.  Excellent beer.

Bottle, kindly shared by larsga.
Very Belgian style. Fruity - grapefruit, oranges. Flowers.

Hazy golden color with a thick white head. Aroma is yeast and citrus. Its pretty highly carbonated and if feels almost like soda in on the tongue. Taste is citrus with a nice sweetness to it. No alcohol flavor even though its 9%. Cant put my finger on why, but I really like this beer.

Pours a nice hazy golden color with a thick white head, this is a highly carbonated beer! Aroma of orange and citrus with a yeasty overtone. Taste is good, lots of citrus with some other fruit flavors. Very spritzy character, with an almost fizzy sensation in your mouth. Goes down very smooth with a somewhat tart finish. Enjoyable triple.
Swirling wheat bier appearance. Clean yet wheaty volatile aroma. Taste is lemony and tart at times without any sourness. Finish is heavy malt and alcohol.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12oz shared with Brie on a sunny Sunday afternoon.  I cant believe that I havent rated this classic yet.  This is possibly the best triple to come out of North America and it is readily available here in the MA.  The spicy yeast and banana flavors are great and the finish is a little tart and refreshing.  I want a 6 pack of this and some 90 degree weather soon. Tripels and Saisons kick ass in the hot weather.

Medium white head. Hazy yellow body. Sharpish fruity spicy aroma with notes of pepper, grains of paradise, and soft metal. Sharpish fruity chalky taste with spicy notes and a touch of banana. Malty, candy notes. Nice, even if its a little sharp and dense. (0.341l bottle from some convenience store in Montreal.)

This is pretty good, but I was expecting a lot more from the makers of the wonderful Maudite.  It is faintly hazy light gold with a big, dense, long-lasting off-white head that leaves only a weak hint of lace.  The aroma is pears, a witbier-like grain and banana quality, a hitn of spie, and a meaty, winey alcohol quality.  The taste is rather smooth, warming alcoholic sweetness with a light bitterness, mostly subtle pears, winey grape, light grain and a soft witbier-hefeweizen character.  It is light, crisp while at the same time being vaguely warming, soft, and almost oily.  But, the tastes are rather subdued and it really lacks the richness or the complexity and pungent quality of something like Westmales tripel.  Its not bad at all, but I think Ill stick with something else.

Mer. This really wasnt one of my favorite beers that Ive had . .. ever. I did come from a new (to me) brewery I like the other two more than this beer. Drink the black horse over this one if you have a choice.

Pale golden with white head that disappears quickly. Nice rich wheaty, fruity (orange/lemon) aroma with hints of pepper and a strong yeast character. Very strong flavor! Doughy yeast, spices and apricot prevail in the flavor. The end is somewhat dry. Not bad!

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 355ml Bottle.  Orange-beige appearance with tight soapy head.  Lively carbonation. Powerful aromas of wheat, orange, lemon and pepper.  Sweet malt taste with lots of yeast, some cardamom.  Soft oily palate with an alcoholic finish.  Abundantly characterful.
One of my favorite tripels.  Pours an opaque golden color with a good head that persists.  The complex flavor and subtle notes are really where this brew shines.

Pours an attractive orange/golden color with beautiful white head that stayed for a while.  Aroma is of fruit and is sweet.  The flavor is sweet and fruity up front that gives way to a peppery spiciness.  Mouthfeel is good and the 9%alcohol is not evident until this beer is consumed.  A really nice beer that is meant to be savored.
UPDATED: MAR 3, 2008 Interesting aroma Tastes were bananna and cloves  Light yellow in color. A very good beer,certainly worth having again
pours a light amber with a lasting head.  Nice taste with tones of spice and yeast.  alcohol is well hidden.  carbonation is high, but feels right with this one.
This is a beautiful pour with a big white soapy head and a golden body.  Aroma is full of wheat and fruit.  Smooth drinking wheat flavors with plenty of fruit and alcohol.  What a delicious beer!
Pours a hazy orange. Good flavor, lots of spice, decently carbonated. Good beer would buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: (750 ml bottle (best before 12/21/09), cellared for 10 mos. after purchase) Pours cloudy apricot with a small white head that recedes to a thin lasting layer. Aroma of yeast, fruit, perhaps citrus. Mouthfeel is smooth and quite soft - quite nice, not sticky. Fine bottle-conditioned carbonation. Light sheets of lacing melt away quickly. Flavor is sweet and fruity with banana and a fair bit of yeast. Alcohol well-hidden. Not the most exciting tripel Ive had but nice, esp. the palate.

33cl. bottle, bottled Nov22, 2005: Slightly hazy (due to bad pouring on my part) amber with jut a slight tendency towards red. Nice thick dense (barely) off-white head. Cooked apple and raisin sauce aromas. Hops still kicking in after all that time in the bottle!... not strong but a good earthy, fruity hop note. Grilled banana with vanilla ice-cream in the background with just a slight drizzle of caramel and cardamom. There is a definite, strong, toasted grain component to the aroma that makes it feel almost gritty in the nose. A fruity yeast dusted over the top as a garnish with a light squeeze of lemon. Nice tight had lasts for a long time. Flavor... For some reason one thing comes to mind, hopped honey with a drinking problem. Ok, maybe thats not exactly right but that came to mind first. Start with a biscuit base, dip it in pear juice, drench it with honey, sprinkle some ground up earthy (almost cheesy) hops on top, roll it in some grain an serve it in bit sized chunks. I am sorry I waited so long to open this bottle, but at the same time I think the age helped develop some of these wonderful flavors. This is a style I have been somewhat bored with lately (there are a lot of uninspired tripels out there) but this is quite nice. Maybe I should get a fresh bottle to compare... but then again I may not like it. It seems to have aged really nicely. I guess the only real complaint I can give is that it could be a touch drier.

Part of the "I cant believe I havent rated it yet" run.  Hazy golden yellow, puffy white pillow of a head, nice lacing.  Nose is lemon hay malt, unibroue yeasty fruity spice.  Nothing particularly identifiable in terms of spices - a combo of cardamom, clove & coriander.  The spice grows into vanilla & malt comes through again at the end.  Flavor is lemon, hay malt, clove, cardamom, yeasty spice.  More clove & lemon/fruit in the finish.  Vaguely astringent as a result of the spice.  Wonderful body - full yet spritzy.
Bottle.  Pours deep straw, nice white head. Residual bubbles. Nose is fruit, spicy body. Clean.
2004 vintage.   Spicy aroma, yeast and fruity esters.  Flavor is full of fruit, yeast, spices, citrus, and bubble-gum. Active carbonation in the palate.  Solid tripel, but not out of this world.
This was a pretty intersting/nice Tripel. Nice and clean, lots of citrus in the nose with bubblegum, banana and cloves on the velvety push across the tongue. Nice.
Bottle:  Poured a dirty blond color with 1 inch solid white head.  Aroma is of citrus (orange/lemon).  Flavor is something to be desired.  Not my first choice and wont be having again.
Good very is this. Dry fairly still is finish the. Well as annisseed and, honey, liquorice (way good a in but) apple smith granny of bit a. Smooth really is this, Wo.

Color a brilliant orange with pale white head, taste mostly orange, too, one-dimensional really but not necessarily bad. Sweet, not bitter. Some spice. Unoriginal but passable. I have sampled this 2-3 times hoping for more but left somewhat disappointed.

Pours light orange with a large hazy, white and lasting head. Nose of yeast, cinnamon and cloves. Sweet flavour with citrus fruit and notes of coreander. slightly alcoholic finish. Medium bodied. Tasty and complex.

After the satisfying pop of the cork, Fin du Monde pours with an abundant, beautiful and snowy head.  Then is revealed a luxurious and cloudy, pale, old  gold color.  The nose reveals citrus, flaky wheat, mineral crispness, honey and booze.  Fin tastes like a honey pot (without being too sweet), and is an obvious cousin to Belgian big brothers.  The minerals continue upon sipping, revealing a solid, fairly approachable experience.  There is even something woody, forest like in the drink.  It is soft in the mouth and leaves without a hint of bitterness, a clean and satisfying finish all around.  Admittedly, Im a sucker for good beer labels, and this one got me.  I want to be at the Fin du Monde with this beer!  Delish!
Elle dégage des effluves de fleurs et de fruits. Couleur de paille, plutôt trouble et mousse beaucoup. Très goûteuse, épicée. Jai beaucoup apprécié mon expérience.

appetizing golden strawlike body w/foamy white head. Citrus and candy in the nose, the taste is sweet and whiney, but an overwhelming iron/metal taste takes control of my tounge and wont let go. The finish warms the body and the alcohol taste is not very hidden. Overall, if you like the taste of metal, go for it... i for one do not

Pours a yeasty, cloudy, straw gold, with a thick, foamy, pearly white head.  Smells of sweet Belgian candy sugar, alot of orange citrus, with a mild spice character as well.  Lovely aroma.  The flavor is pretty heavy on the carbonation, with that easily identifiable Unibroue yeast flavor.  The flavor wasnt as sweet as some of their offerings, more citrus with light candy sugar.  Mild spiciness to it, some coriander I would say.  Great drinking tripel, another rock solid offering from a pretty solid brewery.
Has a cloudy appearance, a very yeasty aroma, and a pleasant orange flavor.

light golden haze, but didnt pour the large white head that others have reported...I get cloves yeast and spices in the aroma, and theres almost a powdery aroma as well?  The flavor is bright, fruity and tart with just a hint of hoppy bitterness.  Finishes tart and alcoholic, and continues to warm for a while.  Overall, I was surprised by the bitterness that follows the fruit on the palate.  Very enjoyable and drinkable...watch out!!

Bottle labeled,"best before 05-10-10",  consumed 02/14/08.  Cork popped with a great deal of energy, ricocheting around the room!  Beer pours a golden yellow with a full, mernegue-like three finger head that slowly fades.   Lots of carbonation.  Aroma is somewhat off, with a nasty metallic tang being the dominant note.  Some yeasty spice underneath.  Metallic flavor carries over to beer.  Dreadful!  A little peppery spiciness and some lemongrass and sweetness lurked behind the relatively huge rusted metal flavor.  Some parchign dryness on the tongue.  Something must have gone wrong here, as I have had this before and it was a fine brew.  This bottle, however, is a dumper.  Until I have another to re-rate, this rating reflects this bottle.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a huge white head.  The aroma is full of cloves.  The flavor is yeasty with citrus fruits.  And the finish is nothing but dry.  It has a very nice crisp feel to it, but I just cant get myself to really dig this beer.

Pours a nice cloudy gold with a huge white head that just will not die. The aroma is mostly fruity, with banana being the most prominent.  The flavor is more intense fruit, with a overriding sweet whiney bite that I did not really enjoy. Finish is very dry. Pretty good brew, but this must not be my style.
Cloudy and orange appearance, looks like blue moon.  Large white head with a sweet fruity aroma.  Taste is initially a sharp citruis, changing to mellow honey with a dry finish.
Cloudy goldern pour, with moderate head, aroma of cloves and yeast. Bright fruity taste (citrus and banana) with spices and good balance between yeast and malt; effervesecent finish

Deep and very complex beer.  This beer has a lot of flavor to it.  It pours a deep golden color with a vigorous head.  At first sip it tastes of citrus and honey, but honestly I need to have several to try and grasp all of the flavors of this complex beer.  Good Stuff.

Pours a pale partially opaque honey color with receding white head. Aroma of a clean spice and yeast. Medium body with yeast and white grape juice flavors. A little alcohol taste with a good amount of carbonation gives it a kick. Good unique beer.
Tasty and delicious! Strong, but it makes up for it with an equally awesome flavor. Another great one from Unibroue.

750 ml bottle, poured into a Duvel tulip.  Golden in color with a billowing white head.  Nice retention and lacing.  Aromas of soft esters with a spicy zing.  Flavors of fleshy fruits like pear and apple, with some clove and pepper spiciness.  With warmth, yeast becomes a prominent note.  A bit high on carbonation, but overall quite smooth.  Alcohol is hidden under the fruitiness.  Body is medium.
Pours a cloudy orange with a white head.  Sweet malty aroma with prominent spice and orange/banana presence.  Taste is very much the same, very good overall.
Spicy nose, straw coloured with lots of carbonation.  Sweet with dry finish.  Nice drinkable ale that may catch up to bite you if one is not careful.  Goes great with spicy Thai food !
Poured from twelve ounce bottle. Hazy light orange color. Smelled like sweet wet grass and lemons. Taste was definitely a triple. Some citrus and bananas. Quite grassy with a funky yeasty finish.

Reminded me of the Grand Cru style of Belgians.  This one had thick head with many sweet citrus flavors and a Hefe color.  This brew was very rich and malty, and the alcohol was disguised well behind the breadth of flavor and light carbination.
Poured a hazy yellow color with a large white head. Sweet citrus flavor dominated the beer. Only a hint of the high alcohol content could be detected.  All in all a very good beer.

Sampled blind at "Better Know a Style: Abbey Tripel" tasting.  Clear pale color with dense white head.  Spicy orange aroma with alc, nice.  Orange flavor upfront with coriander, slight yeast spice, subdued alc.  Medium body.  With the subdued alc it seems to be more balanced and thus pleasant.

Bottle from Londis, Goring and had this last night 30-01-08   Pours murky golden and with tiny yeast floaters flying around, this stuff literally explodes from the bottle, aroma is very sweet and so is the taste like sucking on a stick of toffee initially but it gets better, alcohol is ever present but spiciness starts to show. Unfortunately the sweetness becomes a bit of an issue for me otherwise this has a lot in its favour.
Bottle at home. caramel, roasty, spruce, golden, hazy, aminimal head, light sweetness, light body, lively,

Bottle. Aroma of fruit and orange zest. Orange in appearance with a frothy white head. Yeasty beer with a strong fruit feel, a little spicy too. Sweet honey finish. Not my favourite style but not bad.

Light gold-orange colour. Fluffy white head disappears fairly quick. Aroma was a little yeasty/bready at first with strong flower/perfume aroma. Taste was fruity, a little spice with quite a sweet, alcohol warming feel to it. It was quite viscous, kind of like a fortified wine. A great beer.

Hazy orange with a white head that disappears.  Mostly sweet fruit in the nose, reminds me of what is currently marketed as strawberry/banana.  Flavor is similarly sweet with the addition of some bitter fruit, white fruit, and the slightest notion of citrus.  Palate is very interesting with some serious viscosity for the style and soft carbonation.  Finish somehow tends to dry and shows clove flavors well.

Soft citric notes in the aroma.
Soft yellow colour (very similar to a white beer).
Soft sweet flavor with lemon notes in the palate.
It is very similar to a white beer in everything but the alcohol (no alcohol notes anywhere, surprising).

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2008 750 ml bottle fro Bevmo. Pours a slightly cloudy gold color with a small white head that dissipates quickly. The aroma is strong and one sniff tells you immediately that this is a big Belgian style Tripel. Notable in the bouquet is coriander, cloves, banana and some funky yeast. The flavor is complex and rich with lightly spiced banana, biscuit, white pepper, and a grassy barnyard quality reminiscent of a saison.   The mouthfeel is full, smooth and creamy. The finish is long with lingering spices and hay. Overall: One of my favorite triples to date. Recommended.
Pours a golden color with a light head.  Sweet taste almost like anise.  Not too bad.
Pours a very light golden/amber. Large head by fades quickly. Nice spicy pepper on the nose. Very well balanced flavour, a little fizzy in the mouth.
Bottle 0,33ltr at Kandinsky, Tilburg: Hazy orange tripel from the province of Quebec, Canada. Very sweet from the fruitu taste.

750mL bottle into tulip.  Pours hazy golden with thick white head.  Aroma is spicy, yeasty, slightly fruity.  Flavor is spicy and complex, fruits, alcohol, yeast.  It is fairly full bodied, but has a dry finish.  A decent tripel.
The pour is a nice hazy straw with a lingering dense white head.  The nose is dried fruits, caramel and hints of alcohol.  The flavor is sweet, and complex as with any great Belgian style triple.

pours very pale gold, with a haze, and a nice, dense white head that lingers to the end. Aroma is all fruit, with very faint hints of white pepper. Big time tutty-fruity bubble gum! Flavor is very sweet. Sweeter than the last time I had it. I find it is missing some of the dryness and white pepper notes I enjoy in this style, and think I used to enjoy in this brand. The finish is a little cloying, and the body is a little to full for a tripel. A Belgian brewer will say it is to filling, and I would agree. Not sure why the change, this has been a great beer, and it still is good, just not as good as before.
Pours a nice golden color with a normal head. The aroma is wonderful with a strong citrus like feel. The flavor is soothing with a bit of, again, citrus and a wheat beer like effect.

aroma of fruit, malts and banana...honey color with a fizzy big white head....taste of light spice and bitter green apples....malty without a thick filling feeling...crisp finish...I keep on going back to green apples.....I LIKE IT

12 oz. bottle poured into trappist glass- poured transparent golden, medium carbonation, white head quietly bubbled away.  Aroma of yeast with malt and hops in the background.  Hits the mouth with a medium body, notes of malts and sweetness throughout, finish fades away.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Bit of a let down however.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2016 Bottle.  Sweet yeasty aroma with strong candy sugar and spice (corianderish).  Golden body with medium-strong carbonation and a large, rocky, excitable white head.  Taste is sweet and malty, dries out significantly and finishes dry and yeasty, a touch of cobweb in there but otherwise riddled by fruitiness and pervasive white pepper.  Nice floral hoppiness, really a part of the whole.  Medium body but stylish and slashing, just crisp enough to be interesting, with lots and lots of bubbles.  Well-hidden alcohol with just a subtle, slow-coming warmth.  A classy classic! [2008.01.12: 4.0]Bottled, foiled screw-top BB 01-06-19, so nice and fresh.  Nose lovely vanilla and golden, grainy-pilsy malt, some faint pseudo-oak and stronger Hefe-like yeast components.  Pour bright golden with a very large and soapy-dense cream head, bubbles and recedes and allows he aroma to fill the room -- more mineral character, lemon meringue and cream.  Taste medium-sweet (much sweeter than I prefer my tripels) with low-to-no bitterness save for the dash of minerals at the end, yeasty-creamy throughout with light alcohol and adult passive-aggressiveness (generally well-hidden, though).  Medium and very smooth body, all of the above flavors with background flits of green apple and raspberry, honey, clove, medium-strong banana and fainter spice.  As this one is much fresher than the last few, the Hefeweizen comparison seems much more apt -- sparkling and fruity with successive layers of esters and phenols, relaxing on a bed of soft malt and bright lemony-orange pillows.  Doesnt have the hops I remembered (theres a dash of purple floral here, a dash of herbal there, but all are constrained), but the added freshness and vibrancy are tremendous!  Not like others, but were better off for the difference.  [2016.11.28: 4.5]

Hazy pale yellow. Small wispy head. Soft and yeasty. I would agree with the description of it being a blonde style ale, because its a bit light for the tripel style. Yeasty bread, light banana, a bit of sour fruit. Almost reminds me of a wheat beer, due to the light graininess of it. Overall good, but not my favorite Unibroue beer.

Pours a golden honey with very little head. White lacing. Aroma is yeast, cloves and citrus fruit. Body is fairly light with flavors of yeast, apple cider and a bit of spice to finish.  It is quite smooth considering the 9 percent.

Smells a lot like champaign with some hops. Pretty looking. Murky deep yellow with a white head that has excellent lacing. Taste is okay, but a bit off in the finish (dont like, what appears to be a peppery spice/apple taste). Finish has an alcoholic touch to it. Good, but not as good as I expected.
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2010 12 oz bottle. Wow. Body is hazy, cloudy orange with stuff floating around. The aroma is minimal. The taste is great, so smooth considering the 9%. Unreal. Hid it really well.

12oz bottle.  First off, 9% ???? You cannot taste this at all!!  Wonderfully hidden by sweet citrus creamy deliciousness that leaves a coating on the back of your tongue.  This brew pwns all others.  Godlike.
Hazy golden with large off white head. Sweet aroma with orange peel, yeast and malt. Sweet malty flavor with fruity notes and spices. Ends dry with warming alcohol note.

Pours a hazy golden/yellow color into the glass with a medium-large pure white (and very bubbly) head.  Aroma is of yeast and citrus (lemon/orange/tangerine).  Flavor is dry and yeasty with many fruity flavors... a variety of citrus as well as grass, alcohol, and spice.  Easy to drink and the 9% alcohol by volume doesnt hurt either.  

1 pt. 9.4 oz bottle, caged and corked.

Mildly sweet, fruity aroma.  Murky yellow with a small white head.  Flavor a relatively straightforward yeast and apple, with a touch of spice in the end.  Surprisingly smooth and hides the 9% alcohol well.
Limit 1 per customer, more is over-kill. Good starter beer. It goes well with a light digestion.
Good looking and smelling brew.  Lots of carbonation, and feels good in the mouth.  Taste is a bit metallic.  I liked the beer, but not a favorite.

Pours an orange tinted golden with a nice foamy off white head.  Aroma is complex and fruity.   Taste is sweet and malty with fruity champagne like notes from the yeast.  Very tasty like most Unibroue beers.

Cloudy gold; nice lingering head.  Malt and sweet fruit aroma.  Ive had this beer many times over the years.  This bottle is a 2005 and quite refreshing with bread, rich amber malts, subtle cookie dough, pear and spice flavors.
(bottle) A bit on the sweet side, rather complex fruity (candy?) flavor.  Enjoyed this one very much.

sampled blind at "Better Know a Style: Abbey Tripel".pours clear golden with dense white head. nose of coriander, cloves, and mint. flavor of cloves, minty, yeasty, bland finish. med body. good carbonation. alcohol is well hidden. really spiced up tripel.

12 oz. bottle from Plaza Liquors - Pours a hazy golden color with a one and a half finger thick white head.  Light clumpy lacing.  Aroma is esters, light yeast and big spice. Flavor is much of the same.  Medium body.  A good beer.

Pours a golden color, with a 1 white foamy head, light stringy  lacing. Spicy, banana aroma, with light malts. Flavor is the same as the smell. Banana, spice, and citrus flavors. Light body, easy drinking. No lingering after taste.
user_location: Mescal Lakes (wherever that is), Arizona, USA

text: .355->Trappist: Pours a large, fizzy light whet onto a cloudy yellow body; Provides a nutty caramel aroma, citrussy-hops, some bananna, and has a heavy alcoholic taste that has some clove/spice taste to it.  When consumed, the body is medium, oily, and has an average amount of carbonation to it.  The finish is astringent, the duration average, and it is lightly sweet, acidic, and bitter.  I enjoy most all of Unibroues beers, but this one may be the least favorite for me.

330ml bottle at The Bishops Arms, Malmo, 8th Oct 2007. Hazy amber with a white head. Wonderful aroma of bramble and apple crumble but then the disappointment of the taste. I found the palate smooth but far too sickly sweet, giving the feeling of drinking a fruit cordial rather than a beer. A pity, because I love some of this brewerys beers. Overall, nice but flawed.

A fruity, pear-like aroma with spicy undertones. Slighty cloudy, straw coloured body with a decent head. Spicy, fruity flavour, with some bitterness and yeast. Pleasing on the palate. An exceptional beer.

Pours a hazy strawlike yellow with a pillowy head that dies to a nice lace. Smells of sweet fruit, yeast, clove, and tea. Tastes of spicy clove, malt, pear, tea. Feel full in the mouth with a lively tickle on the tongue from carbonation. Finishes a little dry with a touch of alcohol and a big warming effect. This is a sipper for sure and a delight to drink.
Bottle: Pours yellow with a full thick head.  Aroma of yeast.  Flavor of yeast and slight overtone of malt.  Very good.

I was surprised when I tasted this.  I had no idea what to expect.  This poured a little cloudy.  Had a sweet initial taste and then a nice malty finish.

Great Beer.

341ml bottle 
9.0% abv 
I tried this beer on December 21, 2007 at "Smokeless Joes" in Toronto.  The beer poured a murkey golden brown with a generous white head.  The aroma was a combinaion of malt and plums.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with high carbonation.  The favour was spicy, malty, and slightly bitter.

From a 12oz Bottle.  Twist off cap.  Pours a hazy, ripened banana skin yellow color with a finger of fizzy white head.  The head falls apart rather quickly, but a steady stream of bubbles keeps churning up the center of the wispy film, encouraged by the D in my Duvel glass, letting me know its still alive.  A vigorous swirl churns up a renewed serving of frothy white, but it recedes back to the prior state in a relatively short-lived time.  An earthy Belgian yeast presence makes its self known instantly, bringing out notes of shittake mushrooms, bright pepper, and a smidgen of bandaid.  A distinct, citrusy, candied orange aroma also appears, along with some herbal coriander.  As it warms, the fruit notes become more forward, as does the coriander.  Im getting a nice little squeeze of lime and gentle cardomom.  Light bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel that melts across the tongue with a soft, creamy wheatiness.  Silky palate with a touch of wheat acidity.  Some of that spicy yeast character jumps out right away, tickling the palate, and the subtle bandaid quality from the nose is still there, but only noticeable when looking for it - the pepper characters tend to dominate.  Not nearly as fruity or sweet as in the nose.  The coriander notes get a bit too strong for me in the finish, and although it results in an expceptionally dry conclusion, I find it gets a bit too herbal.  Pretty enjoyable overall, but I have a hard time getting into the yeast characters of Unibroue beers in general (this one being no exception) and the coriander flavor is too much for me.
Spicy and fruity aroma, nice thick white head, opaque golden body, medium carbonation, fruity and spicy flavor as well, although not as intense as trois pistoles, goes down smooth.
One of my favorite Belgian [-style] Ales, fruity aromas and complex sweet fruit on the palate, deceptively easy to drink..but watch out!!

Very nice beer here.  Had this bottle for a while but actually forgot about it and decided it was time.

Very cloudy, hazy pour with an insane head and I do mean insane.  Took forever to fade out.  I couldnt believe it.

Kind of a fruity sweet smell to this.  I might even detect some banana in this.  Very yeasty as well.

Good tasting tripel.  Very smooth flavor with a good amount of yeast and sweetness.  Be careful though... that 9% will put you out if you start messing with it.  

Very good beer here.  I hate I waited so long to review this but Im glad I did.
